El tiempo que tiene en  Finca, ha podido ahorrar y  comprar muchas cosas para su casa  al contado, nos dice que este año le ha ido muy bien, las dificultades que presenta Maria es en su salud por el trajín del negocio pero esta superándolas. 
Ella tiene un sueño que es tener un puesto propio pero le cuesta siete mil dólares y  necesitaría un préstamo grande y con el tiempo un motocar para ponerlo a trabajar y también le gustaría comprarse un carrito
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Bancomunal Niño Divino. She is separated and has six children, aged 33, 30, 28, 21, 18, and 17, all married except the youngest who lives at home with her and attends school. Maria works selling toys and sandals. She has worked in sales for the past 30 years: she had a stall at the hardware store but had to leave it when she separated from her husband; then she worked selling new and used books; and at one time she bought second-hand clothing to sell in provinces such as Matucana and Tornameza, outside of Chosica. Maria is applying for this 800 soles loan to buy toys and sandals to sell over the Christmas holidays. During her time in Finca, she has been able to save and buy many things for her home with cash. This year has gone well for her, although she's had health issues due to the toll of the business but she is overcoming these. Among her dreams are to have her own store (but that would require a large 7,000 dollar loan), to buy and work a motocar, and to buy a small car.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys and sandals.

loans.name: Teodora Cristina

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Teodora es conviviente tiene 46 años tiene cuatro hijos de 27, 21, y 20 años  ellos están en el extranjero y el hijo de 13 años esta en el colegio, nos cuenta que hace doce años empezó en su casa vendiendo prendas chicas como, medias, truzas  hasta que consiguió un puesto en el mercado y lo alquilo. ahora vende ropa de damas, caballero y niños.

Teodora solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para comprar mercadería en de ropa, desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser más responsable en sus pagos y en el trabajo, le gusta las reuniones por que ha aprendido cosas que no sabia y sobre todo que la ayuda en el negocio.  
Las dificultades que presento en su vida es su salud le dio hace años  un derrame cerebral y le quedan secuelas hasta el día de hoy le cuesta concentrase y  no puede ver bien 
El sueño de Teodora es tener su puesto propio, y viajar a ver a sus hijos que están en el extranjero pero tiene que trabajar mucho y ahorrar.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the “Niño Divino” (Divine Child) Community Bank. She is 46 years old, lives with her partner, and has four children. Her older children (ages 27, 21, and 20) live abroad. Her youngest son is 13 and in secondary school.

Twelve years ago, Teodora began selling small items like socks and underwear from her home. Later, she found a stall at the market and rented it. Now she sells clothing for women, men, and children.

Teodora is asking for a loan of 2000 Peruvian nuevos soles (US $650) to purchase merchandise. Since being involved with Kiva's partner FINCA, Teodora has learned to be more responsible with her payments and in her work. She enjoys FINCA's meetings, as she has learned many things she did not know. More than anything, she is grateful for their help with her business.

Teodora has faced difficulties with her health. Several years ago she had a brain hemorrhage, which continues to affect her concentration skills and her vision.

Teodora's dream is to own her own shop. She would also like to visit her children abroad. She knows that to do that she will have to work hard and save.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosario Maria

texts.es:
Rosario es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Rosario es conviviente, tiene 41 años es enfermería técnica tiene una hija de 15 años  esta en colegio estatal Cesar Vallejo.
Rosario se dedica hace tres años a las ventas empezó vendiendo ropa y también  vende por catalogo de productos de belleza como Unique, Avon, Esika 
El préstamo que solicita es de 400 soles que los va invertir en comprar productos de belleza por catalogo.
Lo que ella a aprendido desde que esta en Finca es ser responsable en el préstamo,  ha ahorra y tener capital para invertir.
Le gustaría tener una boutique y también ejercer su carrera y viajar fuera del país
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the “Niño Divino” (Divine Child) Community Bank. She is 41 years old, a nurse, and lives with her partner. She has a 15-year-old daughter who attends Cesar Vallejo High School.

For three years, Rosario has been in sales. She began by selling clothing and expanded her business to include the sale of beauty products, including Avon, Unique, and Esika. She will invest her loan of 400 Peruvian nuevos soles (US $150) in the purchase of beauty products from catalogs.

From her association with Kiva's partner FINCA, Rosario has learned to be responsible about loans and how to save in order to have capital to invest. While she would like to continue nursing, one day she would like to have a boutique. She would also like to travel outside of Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products from catalogs

loans.name: Sonia Antonieta

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Sonia es casada, tiene 33 años,  tiene dos hijos de 11y 4 años, el mayor  esta en el colegio de San Juan, Sonia empezó de niña ha trabajar vendiendo tamales, se dedica a la venta hace doce años decidió vender por diferentes mercados ella  era vendedora ambulante vendía ganchos cosméticos, lencería  etc, hasta que decidió quedarse en el mercado de Chorrillos San Genaro consiguió un puesto y lo alquilo y ha puesto un pequeño bazar nos cuenta que también paso tiempos difíciles por que la han querido desalojar  por que el terreno donde esta el puesto que el alquilan es invasión.
 
Sonia pide a Finca un préstamo de 1200 soles para comprar juguetes y venderlos en su bazar 
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banquito y la manera en que su promotora trabaja y esta contenta con los prestamos que Finca va a dar. 
Sus sueños son llegar a tener un puesto propio y tener su casa, de tres pisos  y que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Niño Divino” (Divine Child) Community Bank. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children, ages 11 and 4. The 11-year-old attends San Juan Secondary School. Sonia began working as a girl, selling tamales. Twelve years ago, she decided to become a street vendor in various markets. She sold clothes hangers, cosmetics, lingerie, etc. Later, she decided to rent a stall in the Chorrillos San Genaro market and now has a small shop there. There have been difficulties, and she has been threatened with eviction, as the land upon which her shop sits is not sanctioned. Sonia is asking Kiva's partner FINCA for a loan of 1200 Peruvian nuevos soles (US $400) to purchase toys to sell at her shop. She enjoys attending the meetings of her bank and appreciates the way the bank's staff works. She is happy with the loans that they offer. Sonia's dream is to own her own shop and to have a three-story home. She also wants her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys to sell at her shop

loans.name: Doraliza

texts.es: Doraliza tiene 29 años, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar, vive con su conviviente quien la ayuda en sus propósitos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa para niños y adultos, así como también, zapatos y otros accesorios, prendas que deja a sus clientes al crédito o al contado. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás. Doraliza trabaja muy duro con la sola intención de sacar adelante a sus hijos y desde luego crecer con su  negocio, ya que más adelante quiere tener su propia tienda. Y como lleva a vender sus prendas por los caseríos (zonas rurales de los distritos) le va muy bien, porque es la única persona que les lleva ropa por esas zonas. Comprometida a ser responsable con sus pagos, es la primera vez que trabaja en un banco comunal y con MFP, por lo que está muy entusiasmada. Con el dinero solicitado alquilará un local para implementar su tienda de ropa, también comprará más prendas para seguir con su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Doraliza is 29 years old and a mother of 3 school-going children. She lives with her significant other who supports her with her purpose. She sells clothes for children and adults as well as shoes and other accessories to clients who pay by installments or cash. She has been doing this for the past 2 years. Doraliza works very hard in order to help her children get ahead and to make her business grow as she wants to have her own store in the future. She sells her clothes in the hamlets and she does very well as she is the only person selling in these areas. She is commited to be responsible with her payments as this is the first time she works with a community bank and with MFP and therefore she is very enthusiastic. With the loan she will rent premises to set up a clothing store and she will also buy garments to go on with her daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent premises for business.

loans.name: Helen Lorena

texts.es:
Helen pertenece al Bancomunal Niño Divino
Helen es conviviente, tiene 25 años  tiene dos hijos de 8 y 3 años vive en casa de su suegra les ha dado el segundo piso para que vivan allí con su esposo, se vio en la necesidad de trabajar por que falta dinero para cubrir sus necesidades  
En Finca ella ha encontrado que le dan prestamos con menor interés y ella solicita un préstamo de 400 soles para la compra de ropa de niño y venderla ya tiene pedidos
Los sueños de Helen son le gustaría tener un puesto de ropa o tener un negocio propio, acabar de construir su casa, terminar el colegio y ser maestra de educación inicial
texts.en:
Helen belongs to the Nino Divino community bank. She is 25 years old and has two children, 8 and 3 years old, respectively. She lives in the house of her mother-in-law who has given her and her family the second floor of the house. She saw that she had to work when there wasn't enough money to cover her family's basic needs. She found that Finca provided loans at lower interest rates and is applying for a 400-soles loan to buy children's clothing that she will resell to customers who have already placed orders with her. Helen's hopes for the future are to have a shop or stand for setting up her own business, to build a house of her own, to finish school and to become a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Tania Angelica

texts.es:
Tania es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Tania es conviviente tiene 42 años y  dos hijos de 12 y 7 años ellos estudian en el colegio. Hace ocho años empezó  con un puesto de abarrotes, después  le ofrecieron un puesto en el mercado y empezó vendiendo ropa y zapatos nuevo y de segunda mano 
Viaja a provincia vendiendo sus productos, también vende en la parada y en distintos lugares, dependiendo la ocasión  
Desde que esta en Finca su economía ha mejorado, aprendido ha ahorrar ha invertir sus hijos estudian en colegio particular, su calidad de vida es mejor 
 
Tania necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para invertirlo en al compra–venta de ropa y zapato usados y nuevos 
El sueño que tiene tener mas clientes y construir cuartos en el tercer piso de su casa para alquilarlos
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Nino Divino community bank. Tania, 42, is partnered and has two school-aged children, 12 and 7. Eight years ago, she started a grocery business. Later, she got a stall in the market and began selling new and used clothing and footwear. She travels around the area selling her products, sometimes in fixed places and sometimes not, depending on the situation. Since first applying to Finca, her finances have improved, she's learned how to save and invest, her children are in a private school and her quality of life is better. Tania needs an 800-soles loan to buy used and new clothes and footwear that she will resell. Her hopes for the future are to have more customers and to build a third floor on her house that she can rent.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 5 sheets of the "Ordinaria" lottery, 5 sheets of the "Chalupa" lottery, and 5 instant lottery ticket sheets.

loans.name: Lourdes Vanessa

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Lourdes tiene 25 años es conviviente, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 5 años ellos estudian 
Es vendedora ambulante vende hace siete años comenzó vendiendo jabones.  en la avenida San Juan, con el tiempo comenzó a  vender novedades que salían y por el tiempo de campañas como: día de la madre, veintiocho de julio, navidad, etc.    

Ella necesita un prestado a Finca de 400 soles para la compra de juguetes por campaña navideña
El sueño de Lourdes es tener una tienda para la venta de sus productos y tener su casa por que vive en casa  de sus padres
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the “Niño Divino” (Divine Child) Communal Bank. Lourdes is 25 years old, has a partner, and two children ages 10 and 5 who are in school. She is a street vendor who began selling soap 7 years ago on San Juan avenue. Over time she began to sell seasonal novelties for holidays such as Mother’s Day, July 28th, Christmas, etc. She needs a loan from Finca for 400 soles to buy toys for the Christmas season. Lourdes dreams of having a store to sell her products and of having her own home because she lives in her parent’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Toys for her business

loans.name: Fiorela

texts.es: Fiorela tiene 21 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos que la ayudan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida (salchipollos: pollo frito con papas) por las noches desde hace ya un año, le gusta su trabajo porque conoce a mucha gente con quienes intercambia ideas y hace nuevas amistades, además le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona, por donde transitan muchas personas. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, comprometiéndose a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere implementarse con sillas y mesas para dar una mejor acogida y comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fiorela is 21 years old, is single, and lives with her parents and brothers who help her a lot. She works in food sales (salchipollos: fried chicken with potatoes) in the evenings for the past year. She likes her work because she meets many people with whom she exchanges ideas and forms new friendships. Moreover, it is very profitable because she is located in a good zone where many people circulate. It is the first time that she is applying for a loan with MFP and she is committed to be punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting she will use it for chairs and tables to make it more attractive and comfortable for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for her food sales business

loans.name: Zonia Maribel

texts.es:
Zonia es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino, 
Es casada tiene 38 años tres hijos  de 14, 9 y 3 años, los mayores están en la escuela, 
Zonia Empezó su negocio con el primer préstamo que Finca le otorgo, se dedica a la compra-venta de gas, primero comenzó vendiendo  tres balones de gas hace dos años, en la actualidad vende 40 balones de gas.
Desde que esta en Finca ha podido ver como su negocio crece, ha aprendido que tiene que ahorrar para seguir surgiendo.

Ella necesita un crédito de 400 soles, los va ha invertir en la compra de gas al distribuidor y también en la compra de productos de belleza
El sueño que tiene es tener su casa propia, por que vive en casa de sus padres
texts.en:
Zonia is a member of the Niño Divino communal bank. She is married, is 38 years old and has three children who are 14, 9 and 3 years old. The oldest ones are in school. Zonia started her business with the first loan that Finca granted her. She worked in the purchase and sale of gas, she first started selling three tanks of gas two years ago and currently sells 40 tanks of gas. Since she has been in Finca she has been able to see her business grow, she has learned that she has to save to continue emerging. She needs a loan of 400 soles, which she is going to invest in the purchase of gas from the distributor and also in the purchase of beauty products. Her dream is to have her own house because she lives in her parents' house.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gas from a distributor

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: La señora Flora tiene 61 años, es madre soltera, en la actualidad vive con su hijo y sus nietos a quienes ama mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y cigarrillos en las instalaciones de un recreo turístico muy reconocido en su región, esta labor la viene haciendo desde hace 5 años atrás y le gusta mucho porque conoce a mucha gente que la aprecian mucho por su buena atención y amabilidad, además este negocio le es rentable porque es la única persona que vende estos productos en este recreo. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a construir un kiosco para ya no tener que caminar por toda la zona y vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Flora is 61 years old, is a single mother, and currently lives with her son and her grandchildren who she loves a lot. She works selling sweets and cigarettes in the installations of a very recognized tourist complex in her region. She has been doing this work for the past 5 years and she likes it very much because she meets many people who appreciate her for her good attention and kindness. In addition, this business is profitable for her because she is the only person who sells these products in this complex. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has committed to make her payments in a punctual way. With the money requested she will have a kiosk built to not have to walk through the area and sell with greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for the sale of her products

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Felicita es conviviente tiene 47 años  tiene cinco hijos de 27, 25, 21, 14 y 10 los dos últimos estudian en el colegio 
Empezó hace diez años en la feria de cañete imperial viajaba constantemente y decidió poner su negocio  en pista nueva como ambulante de venta de saldos (ropa de segunda mano)

Felicita necesita un crédito de 1600 para la compra de mercadería de calzado de caballero, dama y niño 
Desde que entro en Finca le va mejor económicamente 
El  sueño de Felicita  es tener una tienda para que pueda vender sus productos  de saldos
texts.en:
Felicita is a member of the Niño Divino microfinance institute. She is a 47-year-old woman with a live-in partner and five children, ages 27, 25, 21, 14 and 10. The two youngest children attend school.

She started her business ten years ago in the street market of Cañete Imperial. She used to travel constantly, so she decided to take a new course and work as a secondhand clothing street vendor.

Felicita needs a loan of 1,600.00 PEN in order to purchase footwear for men, women and children.

Ever since she joined Finca, her financial situation has improved. She dreams of having her own store so that she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase footwear for men, women and children

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos que estudian y son sus ganas de salir adelante. El se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes de pasajeros con un motocarro desde hace 3 años atrás, sin embargo muy a aparte trabaja en una institución muy reconocida en su región, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene contacto directo con sus clientes y darles un buen trato y confianza es lo principal, nos menciona. Le es rentable, ya que él mismo es quien conduce su motocarro y es quien administra las ganancias. Es su 4to préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser una persona responsable. Con el dinero que solicita reparará su motocarro que sufre algunos desperfectos, también quiere arreglar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jorge is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three school age children, who are his motivation to get ahead in life. He has been providing public transportation services via motorcycle taxi for 3 years. He also works in a well-known establishment in his region. He states that what he likes about his job is being in direct contact with his customers and providing them with great service; trust is of the essence. His business is lucrative because he himself drives the motorcycle taxi and manages the finances. This is his 4th loan with MFP, having demonstrated that he is a responsible person. With the money that he is requesting, he will repair his motorcycle taxi, which has some defects. He also wants to repair his house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Liliana Sandra

texts.es:
O. es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino 
O. es conviviente tiene  48 años y dos hijos de 7- 4, el mayor va a la escuela 
Empezó hace siete años vendiendo golosinas a los trabajadores de un taller que su papa tenia, en la actualidad sigue en la venta de golosinas
    
Desde que esta en Finca tiene mayor capital para invertir y mayores ganarías y necesita un crédito de 1000 soles para comprar golosinas y comprar víveres para hacer tamales  que su esposo vende
Le gustaría tener mejores ingresos dar buena educación a sus hijos y tener su casa propia pues vive en casa de sus padres
texts.en:
O. is a member of the Divine child Bancomunal. O. is 48-years old and has two children ages 7 and 4 who are both in school. Seven years ago, she started selling candy to the workers in the workshop owned by her father. She eventually made it into a business.

Since she has been a member of FINCA she has had mO. capital to invest, and to earn mO. she’ll need a loan of 1000 soles to buy sweets and food to make tamales that her husband can sell. She would like to earn mO. to give her children a better education and to have their own home because they are currently living with their parents.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sweets and food to make tamales.

loans.name: Cynthia Elena

texts.es:
T. es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
T. es conviviente tiene un hijo de dos años 
Empezó hace dos años en el mercado modelo, alquilando un puesto para venta de comida 
Desde que esta en Finca ve que las cosas han mejorado para ella, tiene mas capital.

Ella necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, para comprar productos al por mayor para su restaurante 
Sueña con implementar su negocio con vitrinas, exhibidores y  tener un terreno
texts.en:
T. is a member of the Divine Child Bancomunal. T. lives with her 2-year old child. About 2-years ago, she started the Modelo market, renting a place to sell meals.

Since she has been a member of FINCA things have greatly improved for her and she has more capital. She requests a loan of 600 soles to purchase wholesale products for her restaurant. She dreams of owning her own business to implement showcases, exhibits and to have her own spot.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale products for her restaurant.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: Lucía tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos en edad escolar, vive con su conviviente quien la ayuda mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida dentro de su vivienda desde hace 5 años y medio, esta actividad la realiza durante todo el día, ya que vende desayuno, almuerzo y cena, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes la ayudan mucho, además, conoce a mucha gente, una de las razones por las que le gusta cocinar es para que las personas degusten de su buena sazón y se sientas satisfechas con su comida. Lucía cuenta con una fiel clientela desde hace mucho tiempo y por el momento no tiene dificultades, ya que su negocio marcha bien. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP y está con muchas ganas de trabajar responsablemente en su banco comunal. Con el dinero de este crédito comprará sillas, mesas y materiales de cocina para implementar cada vez mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia is 29-years old and is a mother of four children who are of school age. They live with Lucia and help her out a lot. For the last 5.5 years, Lucia has dedicated herself to selling meals from her home. This activity is an all-day affair; she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. She enjoys her job because she is supported by her children who help out a lot. Moreover, she knows many people and it’s for this reason that she enjoys cooking so that patrons can sample her style and get a feeling of satisfaction from her meals.

Lucia has a loyal client base for a long time now and for the moment she is not experiencing hard times, as business is going well. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from MFP and she’s eager to work responsibly with her community bank. With this loan she will purchase chairs, tables and cooking materials which will each be used to improve the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furniture and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy wheat, barley and other grains

loans.name: Rina

texts.es: Rina tiene 30 años, vive junto a su conviviente y su hijo que tiene 3 añitos de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su casa desde hace 2 años, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a mucha gente con quien mantiene amenas conversaciones. Durante todo este tiempo su negocio le está permitiendo fortalecer su nivel económico y el de su familia, y como trabaja con una marca muy reconocida, el consumo es asegurado. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido en ser responsable con su banco comunal y con sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a construir un pequeño local al costado de su casa para su negocio, también comprará más cajas de cerveza.
texts.en:
Rina is 30-years old and lives with her companion and her son who is 3-years old. For the last two-years, she has dedicated herself to selling beer from her home. She enjoys this line of work because she gets to meet many people with whom she can converse with.

During this time, her business has grown and so too has her family. They work with a very recognizable brand that customers trust. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from MFP, and she understands her responsibility to the community bank and her debt to pay. With this loan, she will have a small partition built from the house for her business. Rina will also purchase more crates of beer.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a small place for her business

loans.name: Maria Isabel Modesta

texts.en:
Maria Isabel is a member of the Orquideas (“Orchids”) Village Bank. She is 47 years old and married with six children. Maria Isabel runs a restaurant with her family, located in a rented space on Pasaje Caceres. The restaurant offers fixed-menu lunches as well as extra dishes. She starts working very early each morning, and works until 10pm at night. She has had this restaurant for the past five years, though she has been in the business for 20 years. 

Maria Isabel is requesting a loan of 900 soles to buy dry goods like rice, flour and sugar for her restaurant. Her goal for the future is to open a store in her home.

loans.use: Buy rice, flour and sugar

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 23 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo y sus dos hermanos. Se dedica a dar una buena atención diaria a las personas que recurren a su pequeña bodega, negocio que tiene desde hace un año. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo son las conversaciones que tiene con sus clientes y por ello conoce a mucha gente y hace nuevas amistades. Además, le es rentable debido a que es ella sola quien vende estos productos de primera necesidad dentro de su zona y le va excelente. Es su primera experiencia en un banco comunal y con un crédito con MFP. Con el dinero que ha solicitado mandará a ampliar su bodega y comprará más productos para surtirlo mejor.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 23-year-old single mother who lives with her son and her two brothers. She provides excellent customer service to the people who frequent her small general store, which she has had for a year. What she likes about her job are the conversations she has with her customers, which is why she knows a lot of people and forges new friendships. Furthermore, her business is lucrative because she is the only one who sells basic need items in the area, so her business is prospering. This is her first time dealing with a microfinance institute and with a loan from MFP. With the money that she is requesting, she will have her shop expanded and purchase more products to better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand general store and increase inventory

loans.name: Sarela

texts.es: Sarela tiene 24 años, es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, vive con su conviviente quien la ayuda en su trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado en un puesto del mercado, complementado con  productos de primera necesidad, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 5  años y lo que le gusta es dar una buena atención a sus clientes quienes son el factor principal en su negocio. Además le es rentable porque cuenta con una clientela selecta y se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar, le va muy bien. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con este dinero mandará a construir un kiosco para su puesto de venta, y así dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sarela is a 24-year-old mother with two school age children. She lives with her partner, who helps out with her business. She sells fish and basic need items in a market stand. She has been in business for 5 years, and what she likes about her job is providing excellent service to her customers, who are essential for her business. Furthermore, her business is lucrative because it is located in an optimal place and because she has a solid clientele; her business is prospering. This is the third time that she requests a loan from MFP. With this money, she will have a kiosk made so that she can better welcome her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Paulina Ayddee

texts.en:
Ayddee is a member of the Orquideas (“Orchids”) Village Bank. She is 32 years old and married with three children. Ayddee and her family own three buses, which they use for passenger transport around the city of Ayacucho. Her relatives drive the buses, and Ayddee administers the business and handles the money. She has been in this business for the past ten years. Ayddee’s husband works as a taxi driver. 

Ayddee is requesting a loan of 1800 soles for general maintenance on her buses. Her goal for the future is to build another, more comfortable home where she can open a store.

loans.use: General bus maintenance

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 60 años, es madre de 7 hijos que ya son independientes, viviendo en la actualidad con su conviviente quien la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, además de golosinas y bebidas, esto desde hace 10 años atrás en su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes y ver crecer cada día más su negocio. Y debido a que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada y concurrida tiene buenas ventas cada día. Lo difícil es enfrentar los cambios climatológicos, ya que por temporada de lluvias no vende mucho. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a ampliar su negocio, también quiere implementarse de más productos y posteriormente mejorar algunas infraestructuras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Teresa is 60 years old and has 7 children who are all independent. She lives with her partner, who supports her a great deal. She has been selling basic need items, candy and beverages for a living in her own home for 10 years. What she likes about her job is providing excellent customer service and watching her business grow more and more each day. Because her business is located in a bustling area, her daily sales are good. The difficult thing for her is dealing with changes in the weather because during the rainy season, sales dwindle. This is her first loan with MFP. With this loan, she will have her business space expanded, restock her shop with more products and later make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase amount of goods

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.es:
Perfecta es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino. Perfecta es conviviente tiene 54 años y once hijos de 38, 36, 34, 33, 30, 28, 24, 22, 20, 14 y 12 años estos dos ultimaos están en la escuela 
Su esposo le compro una careta para que venda tamales, los compraba a 0.30 céntimos y los vendía a 0.50 céntimos, actualmente sus hijos preparan  tamales les venden el sábado y domingo al lado de una panadería.

Perfecta, desde que esta en Finca sus hijos se han involucrado en el  negocio y han comprado otra carreta que la ponen  afuera un  colegio, tiene mayores ingresos  lamentablemente no cuenta con la ayuda económica de su esposo por  que le gusta tomar  y andar con mujeres, necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, para compra de gaseosa y productos para preparar tamales 
El sueño de Perfecta es empezar a vender gaseosas, marciano, gelatina, tener un terreno propio, ella vive en casa de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Perfecta is partner of the Communal Bank called Niño Divino. Perfecta is 54 years and lives with her partner and 11 children who are 38, 36, 34, 33, 30, 28, 24, 22, 20, 14 and 12-year old. The last two are still in school. Her husband bought her a vending cart so she can sell tamales. She would buy them for 0.30 cents and sell them for 0.50 cents, at present her children prepare the tamales and she sell them on Saturday and Sunday next to a baker's. Since Perfecta joined Finca (Kiva's field partner) her children have got involved in the business and now they have bought another vending cart that they park outside a school. She has a bigger income but unfortunately she doesn't have the financial support of her husband who likes to drink and go out with other women. She needs a loan of 400 suns ($400) to buy soda drinks and food products to prepare the tamales. Her dream is to start selling sodas, shaved ice treats, jelly and one day have her own lot, she lives in house of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soda drinks and products to prepare tamales.

loans.name: Rubi Maribel

texts.es:
Rubí es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría. Rubí es de Chiclayana es conviviente tiene 37 años,  tiene cinco hijos de 16, 12, 9, 4 años y el último de 1 mes, vive hace 8 años  en Villa Maria están en el colegio estatal Estela Daris.
Rubí empezó en los negocios, hace seis años  en las reuniones familiares y las reuniones  con sus vecinos le decían que cocinaban  muy rico, que por que no cocinaba  para vender, entonces  empezó hacer polladas cada quince días preparaba 100 polladas  y también empezó hacer cevichadas  cada quince días por un buen tiempo ahora hace un año ha empezado a  repartir menú  en el grifo Guesa de Villa Maria que es donde trabaja su esposo, diario reparte 20 menús. 

Rubí solicita un préstamo de S/ 600.00 que lo va invertir en comprar víveres para su negocio de comida menú. Rubí le gusta las reuniones del Banquito ella ve que todo es legal, transparente,  que son unidas, les enseñan que deben a ahorrar y siempre les dan recomendaciones   
Rubí  nos cuenta que antes tenía que prestarse dinero de otras personas que le cobraban altos intereses ahora que esta en Finca esta mejor y más tranquila 
Rubí tiene un sueño que es ser prosperada y tener un pequeño restaurante y ayudar a su familia
texts.en:
Ruby is a partner of Communal Bank called Perlas de la Sabiduria. Ruby is from Chiclayana, and she lives with her partner. She is 37 years old and she has five children who are 16, 12, 9, and 4 years old and the youngest who is 1 month old. She has lived in Villa Maria for 8 years, and her children are in the state school Estela Daris. Ruby started her business six years ago when in family meetings and parties with her neighbors, people were telling her that she was a really good cook and that she should cook to sell. For a while she started to sell grilled chicken every two weeks and she was making 100 chikens and also she began to do Ceviche every two weeks as well. A year ago she started distributing prepared meals at the gas station Guesa de Villa Maria where her husband works. She sells 20 meals every day. Ruby is requesting a loan of 600.00 soles ($200) that she will invest in buying food supplies for her business of prepared meals. Ruby likes her bank meetings, where she can see everything is legal and transparent. They are taught they have to save and they always give them recommendations. Ruby tells us that before she had to borrow money from other people who were asking her for high interests; now that Finca (Kiva's field partner) is here she is doing better. Her dream is to prosper and have a small restaurant and to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food supplies for her meals business

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría 
Rosa es soltera  tiene 19 años, ha terminado de estudiar su quinto de segundaria, pero no puede seguir estudios superiores por falta de dinero, por ahora quiere ayudar económicamente  a su familia  
Rosa trabajaba en un jugueria en la cual tuvo problemas y  se queda sin trabajo   una amiga la animo a que venda productos de belleza por catalogo Avon desde entonces se dedica hace un año a la venta de productos por catalogo.

Rosa solicita un préstamo de  600 soles para invertirlos en comprar productos en oferta y tener un stock, para después venderlos a precio normal
En Finca ha aprendido administrar su dinero a saber cuando invertir, le gusta las charlas que recibe en su Banquito, esta contenta por se preocupan por ella  
Rosa nos cuenta que ha presentado dificultades en las ventas por que hay personas que no le han pagado pero lo ha podido súperar gracias a los ahorros que tenia.
Rosa tiene un sueño quiere ser gerente zonal de ventas por catalogo en  Avon en Tablada de Turín  y le gustaría estudia mas adelante cosmetología
texts.en:
Rose is a partner of the Communal Bank called Perlas de la Sabiduría. Rose is single and she is 19 years old. She finished the fifth year of secondary school, but she can't continue her studies for lack of money. For the time being she wants to help her family economically. Rose used to work in a toy shop where she had some problems and she was left without work. A fried encouraged her to sell "Avon" beauty products and she has been selling this products for a year. Rose is requesting a loan of 600 soles ($200) to invest in buying products on sale and be able to have a stock and later to sell them at a regular price. In Finca (Kiva's field partner), she he has learned to administer her money and to know when to invest it. She likes the seminars he gets from her bank. She is happy because they worry about her. She tells us that she has had some problems with the sales because there are some people who haven't paid her, but she has been able to overcome this thanks to the savings she had. Her dream is to become the area manager of the Avon catalogue sales in Tablada de Turin and she would like study cosmetology later.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products on sale to have a stock and later sell them at a regular price.

loans.name: Jenifer Milagros

texts.es:
Jennifer es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría 
Jennifer tiene 28 años es separada tiene cuatro hijos de 13, 9, 8, y 3 años sus hijos están en la escuela estatal José Maria Arguedas.  
Jennifer ha trabajado en una imprenta, después  trabajo para una fabrica vendiendo puerta por puerta mermelada, también vendiendo  ropa en un puesto en el mercado, siempre trabajando para otros pero desde noviembre del 2008 ella decidió ser  independiente y con la llegada de la navidad ella decidió empezar a vender juguetes, luces navideñas a sus amigas, vecinos  y conocidos gracias a Dios ya tiene realizada varias ventas 
Jennifer solicita un préstamo de 400 soles para la comprar mercadería de juguetes para la campaña navideña 
Jennifer encuentra en  Finca mucha ayuda y orientación para su negocio.
Los sueños que tiene Jennifer son incrementar sus ingresos, y comprar una maquina de coser a hacer polos, ha ella le gustaría tener su taller de costura                                                                                                                               
Jennifer ha pasado por situación muy difícil en su vida cuando salio en estado de su cuarta hija  su pareja la abandono, quedando ella emocionalmente 
dañada recibió ayuda de psicólogos y personas que le hablaron de Dios
texts.en:
Jennifer is a partner of the communal bank called Perlas de la Sabiduría. Jennifer is 28 years old, who is separated and has four children who are 13, 9, 8, and 3 years old. Her children are attending the state school José Maria Arguedas. Jennifer worked in a printing shop, later she worked for a factory selling marmalade on the street and she has also worked selling clothes in a stand at the market. She has always worked for others but in November, 2008 she decided to be independent and with the arrival of Christmas, she decided to start selling toys, and Christmas lights to her friends, neighbors and acquaintances. Thanks to God, she has already made several sales. Jennifer is requesting a loan of 400 soles ($150) to buy merchandise like toys for the Christmas season. Jennifer has found in Finca (Kiva's field partner) a lot of help and orientation for her business. Her dream is to increase her income, and to buy a sewing machine to make sweaters. She would like to have her own workshop. Jennifer has gone through a very difficult situation. When she became pregnant of her fourth daughter, her partner left her. She was in a really bad emotional state and had to get help.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Toys for her business

loans.name: Hercilia Vicenta

texts.es:
Herlicia pertenece al Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría
Herlicia es de Ancash tiene 36 años, es conviviente tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 8, y 5 años  todos su hijos estudian en el colegio estatal José Maria Arguedas, su casita es de madera  
Herlicia empezó hace un año a vender ceviche en al puerta de su casa, fue animada por sus vecinos, ella vive frente a una loza deportiva y siempre hay campeonatos y después de cada campeonato  la gente quería consumir y tomar algo. Así que Herlicia se puso en marcha, ella esta contenta por que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.

Herlicia  solicita un préstamo de 400 soles para comprar un Kiosquito y vender golosinas  
Le gusta las reuniones de Finca he recibido orientación, y ella ha visto que se preocupan unas por otras, que  son solidarias  
Las dificultades que tiene son que le falta capital para comprar lo que los clientes le piden, gaseosas, cervezas. 
Su sueño es comprar un kioskito para realizar sus ventas
texts.en:
Herlicia belongs to the Pearls of Wisdom Community Bank. She is from Ancash and is 36 years old. She lives in a small wooden house with her common-law husband and has four children, ages 12, 10, 8 and 5, all of whom study at the state-run José Maria Arguedas School. A year ago Herlicia began selling ceviche, a popular regional dish made with fish and lime, in front of her home, and she was encouraged by her neighbors. She lives in front of sports fields and there are always games going on, and after every game the people want something to eat and drink. This is where Herlicia put her business plan into action, and she is very satisfied because she can count on the support of her husband. She is requesting a loan of 400 soles (approximately $150) to purchase a small kiosk to sell her snacks. She enjoys her meetings with Kiva partner Finca, has received her orientation and has seen how others worry about the well-being of their fellow man. The problems she has faced have been from a lack of capital to meet her customers' demands for drinks, beers, etc. Her dream is to purchase a kiosk so she can carry out her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a kiosk where she can sell her treats

loans.name: Luz Marleny

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría 
Luz tiene 48 años es conviviente tiene diez hijos de 29, 28, 25, 23, 22, 18, 15, 13, 12,  y 9 años los mayores trabajan y últimos están en la escuela, su esposó también trabaja, ella empezó vendiendo mazamorra en la puerta de su casa, después se puso a vender espinazos de pollo frito por mucho tiempo, pero lo dejo por que había mucha competencia y ya no le salía a cuenta entonces empezó ayudar a una amiga a vender productos de belleza por catalogo Avon ahora es vendedora directa ya tiene vendiendo los productos tres años le esta yendo  bien pero necesita capital

Luz solicita 400 soles para invertirlos en compra de productos de belleza Avon. Para estas fiestas navideñas. El sueño de Luz es tener un negocio propio de Ropa interior
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Pearls of Wisdom Community Bank. She is 48 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has 10 children, ages 29, 28, 25, 23, 22, 18, 15, 13, 12 and 9. The eldest ones work and the younger ones are still in school. Her husband also works. She started out selling mazamorra, a popular regional dish made with corn, in front of her home and later offered skewers of fried chicken for a long time, but she stopped because there was a lot of competition in the area and it wasn't going as well as she had hoped, so she started helping a friend sell beauty products out of the Avon catalog. Now she is a direct sales representative and has been selling products for three years. It is going well but she needs capital. Luz is requesting 400 soles (approximately $150) to invest in the purchase of Avon beauty supplies to be prepared for the holiday season. Her dream is to have her own underwear business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies

loans.name: Nelvina

texts.es:
Nelvina  es socia del Bancomunal Perlas D. la Sabiduría
Es casada tiene 41 años,  cuatro hijos D. 24, 22, 12 y 7 años los dos últimos están en la escuela.
Ella venD. comida desD. hace tres años y en el tiempo D. colegio venD. golosinas 
Necesita un préstamo D. 400 soles para invertirlos en  la compra D. adornos D. naviD.ños.
El sueño D. Nelvina es tener su restaurante en su casa y que su esposo tenga su carro propio, por que él  trabaja como chofer
texts.en:
Nelvina is a member of the Pearls of Wisdom Community Bank. She is 41 years old, married and has four children, ages 24, 22, 12 and 7, the youngest two of whom are still in school. She has sold food for the past three years and during the school season she sells snacks. She is requesting a loan of 400 soles ($150) to invest in the purchase of Christmas ornaments. Nelvina's dream is to have a restaurant in her home and for her husband, who works as a driver, to have his own car.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Christmas ornaments

loans.name: Bilma

texts.es:
Bilma es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría
Bilma es viuda tiene 55 años, siete hijos de 36 hasta 16 años esta en la  escuela 
Empezó vendiendo tamales  en el norte y ahora que esta en Lima también se dedica a las ventas de tamales
Bilma necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para ampliar su negocio y comprar mas ingredientes para hacer sus tamales y  llevar a otras zonas. 
Los sueños de Bilma son tener su carrito sanwichero y que sus hijos tengan buen trabajo
texts.en:
Bilma is a member of the “Perlas de la Sabiduría” (Pearls of Wisdom) Communal Bank. Bilma is 55 years old with 7 children ages 36 to a 16 year old still in school. She began selling tamales in the north and now that she is in Lima she continues to sell tamales here. Bilma needs a loan for 800 soles to expand her business and buy more ingredients to make her tamales and take them to sell in other areas. Bilma dreams of having a sandwich cart and that her children have good work.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría
Ana es conviviente tiene 41 años, tiene cinco hijos los de 24 y 20 estudian en un instituto superior, el de 13 años esta en el colegio y los de  2 y 4 años  en casa 
Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace dos años también vende ropa, su hijo mayor se fue al norte a estudiar, y le tiene que enviar cada mes dinero para sus estudios, también ella manda al norte videos para que su hijo los venda.
El estar en Finca le ha ayudado a especializarse en las ventas y como llevar su negocio, sobre todo ve un crecimiento.

Necesita un préstamo de 800 que va invertir en la compra de ropa para la campaña navideña
Los sueños de Ana son poner una tienda en su casa  que este bien surtida, que sus hijos sean profesionales, tengan un  buen trabajo, tener una casa propia
Manda videos al norte para venta
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “Perlas de la Sabiduría” (Pearls of Wisdom) Communal Bank. Ana is 41 years old, has a partner, and five children. The children ages 24 and 20 study in college, the 13 year old is in school and the 2 and 4 year olds are at home. She has been selling cosmetics for 2 years and she also sells clothing. Her oldest child went north to study, and she has to send him money every month for his schooling. She also sends videos north for her son to sell. Being a member of Finca has helped her focus on sales and learn how to run her business, and above all experience growth. She needs a loan for 800 soles to invest in the purchase of clothing for the Christmas season. Ana dreams of opening a well-stocked store in her home, that her children become professionals, that they have good work, and that she has her own home. She sends videos north to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal  Perlas de Sabiduría 
Maria es casada tiene 36 años, dos hijos de 18 y 13 años ambos estudian 
Empezó hace cuatro años vendiendo truzas, medias, ahora vende cosméticos y en tiempo de colegio vende útiles para el colegio, venta choco-tejas
Desde que esta en Finca tiene mayor capital ayuda a su esposo con los gastos y a su hija con sus estudios.

Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para invertirlos en la compra de ropa 
El sueño que tiene Maria es tener su tienda de ropa bien surtida y que sea propia.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Perlas de la Sabiduría” (Pearls of Wisdom) Communal Bank. Maria is 36 years old, married, and has two children ages 18 and 13 who are in school. Four years ago she began selling underwear and socks, today she sells cosmetics and when schools is in she sells school supplies and chocolates. Since she has been with Finca she has greater capital to help her husband with the expenses and her daughter with her studies. She needs a loan for 800 soles to invest in the purchase of clothing. Ana dreams of opening a well-stocked store of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es socio del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduriíta 
Julio tiene 28 años es conviviente tiene un hijo de 2 años 
Él empezó alquilando una moto-taxi luego se compro una al crédito ya termino de pagarlo hace tres meses

necesita un crédito de 600 soles para invertirlo en mantenimiento de sus moto-taxi y comprar el  SOAT
Julio vive en casa alquilada y su sueño es tener casa propia
texts.en:
Julio is a member of the “Perlas de la Sabiduría” (Pearls of Wisdom) Communal Bank. Julio is 28 years old, has a partner and a two year old son. He began renting a motor-taxi and then bought one on credit which he paid off three months ago. He needs a loan for 600 soles to invest in the maintenance of his motor-taxi and buy a SOAT. Julio lives in a rented house and dreams of having his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her motor-taxi

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy suppies for poultyr farming

loans.name: Walter Guillermo

texts.es:
Walter es socio del Bancomunal Pelas de la Sabiduría
Walter es conviviente tiene 42 años  tres hijos de 22,18, y 8 años este ultimo esta en el colegio 
Empezó hace ocho años trabajando  con su moto-car, así fue creciendo aparte trabaja con su esposa en la panadería y  actualmente trabaja de día en la moto, tiene tres motos-car. 

Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, los va invertir en la compra de Soat  para su moto, y repuesto para la moto y cambio de tarjeta de propiedad
El sueño de Walter es tener su panadería, esta construyendo el primer piso de su casa para panadería y el segundo piso lo va hacer vivienda
texts.en:
Walter is a member of the Pearls of Wisdom Community Bank. He is 42 years old, lives with his common-law wife and has three children, ages 22, 28 and 8, the youngest of whom is still in school. He started worked with his motor-coach eight years ago and grew the business as well as working with his wife at a bakery. Currently he focuses his efforts on his transportation business and has three motor-coaches in his fleet. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $325), which he plans to invest in the purchase of safety devices and spare parts for his motor-coaches as well as change the registration. Walter's dream is to have his own bakery. He is building the first floor of his home for a bakery and the second floor will be the living area.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase safety devicies and spare parts for his motor-coaches

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Norme es socia del Bancomunal San Juan.  Norma tiene 42 años vive en casa de sus padres con su esposo,  es profesora de primaria tiene tres hijos de 14,13 y 4 años están en el colegio estatal, a Norma le gusta hacer manualidades empezó hacer adornos  con madera de tulipán  aproximadamente hace dos años y los vende en los colegios a los profesores, también realiza trabajos de enchapado de puertas  como reposteros de cocina, roperos etc, su negocio funciona en su casa y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo de la empresa Unique.
Ha pasado momentos difíciles le atropello una moto golpeando su brazo derecho estuvo por quince días en reposo. No pudo salir a trabajar

Norma pide un préstamo a Finca de 1200  para comprar materiales para enchapar puertas y hacer sus adornos en madera de tulipán, esta contenta por que recibe orientación de cómo llevar su negocio, 
Los sueños que le gustaría realizar son tener su casa propia, tener una librería bazar y llegar hacer directora de  venta por catalogo de Unique
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the San Juan cooperative bank, 42 years old, and lives in her parents’ house with her husband. She is a primary school teacher and has three children ages 14, 13 and 4 who are in public school. Norma enjoys making handcrafted items, having started out two years ago making decorations from tulip wood. She sells these at schools to the teachers, and she also makes wood veneer doors such as those for kitchen confectioners, wardrobes, etc. Her business is run out of her house, and she also dedicates herself to selling Unique brand beauty products by catalog. She has had some difficult times, particularly when she was hit by a car which injured her right arm and forced her to be on bed rest for fifteen days. She was not able to work during this time. Norma requests a loan from Finca of 1,200.00 Peruvian soles, with which she will purchase materials for making her doors and decorations. She is glad to be receiving orientations on how to best run her enterprise. Her dreams are to own her own home, to have a bookstore/bazaar, and to become a director of Unique brand product sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for making wood veneer doors.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Maria es casada tiene 48 años dos hijos de 19 y 10 años uno se prepara para ingresar a la universidad y el otro esta en el colegio, incursiono en los negocios con su esposo haciendo bolsas de plástico durante  5 años  después lo dejaron por que su esposo entro a trabajar a un taller de carpintería donde aprendió hacer puertas, después de un tiempo  decido independizarse y hacer  en el techo de su casa un taller, Maria y su esposo trabajan en el taller haciendo puertas y las venden en la parada.

Maria solicita un préstamo de Finca de 3000 soles, para la compra de madera, tripley y cola, las dificultades que presenta es que su taller esta en la parte posterior de la casa, lo que impide que la mercadería se exhiba hacia la calle  y los clientes la puedan apreciar 
El sueño de Maria y su esposo es tener su taller en un primer piso con vista  a la calle  y vender directamente  sin intermediarios.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the San Juan Community Bank. Maria is aged 48 and married with two sons, one of whom is preparing to start university; the other is at school. She entered into business with her husband making plastic bags for 5 years: they then stopped doing this because her husband started work in a carpentry workshop where he learnt to make doors. After a time he decided to establish himself independently and to set up a workshop on their roof. Maria and her husband work in the workshop making doors and selling them in the street markets. Maria is asking for a loan from Finca of 3000 soles, in order to buy wood, varnish and glue. One of the difficulties is that the workshop is in the back-half of the house which prevents them showing their merchandise on the street where potential customers could see it. The dream of Maria and her husband is to have a workshop on the first floor with a view onto the street and to sell directly without intermediaries.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, varnish, glue

loans.name: Rosa Susana

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal San Juan,  es casada tiene 51 años tres hijos de 24, 20, y 16 el mayor trabajo y los dos últimos estudian. 
La historia de Rosa empezó cuando ella estaba estudiando en el colegio La Inmaculada allí  estudio repostería y aprendió hacer dulces como alfajores  los cuales  salían a vender a los salones hasta que un buen día el administrador del colegio le dice  para poner un cafetín y ella acepto,  empezó a trabajar con su mama, después que acaba de estudiar en el colegio Rosa decidió especializarse en repostería, aprendió hacer tortas de matrimonio, quince años, bocaditos  pastelería fina. Rosa tiene 20 años trabajando en el cafetín del que era su colegio

Rosa solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de mercadería para surtir su cafetería
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió como se lleva un negocio, y esta muy contenta.
El sueño de Rosa es tener su propio local y poner una restaurante  dulcería
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the San Juan Community Bank. She is aged 51, married with three children aged 24, 20 and 16. The eldest works and the younger two are still studying. Rosa's story began when she was studying at La Inmaculada college. There she studied baking and learnt how to make such as "alfajores" (caramel-filled cookies) which she sold in the bars until one good day the College administrator asked her to set-up a cafeteria and she accepted. She began to work with her mother, and after she had finished studying in college Rosa decided to specialise in confectionery: she learnt how to make cakes for weddings and quinceañeros, and other fine pastries. Rosa has worked for 20 years in the cafeteria of her old college: Rosa is asking for a loan of 2000 soles in order to buy merchandise to stock up her cafeteria. Since she has joined with Finca she has learnt how to run a business, and she is very happy. Rosa's dream is to have her own premises and set-up her own cafe and cake shop.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her cafeteria

loans.name: Juana Tarcila

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal de San Juan,  es casada tiene 58 años, ella llega a estudiar en la universidad biología pero no termino por falta de dinero tuvo que dejar los estudios, tiene un hijo de 25 años estudiando arquitectura en la universidad  
Juana se dedica a la venta de comida criolla y arequipeña su pequeño restauran se llama “ Ña Juanita” nos cuenta que siempre le gustaba cocinar empezó cocinando por ayudar a la economía en su casa es así que ella descubrió su talento en la cocina  empezó cocinando en reuniones familiares  los domingos en su casa, cada domingo la familia venia con amigos es así como fue creciendo su clientela así estuvo por espacio de dos años, hasta que decidió abrir las puertas de su casa al publico hace dos años  atrás

Juana nos cuenta que el año pasado su negocio se quemo y ella casi pierde la vida y gracias a Dios pudo nuevamente abrir su restaurante de comida criolla y arequipeña    
Juana solicita un préstamo a Finca de 1000 en la compra de víveres para su restauran. Juana aprendió en Finca como administrar su negocio y su dinero, también aprendió estrategias para enfrentar a la competencia 
El sueño de Juana es terminar de construir su primer piso de su casa para ampliar su negocio y vivir en el segundo piso
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the San Juan community Bank. She is aged 58, married and started studying biology at university but she didn't finish due to a lack of funding which meant she had to leave her studies. She has a 25 year old son studying architecture at University. Juana sells regional food from Arequipa in her small restaurant called " Ña Juanita”. She tells us that she has always liked to cook and first began in order to help with the household expenses. This was how she discovered her talent in the kitchen. She began cooking for Sunday family gatherings in her house, as every Sunday the family would come with friends and in this way her customer-base grew for two years, until she decided to open the doors of her house to the public two years ago. Juana tells us that last year her business burnt down and she almost lost her life but thanks to God she was able to reopen her local food restaurant. Juana is asking for a loan of 1000 soles from Finca in order to buy provisions for her restaurant. Juana has learnt from Finca how to manage her business and her money and she has also learnt strategies for dealing with the competition. Juana's dream is to finish constructing the first floor of her house in order to expand her business and live on the second floor.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provisions for her restaurant

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es socia del Bancomunal tiene 52 años, es separada tiene tres hijos de 32, 30, y 21 años están casados y trabajan, Judith nos cuenta que cuando se separo de su esposo empezó  a trabajar de niñera por cinco años después empezó a vender cerveza en la puerta de su casa por cuatro años, ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y venta por catalogo de productos de belleza.
 
Necesita un préstamo de Finca de 1000 soles para compra de mercadería de ropa interior y productos de belleza, le gusta las reuniones de Finca por que son unidas, le gusta las charlas que se dan  ha aprendido a invertirlo, el sueño que tiene es tener su puesto propio de ropa interior
texts.en:
Judith is a member of Bancomunal and is 52 years old. She is separated from her husband and has three children, ages 21, 30 and 32, who are married and have jobs. Judith tells us that when she separated from her husband, she began work as a nanny, but five years later started selling beer from her home and did so for four years. Now she sells undergarments and has gone into catalog sales of beauty products. Judith needs a loan from Finca of $325 (1000 nuevos soles) to purchase merchandise, undergarments and beauty products. She likes the training sessions that Finca conducts, because they are like a close-knit family, and the talks given because she has learnt to invest. Her dream is to have her own stall from which to sell undergarments.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise--undergarments and beauty products

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es socia del Bancomunal San Juan, Consuelo es soltera tiene dos hijos de 28 y 16 años la ultima esta en el colegio  ella se dedica hace 20 años a la venta de golosinas, gaseosa, cerveza, cigarro tiene un kiosco en la puerta de su casa  su mama le ayuda en su negocio, también hace ocho años ella tiene una micro empresa de tejido con varias amigas se llama “Manos Maravillosas” donde hacen tejidos de poncho carteras etc, hacen a pedido.

Nos cuenta que desde que esta in Finca tiene una visión mas clara de su negocio y le gusta por que hay unión entre las socias amistad y armonía los prestamos que Finca le da han ayudado a que su  negocio crezca.
Consuelo solicita un préstamo de 400.00 soles para surtir su Kiosco  con mercadera
El suelo de Consuelo es poner un puesto en el mercado de venta de pasamanería  y remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the San Juan cooperative bank. She is single, and has two children ages 28 and 16; her youngest daughter is in school. For the past twenty years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of candy, sodas, beer, and cigars. She has a kiosk in the doorway of her house, and her mother helps her out with the business. Also, eight years ago she started a small knitting business with several friends which is called “Marvelous Hands” where they knit ponchos, purses, etc., or items on order. She tells us that since she’s become involved with Finca, she has a clearer vision for her business and she values the friendly and harmonious relationships with the other members. The loans Finca has provided have helped her to grow her business. Consuelo requests a loan of 400.00 Peruvian soles to supply her kiosk with wood. Consuelo’s dreams are to install a location at the market in Pasamanería and to renovate her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her kiosk.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee  es socia del Bancomunal San Juan 
Haydee es casada  tiene 35 años, dos hijos de 10 y 13 años están en la escuela. Ella tiene un negocio de cabinas de Internet que se llama C & S Carmen Y Stephany hace dos años empezó con dos maquinas ahora tiene diez maquinas y un control con lo que maneja todo, también da servicio de impresiones, scaneos, fotocopiadora y otros 
En Finca se siente contenta por que ha podido logra muchas metas, invertir y los intereses son bajos   
Necesita un préstamo de 800.00 soles para implementar su negocio de cabina de Internet 
El sueño que tiene es abrir un locutorio e implementar su casa
texts.en:
Haydee is a partner of the San Juan Community Bank. She is 35 years old and married, with two children. Her children are ages 10 and 13, and both of them attend school. Haydee owns an internet cafe called C & S Carmen Y Stephany. She started two years ago with two computers and now she has ten, as well as a system to manage all of them. Haydee also has a printer, scanner, photocopier, and other equipment. She is happy with Finca because she's been able to achieve many of her goals, she's able to invest, and the interest rates are low. Haydee needs a loan of 800.00 soles to implement her internet cafe business. Her dream is to open an international calling center in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Implement her internet cafe business

loans.name: Erlinda Magda

texts.es:
Erlinda es socia del Bancomunal San Juan. Erlinda  es casada tiene 42 años, tiene tres hijos de 16, 6, y 3 años, sus hijos están en la escuela    
Erlinda se inicio hace catorce años haciendo bocaditos en su casa al principio compraba los ingredientes por kilos por falta de capital, ahora compra al por mayor y gana más. También tiene un auto que lo alquila es una entrada mas   
Desde que esta en Finca es más independiente no tiene que andar prestándose dinero de su esposo  
Ella  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles que los va a invertir en el negocio de compra y venta de carros
El sueño es poner una panadería, pastelería esta buscando un local
texts.en:
Erlinda is a partner of the Community Bank of San Juan. She is 42 years old and married. Her three children are 16, 6, and 3 years old, and all of them are in school. Erlinda started making snacks in her home 14 years ago. At first she bought her ingredients by the kilo because she lacked capital, but now she is able to buy in larger quantities and save money. Erlinda also has a car that she rents, which provides extra income. Since she joined Finca, Erlinda has been more independent and she doesn't have to loan money from her husband. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the business of buying and selling cars. She dreams of starting a bakery, and is presently looking for a location.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business of buying and selling cars.

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal San Juan 
Juana es conviviente, tiene 41 años. Ella tiene una casa propia y por la crisis económica que pasaba decidió alquilar la parte de delante de su casa para tienda y dos habitaciones
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles quiere acabar de construir la habitación que va alquilar  y comprar un stock de productos de belleza de Avon   
Su sueño es remodelar las habitaciones para seguir alquilando
texts.en:
Juana is a partner in the Community Bank of San Juan. Juana is 41 years old and lives with her partner. She has her own home and because of the recent economic crisis she decided to rent the front rooms of her home as a store and two bedrooms. Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles so that she can finish construction on the room that she'd like to rent. She'll also use the money to buy a stock of Avon beauty products. Her dream is to remodel the rooms to continue renting them.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock beauty products.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es socio del Bancomunal San Juan
Gustavo es casado tiene 66 años, dos hijos  mayores de 37 y 35 años están casados  
Tiene una tienda empezó vendiendo galletas, gaseosas ahora vende cervezas y quiere invertir en abarrotes 
Él necesita un crédito de 800 los va invertir en la compra de gaseosas, cervezas y comprar alambre de púas para cercar su terreno que tiene Cajamarca 
El sueño de Gustavo es ser distribuidor al por mayor de cerveza  y gaseosa
texts.en:
Gustavo is a member of the community bank San Juan. He is married and is 66 years old. His two eldest children are 37 and 35 and they are both married. He has begun a store where he sells cookies and soda pop. Now he sells beers and he wants to invest in groceries. He needs a loan of 800 that he would invest in the purchase of soda pop, beer, and buying barbed wire to encircle his land. Gustavo’s dream is to be the best distributor of beer and soda pop.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soda pop and beer

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Betty es separada tiene 53 años, dos hijos de 31 y 18 años, el mayor esta casado y él ultima estudia en la universidad. Betty tiene un negocio de cabina de locutorio empego alquilando el teléfono de su casa a sus vecinos luego puso tres cabinas de locutorio 
Desde que comenzó en Finca tiene Seguridad de pertenecer por que puede seguir solicitando prestamos, le gusta los momentos de amistad en las reuniones 
Ella necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para el  pago de  computadoras     
El sueño es tener un centro de computo e investigación.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the community bank San Juan. She is separated and is 53 years old. She has two children, of 31 and 18 years of age. The eldest is married and the other is studying in university. Betty has a business of telephone booths, where she rents the telephone in her house to her neighbours, and has recently put in three telephone booths. Since she began with Finca, she has had the certainty of belonging, and so she is able to continue asking for loans. She likes the friendly moments in the meetings. She needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to pay for computers. Her dream is to have a computer and communications center.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for computers

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo Hugo de 28 años, quien es carpintero y con su hija Jennifer de 2 años de edad. Ella es una joven y dedicada madre que para hacer que su familia salga adelante abrió una carpintería, donde trabaja su esposo fabricando muebles para que luego ella los venda, aunque también ayuda en el trabajo de elaborar los muebles. Lo que le gusta a Marleny de su trabajo es que puede realizarlo al lado de su esposo y así ser una sola fuerza en común para sacar adelante a su pequeña Jennifer. Marleny quiere que su pequeña hija tenga buenas armas, como una buena educación, para afrontar el futuro, es por eso que necesita mejor estabilidad económica para ofrecerle a ella lo mejor. Este es sétimo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de madera para elaborar más muebles, así aumentar la producción y por ende, sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marleny is 25 years old. She lives with her husband Hugo, who is 28 years old and is a carpenter, and with her daughter Jennifer, who is 2 years old. She is a young and dedicated mother who, since she wanted her family to improve their lives, has opened a carpentry shop. She works there with her husband making furniture that she later sells, and she also helps in the work of making the furniture. What Marleny likes about this work is that she is able to be at the side of her husband and so be a single, common force improving the life of little Jennifer. Marleny wants her small daughter to be well armed for the future with a good education. This is why they need better economic stability to offer Jennifer the best. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very punctual with her repayments. With the money she is asking for, she would by a better quantity of wood in order to make more furniture, and so augment production and through this, her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Carmen  es casada tiene  44 años, tiene una hija de 17 años que estudia
Tiene un negocio de bazar de regalos, dulces empezaron hace seis meses en el mercado de Pamplona  invirtió 5.000 soles y ha duplicado su  inversión a  10.000 soles   
Ella necesita 800 soles  los va invertir en su negocio de bazar de regalos, dulces    
Carmen tiene un sueño es tener otro negocio para su hijo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the community bank San Juan. She is married and is 44 years old. She has a 17 year old daughter who is studying. She has a business selling gifts and sweets that she began six months ago in the Pamplona market. She invested 5.000 soles and she has doubled her investment to 10.000 soles. She needs 800 soles that she would invest in her business of gifts and sweets. Carmen has a dream of having another business, for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business of gifts and sweets

loans.name: Salome Gabriela

texts.es:
Salome es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Salome es soltera tiene 20 años, se quedo sin empleo hace 10 meses, ante la necesidad se inscribió en venta de ropa interior por catalogo Leonisa
Ella necesita 400 soles para invertirlos en compra-venta de ropa interior por catalogo 
Se sueño es terminar su carrera y poner un negocio
texts.en:
Salome is a partner in the San Juan Community Bank. She is 20 years old and single. Salome has been unemployed for 10 moths, and she began selling Leonisa brand lingerie via catalog out of necessity. Salome needs 400 soles to invest in her clothing sales business. She dreams of finishing school and starting a business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lingerie sales via catalog

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 22 años, vive con su pareja en la casa de su suegra. Se dedica a la elaboración de carrocerías para mototaxi, triciclos etc., desde hace ya 3 años al lado de su pareja con quien trabaja en este negocio. Nelly es muy trabajadora, siempre le pone muchas ganas a querer salir adelante y sabe que al lado de su pareja podrá lograrlo si siguen trabajando juntos como lo han venido haciendo, ya que le ponen mucho empeño a su negocio, realizándolo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta que terminen, que suele demorar hasta aproximadamente las 7 u 8 de la noche. Nelly se encuentra en su sétimo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. La demanda es buena, es por eso que Nelly quiere expandir el negocio comprando mayor cantidad de metal.
texts.en:
Nelly is 22 years old and lives with her partner in her mother-in-law’s home. For three years, she has dedicated herself to making metal parts for mototaxis, tricycles, etc. at her partner’s side, with whom she works in this business. Nelly is a very hard-working woman, who always puts forth great effort to getting ahead and she knows that she can accomplish this along with her partner if they continue working as they have been. They put great energy into their business, working from 8 am until they finish which can be 7 pm or 8 pm at night. Nelly finds herself in her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very prompt with her payments. Demand is high, which is why Nelly wants to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity of metal.
