Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of metal.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 28 años, vive de manera independiente, ya que aun no se ha casado ni tiene hijos. Es una joven llena de vida, tras haber terminado sus estudios secundarios y no pudiendo lograr estudios superiores se ha dedicado a trabajar para poder salir adelante. Es así que incursionó, hace ya 4 años, en la venta de golosinas, actividad a la que le dedica la mayor parte del día, comienza a las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 o 7 de la noche. A Silvia le gusta su trabajo, ya que la venta siempre le ha gustado, aunque algunas veces las inclemencias del clima le causen algunos inconvenientes, pero son mínimos, su trabajo le trae muchas gratificaciones. Silvia se encuentra en su sétimo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de golosinas y así mejorar sus ingresos diarios.
texts.en:
Silvia is 28 years old and lives independently since she has not yet married or had children. She is a young woman that is full of life and, having finished secondary school but been unable to continue on to more advanced studies, has dedicated herself to working so she can get ahead. It’s in this manner that, four years ago, she embarked on a business selling sweets/snacks. She carries out her activities for the major part of the day, starting at 8 am and continuing until 6 or 7 pm. Silvia enjoys her work since she has always taken pleasure in sales, although sometimes inclement weather poses some obstacles. These, however, are minimal and she finds her work to be very gratifying. Silvia finds herself in her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and has been very punctual with her payments. With the funds requested, she will invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise so she can improve her daily earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Lourdes Verónica

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Lourdes es conviviente tiene 38 años, cuatro hijos de 20, 19, 16, y 13 años que esta en el colegio 
Ella empezó en el negocio de venta de cerveza vio la oportunidad por que por su casa hay una cancha deportiva y no se vendía nada, entonces ella empezó vendiendo 10 cajas, actualmente vende 25 cajas en cada campeonato. 

Necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles compra de cerveza, comprar juguetes por la campaña de navidad y prendas interiores para la venta 
Su meta es poner una tienda bazar pues por su casa no hay tienda
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the San Juan cooperative bank. Lourdes has a partner, is 38 years old, and has four children ages 20, 19, 16, and 13 who are in school. She started her business selling beer after seeing an opportunity given her house’s proximity to a sports field where nothing was sold to attendees. She started selling 10 cases, and now sells 25 cases at each championship. She needs a loan of 1,400 Peruvian soles to purchase beer, toys for the holiday season, and undergarments to sell. Her goal is to open a bazaar store because there are none near her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and toys for the holidays.

loans.name: Haydee Yovana

texts.es:
Haydee   es socia del Bancomunal Teresa de Calcuta. 
Haydee es casada, tiene 32 años y dos hijos  de 8 y 3 años.   
Tiene su negocio desde hace más de diez años, ella vende en el Terminal pesquero de Villa María del Triunfo vende pescado todos los días junto a tres  personas más.
Desde que esta en Finca le va bien ha podido invertir más  y con las ganancias que saca puede comprar más mercadería y ahorrar.

Haydee solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado y mariscos, ella compra por dobles al por mayor.
Su sueño con comprarse un terreno poder construirlo y también poder darle los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the communal bank Teresa de Calcuta. She is 32 years old, is married and has two children ages 8 and 3 years old. Haydee has had her business for more than ten years. She and three other people sell fish daily at the fish market at Villa Maria del Triunfo. Since she has partnered with FINCA she has done better and has been able to invest more. She has used her profits to purchase more merchandise and to save. Haydee is asking for a loan in the amount of $400 which she will invest in purchasing fish and seafood wholesale. Her dreams is to purchase land to build on and to provide her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fish and seafood.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa D. Calcuta. 
Epifania es casada, tiene  62 años y cinco hijos  D. 44, 42, 40, 38 y 36 años, todos sus hijos están casados.   Ella tiene su negocio desD. hace cuatro años tiene un taller D. costura y una pequeña tienda en su casa, ahí venD. todos los días.
DesD. que esta en Finca  ha mejorado a comprado más mercadería.

Epifanía solicita un préstamo D. 1200. soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cervezas, gaseosas, abarrotes, Kerosene y dulces al por mayor.
Ella sueña con hacer crecer mas su negocio, tener mas mercaderías y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Epifania is a member of the communal bank Teresa D. Calcuta. She is 62 years old, is married and has five children ages 44, 42, 40, 38 and 36. All of her children are married. Epifania has had her business for four years. She owns a dressmaking shop and has a small store in her home which she runs every day. Since joining FINCA her business has improved and she has been able to purchase more merchandise. Epifania is asking for a loan in the amount of $400 which she will invest in purchasing beer, soft drinks, groceries, kerosene and candies wholesale. Her dream is to expand her business, to have more merchandise and to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, soft drinks, groceries, kerosene and candies wholesale.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa D. Calcuta. 
Luisa es casada, tiene  62 años y cuatro hijos  D. 30, 29, 23, y 20 años, 3 hijos están casados y el menor va a empezar a estudiar. Ella tiene un restaurante que se llama “Cusqueña” desD. hace dos años, trabaja con dos D. sus nueras, venD. todos los días almuerzos y por las noches venD. salchipapas, pollo brosther, sándwich,  venD. en un local cerca D. su casa.
DesD. que esta en Finca se ha superado porque antes solo vendía salchipapas y ahora ya tiene un restaurante.

Luisa solicita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes, gaseosas, platos descartables, va arreglar su ambiente D. trabajo.
Luisa sueña con hacer crecer en su negocio, poder arreglarlo y también poder arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the communal bank Teresa D. Calcuta. Luisa is 62 years old,is married and has four children ages 30, 29, 23 and 20 years. Three of her children are married and the youngest is starting school. She has had a restaurant called "Cusqueña" for two years where she works with two of her sisters-in-law. She sells breakfast everyday and in the evenings sells "salchipapas", chicken and sandwiches at a stall near her home. Since joining FINCA her business has improved. Previously she only sold salchipapas and now she has a restaurant. Luisa is asking for a loan in the amount of $650 which she will invest in purchasing groceries, soft drinks, disposable plates and in improving the restaurant's atmosphere. Luisa's dreams are to expand her business, improve her business and to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing groceries, soft drinks, disposable plates and improving her restaurant's atmosphere.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa D. Calcuta. 
Celestina es casada, tiene  61 años y tiene cuatro hijos entre 23 y 35 años todos sus hijos están casados y trabajan.  
Celestina  tiene un negocio D. una bodega que se llama ”Virgen del Pilar” desD. hace 33 años, venD. todos los días con  ayuda su esposo. 
DesD. que esta en Finca  se encuentra más estable, poco a poco ha ido surgiendo con la ayuda D. las charlas

Celestina solicita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes, gaseosas, dulces, todas las compras D. sus productos ella compra al por mayor.
Celestina sueña con surtir más su  bodega D. mercadería y ampliarla.
texts.en:
Celestina is a member of the communal bank Teresa D. Calcuta. She is 61 years old, is married and has four children between the ages of 23 and 35. All of her children are married and work. Celestina has had a grocery store called "Virgen del Pilar" for 33 years. She opens her store every day with her husband. Since she joined FINCA her business has been more stable and she has been improving with the help of its talks. Celestina is asking for a loan in the amount of $275 which she will invest in purchasing groceries, soft drinks and candies. All of which she will purchase wholesale. Celestina's dream is to increase the stock in her grocery store and to expand her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries, soft drinks and candies.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María  es socia del Banco Comunal Teresa de Calcuta. 
María, tiene  37 años y una hija de 16 años que está culminando el colegio.
Su negocio es de venta de chicharrones  que se llama “PORKY 1”, al costado de la comisaría por el  puente Lurín, este negocio lo comparte con otra persona, vende desde hace un año  todos los días, también vende menú.

Desde que entro a Finca se ha superado pues primero vendía productos de belleza, después comenzó a vender DVD, y ahora ya tiene un negocio mayor que es la venta de chicharrones y menú.
María requiere un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de chancho, gaseosas.
El sueño de María es tener su negocio propio y poder darle los estudios a su hija para que sea profesional.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Teresa de Calcutta Community Bank. She is 37 years old and has a 16-year old daughter who is completing her college studies. María earns her living by selling chicharrones (a traditional pork dish)—her business is called PORKY 1 and is located next to the Lurín bridge police station. She runs the business with another person. She has had the business for one year and works there every day. She also sells fixed menu food. Since she first became involved with Kiva partner Finca, she has done well. At first she used to sell beauty products, then DVDs, and now she has a bigger business selling chicharrones and set meals. María is asking for a loan of 2000 soles which she will use to buy pork and soft drinks. Her dream is to own her own business and be able to provide her daughter with a good education so that she can obtain a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pork and soft drinks

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa D. Calcuta. 
María es casada, tiene  53 años y tres hijos  D. 25, 23 y 15 años, dos D. sus hijos trabajan y el menor está en el colegio.
María  tiene un negocio D. venta D. jugo D. caña D. azúcar que se llama “Milagritos” en un puesto del merado 5 D. Mayo, venD. todos los días con su  esposo también venD. ropa por campañas, primero empezó con el negocio D. la venta D. ropa, pero como no vendía mucho decidió invertir en otra cosa.
DesD. que esta en Finca se ha superado ha podido ahorrar, tiene un negocio estable y con el capital que ha obtenido  pueD. comprar más mercadería para cuando hay fiestas. 

Ella solicita un préstamo D. 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa al por mayor.
María sueña con  superarse, que su negocio crezca y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Teresa D. Calcutta Community Bank. She is 53 years old, married, and has three children aged 25, 23, and 15. Two of her children have jobs and the youngest one is in college.María has a stall selling sugar cane juice. Her business is called Milagritos and is located in the 5 D. Mayo market. She and her husband work there every day and also sell clothes there. At first she sold clothes only but because sales were poor, she decided to put her money into something else.Since she’s been with Kiva partner Finca, she’s done well and managed to put asiD. some savings. She has a steady business and with the money she has obtained, she is able to buy more merchandise to sell when there are festivals. She is asking for a loan of 1400 soles which she will use to buy clothing at wholesale prices.María’s dream is to get ahead, to expand her business, and to have her daughter employed in a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca tiene 60 años, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes, en la actualidad vive con una D. sus hijas que la ayuda mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en un puesto del mercado, desD. hace ya 25 años, y lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que la mantiene activa, conoce a mucha gente y brindar un trato amable a sus comensales. Le es rentable debido a que en el mercado donD. venD. concurre mucha gente por ser una zona turística. Este es su 9no crédito con MFP, y sigue con el mismo ánimo D. ser responsable y trabajadora en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará víveres y utensilios D. cocina (ollas, platos, vasos, cucharas, entre otros) como también quiere invertir en el arreglo D. su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 60 years old, is a single mother, and has five children who are independent. Currently, she lives with one of her daughters who helps her a lot. Blanca has been dedicated to selling food from a market stall for twenty-five years. What she likes about her job is that it keeps her active, she knows a lot of people and she provides friendly service to her guests. What is profitable is that a lot of people come to the market where she works since it is in a tourist area. This is her ninth loan with MFP and she continues with the same spririt of being responsible and hard working for her community bank. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase groceries and cooking utensils (pots, plates, glasses, spoons, among other things). She also wants to invest in fixing her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries and utensils.

loans.name: Audelia María

texts.es:
La señora Audelia G. se dedica a la venta de ropa teniendo su propio establecimiento en la ciudad de León en el mercado La Terminal donde todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ella se prepara para iniciar su jornada de trabajo vendiendo la ropa

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente trabajadora y se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual le han permitido la compra de la mercadería. Hoy en día la razón por la cual ella solicita el crédito es para adquirir la mercadería y de esta forma continuar en el negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Señora Audelia G.’s job is selling clothing from her own stall in the market of La Terminal in the town of León. Starting in the early morning every day she gets ready for her day’s work selling clothes. She says she is an excellent worker and has been much helped by loans from Kiva partner Ceprodel. This money has allowed her to buy more merchandise. Today she is asking for a loan to buy more goods and so continue her clothes-selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La señora Flor de María S. H. actualmente tiene su propio establecimiento de venta de ropa dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 5 años. Es importante destacar que a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ha logrado salir adelante y ha beneficiado a su familia por medio del mejoramiento de su núcleo familiar.

Hoy en día la razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque solicitó un crédito para la compra de la mercadería. Es importante destacar que al ser beneficiada con dicho crédito mejorará su negocio y por ende su familia se verá favorecida por tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
At present Señora Flor de María S. H. has a stall where she has been selling clothes for the past five years. It’s important to note that in this time she has done well and has improved the life of her family. Now she has put her hope in Kiva partner Ceprodel and requested a loan to buy merchandise. Upon receiving the loan she will be able to improve her business and her family will benefit from her increased income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Justina De La Concepción

texts.es:
Justina R. es una dama muy alegre y dinámica que desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de gaseosas y agua ubicada en el mercado la Terminal de la ciudad de León específicamente al frente del local donde salen los buses para la ciudad de Chinandega.

Por tener un espíritu de superación en su negocio, la señora Justina ha buscado la manera de salir adelante y se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel y por este motivo es que ha solicitado un nuevo crédito  con el propósito de adquirir los productos para continuar comercializándolos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Justina R. is a very cheerfu and dynamic woman that has for several years been selling sodas and agua in her business located in the terminal in the city of León, specifically in the front of the terminal where the buses leaves for Chinandega. Having a spirit of determination, Justina has looked for ways to get ahead and the loans provided by Ceprodel have help her. For this reason, she has requested a new loan with the purpose of acquiring the products to continue selling them in her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas and water

loans.name: Manuela Yolanda

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Manuela R. se desempeña en el negocio de venta de gaseosas, refrescos naturales  y agua con el propósito de mantener su nucleo familiar y llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

A este negocio se dedica desde hace varios 40 largos años habiéndose destacado como una excelente comerciante en el mercado La Terminal. La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de las gaseosas, frutas para elaborar los refrescos naturales y el agua para así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the La Terminal market in the city of León, Manuela R. works selling sodas, natural juices, and water in order to support her family. She has performed this activity for 40 years, having stood out as an excellent merchant in La Terminal. The reason she has come to Ceprodel is to receive a loan for the purchase of sodas and fruits to make natural juices to continue in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas and fruit to make natural juices

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora María B. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de elaboración de tortillas las cuales son preparadas por ella misma todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Se ha dedicado con tanto empeño a esta actividad que se ha convertido en una excelente elaboradora de estas deliciosas tortillas y por esta razón es muy visitada en su establecimiento por clientes que compran dichas tortillas. 

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra del maíz y la leña para llevar a cabo dicha actividad que es su medio de sustento.
texts.en:
In the La Terminal market in the city of León, María B. has worked making tortilllas that are prepared by her everyday, from early in the morning until sundown. She has been so hard-working that she has become a excellent maker of these delicious tortillas and for this reason is much visited in her locale by clients seeking her products. Today she has come to Ceprodel for the purpose of receiving a loan that will allow her to purchase corn and firewood to continue with this activity, which is her means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and firewood

loans.name: Martha Veronica

texts.es: Doña Martha Veronica está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (repara su cocina), labora como docente en el Nerpe Salmón Ibarra Mayorga desde hace 7 años, ella tiene 2 niños menores de edad que estudian educación primaria, su hijo de 10 año estudia 5to grado y la niña de 8 años de edad estudia 4to grado, doña Martha Veronica recibe ayuda de su marido y comparten los gastos del hogar, ella es una mujer  responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy humilde, vive en la colonia Talolinga de Nueva Guinea, donde la población cada dia crece mas, ella se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya que ha obtenidos grandes beneficios, de esta forma ha mejorado su vivienda y a comprado electrodomésticos con los cuales ha mejorado las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar, su sueño de vivir en un casa digna, y de esta forma sus hijos se desarrollen en condiciones humanas acepatables en la socieda,  también espera tener estabilidad laboral, de esta forma ayudar a su familia a vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Doña Martha Veronica is requesting her seventh loan to invest in improving her house (repairing her kitchen). She has worked as a teacher at Nerpe Salmón Ibarra Mayorga for 7 years. She has 2 young children that are in elementary school, her 10 year old son is in the 5th grade and her 8 year old daughter is in the 4th grade. Martha Veronica receives help from her husband and they share the household expenses. She is a very responsible, honest, hard-working and humble woman. She lives in the Talolinga de Nueva Guinea neighborhood, which is growing day by day. She is thankful to AFODENIC, since she has obtained great benefits and has been able to improve her house and purchase appliances to improve her family's standard of living. Her dream is to live in a decent house and thus see her children grow up in acceptable living conditions; she also hopes to have job security to help her family live better.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of kitchen

loans.name: Josefa Vicenta

texts.es: Josefa Vicenta  labora como Asesora de crédito en la financiera FAMA, vive  en la zona # 3  de Nueva Guinea, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda construyendo una habitacion con baño interno  y poder tener mejores condiciones en el hogar; Josefa se caracteriza por ser profesional, emprededora, optimista, ha luchado desde muy joven para desempeñarse en el campo laboral, es reconocida por ser una mujer responsable, honesta,  trabajadora, con principios cristianos, su mayor sueño es tener un hogar digno con condiciones humanas y social para su hijo.
texts.en:
Josefa Vicenta works as a credit assessor at the FAMA financing company. She lives in zone 3 of Nueva Guinea and has a son who is 3 years old. She is requesting refinancing of her second loan so she can improve her home. She would like to build a bedroom with its own bathroom, to have better living conditions. Josefa is a professional, enterprising and optimistic woman who has struggled since she was young to perform in the labor market. She is known as a responsible, honest, and hard-working woman with Christian principles. Her greatest dream is to have a dignified home with humane and social conditions for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bedroom and bathroom

loans.name: Yelba Marbellys

texts.es: Yelba Marbellys es madre soltera, tiene 3 niños menores de edad, labora como docente en el Ceta INATEC Nueva Guinea desde hace 5 año, está solicitando su 7mo crédito a AFODENIC para mejorar su vivienda con la reparación de piso y cambiar una poco el techo el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones, con este crédito va  comprar los materiales de construción, ella es una mujer con alto espitud de superación, siendo una profesional que desde muy joven se ha desarrollado en el campo laboral, se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable, honesta; Yelba con los crédito que ha recibido a traves de AFODENIC ha realizado poco a poco las mejora de su vivienda, sueña con tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda  digna en su comunidad para brindarle comodidad a su nucleo familiar que son sus hijos por los que ella se sacrifica.
texts.en:
Yela Marbellys is a single mother and has three children under the age of 18. She has worked as a teacher at Ceta INATEC Nueva Guinea for 5 years. She is requesting her 7th loan from Kiva partner AFODENIC so she can improve her home by repairing the floor and repairing the roof a bit, which is in bad condition. She will buy construction materials with this loan. She is a woman with a great spirit to overcome, as she has been a professional since she was very young, and has developed herself in the labor market. She is a very responsible and honest person. Yelba has improved her home little by little with the loans that she has received through AFODENIC. She dreams of having a stable job, good health, and a dignified home in her community so she can give her nuclear family comfort. She sacrifices to give these things to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair floor and roof of home

loans.name: José René

texts.es: José René es casado, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, habita en la colonia La Unión de Nueva Guinea, labora como docente en la escuela Rubén Dario desde hace 3 años, es una persona que asume con responsabilidad los deberes del nucleo familiar cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa para los gastos del hogar, esta solicitando refinanciamiento a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar mejora de su casa de habitación en la cocina haciendo un repello en las paredes de esta, con el credito desea comprar material de construción y poder realizar la mejora que brindara mayor comodidad a su familia;  José René tiene alto deseo de superación, honesto y responsable, actualmente estudia en la universidad URACCAN, se siente satisfecho por los beneficio que ha recibido por la institución pues con los creditos ha logrado mejorar poco a poco su vivienda,  su sueño  es   tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda  digna con buenas condiciones humanas para su familia.
texts.en:
José René is married, has two young children and lives in La Unión, Nueva Guinea. He has been a teacher at Rubén Dario school for the past three years. He is a very responsible family man, and his wife helps him with the household expenses. He is asking AFODENIC for this loan in order to make improvements to his home, specifically to plaster the walls of the kitchen. He will use the loan money to buy building materials to make the improvements which will make his family more comfortable. José René is very motivated to overcome his situation; he is honest and responsible. He is also a student at URACCAN University. He is happy to have benefitted from this institution as he has used previous loans to gradually make improvements to his home. He dreams of having work stability, health and a decent home with good living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix his kitchen

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo M. G., es casado, tiene 1 hijo, labora como docente en el Ceta INATEC Nueva Guinea,desde hace un año, está solicitando su 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar mejora de su casa de habitación reparando la sala y poder comprar material de construción como es ceramica y otros materiales, don Wilfredo asume con responsabilidad su deberes crediticios,  tiene alto espiritu de superación,  desde pequeño se ha desarrollado en el campo laboral para poder ayudarle a sus padres, es muy reconocido en su comunidad por ser una persona honesta las sus actividades que desarrolla. Se siente muy satisfecho por los beneficio que ha recibido por la institución,  su sueño  es   tener estabilidad laboral salud  y una vivienda  digna con buenas condiciones humana para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo M. G. is married, has one child, and works as an educator in Ceta INATEC Nueva Guinea. He's been working her for a year. He is requesting his second loan to the AFODENIC institution in order to improve his living room in his home.

He wishes to purchase materials such as clay among others. Mr. Wilfredo assumes full responsibility to this loan. He has high hopes of improving his life. He has been a very hard-working person since a very young age, he's been helping his own parents and is very well liked in the community for all the support he has to offer. He is very grateful for all the help he's received from this institution, his dream is to have a stable health and to be able to provide a honorable home to his family.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of living room and purchase of building materials

loans.name: Onofre

texts.es: Don Onofre es un pequeño productor agropecuario dedicado a esta actividad desde muy joven, ha logrado sustentar a su familia, todos sus hijos mayores estan casados, 2 habitan junto a el y ya esan en la escuela primaria cursando el 5to y 3er grado; solicita financiamiento para compra de 2 pie de cria (vaquillas) y fortalecer su inventario ganadero, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien lo acompaña en su finquita y le ayuda en la actividad productiva cuidando cerdos, gallinas, peliguey y atiende a su marido muy temprano para que este garantice el cuido de sus animales y la produccion de granos basicos y tuberculos para el autoconsumo y cierta parte para su comercializacion, su sueño es crecer con su inventario ganadero y asi lograr menores condiciones de vida familiar desde su pequeña unidad de produccion.
texts.en:
Mr. Onofre has been working on the agricultural field since a very young age. He's been able to support his family and his three grown children. All his children are married, two of his children live with him since they attend high school (3rd and 5th year, respectively).

He is requesting this loan in order to purchase cows and increase his cattle inventory. He is supported by his wife who works with him taking care of pigs, hens, and other animals. Some of these animals are for commercial uses. His dream is to increase his current inventory and that way improve his family's living standards.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows and other farm animals

loans.name: Belmira

texts.es: Belmira tiene 30 años, es madre soltera, vive con su única hija a quien ama mucho. Se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás, le gusta su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas y sabe que dar un trato amable es primordial para mantener contenta y fiel a su clientela. Este negocio le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un lugar turístico y las personas que lo visitan no dejan de comprar los exquisitos platos que Belmira cocina. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, por lo que sigue comprometida con su grupo y con la institución para ser responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar más sillas y mesas para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Belmira is 30 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her only daughter whom she loves very much. She sells regional food, an activity which she began to be involved in 2 years ago. She likes her work because she is able to have contact with lots of people and knows that friendly customer service is paramount for maintaining a happy and loyal clientèle. This business is profitable because it is located in a tourist area and the people visiting don't hesitate to buy the delicious dishes that Belmira cooks up. This is her fourth loan from MFP, and she remains committed to both her group and the institution to responsible and timely repayment. With the money which she is requesting she wants to buy more chairs and tables to give her customers a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture to equip her restaurant

loans.name: Keyla

texts.es: Keyla tiene 29 años, es madre de 2 hijos que estudian y son su razón de salir adelante, ella vive con su conviviente quien la apoya bastante en su hogar y en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de combustible (petróleo y kerosén) al por menor, lo lleva a vender por las riveras del río a las distintas embarcaciones que lo requieren. Esta  labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años, y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y conversar con muchas personas, además le es rentable porque ya se ha hecho muy conocida en la zona y tiene clientes que saben que el combustible que ella vende es de buena calidad, y solo le compran a ella. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP, Keyla demuestra ser una clienta muy responsable hasta el momento. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más combustible, así como también quiere mandar a repara el vehículo con el cual se transporta.
texts.en:
Keyla is 29 years old. She is the mother of two children who are studying and are her main reason for wanting to move forwards. She lives with her partner who helps her a lot in the home and with her business. She sells fuel (petrol and kerosene) on a retail level, taking it to sell on the banks of the river to the different crafts which need it. She's undertaken this work for the last three years and it is going very well. What she likes about this work is that she's familiar with many different places and talks with lots of people. Additionally, it's a profitable business as she's very well-known in the area and she has customers who know that she sells good-quality fuel, and only buy from her. This is her fifth credit from MFP, Keyla has shown that up until now she has been a very responsible client. With the money she is requesting she will buy more fuel, and she also wants to repair the vehicle she use to transport the fuel.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fuel wholesale

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente y la apoya en lo posible. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas al por menor dentro de su vivienda, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, y la complementa con la venta de comida (parrilladas y ceviches) los sábados y domingos, ya que son los días cuando hay más demanda. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera muchos ingresos, los   cuales fortalecen la economía de su hogar y como cuenta con una fiel clientela, le va bien hasta el momento. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita construirá un local adecuado para vender sus bebidas y comida, como también para brindar a sus clientes una mejora atención.
texts.en:
Laura is 58 years old and lives with her husband, who is a shop assistant and helps her where possible. She sells drinks on a retail basis in front of her house. This is an activity she has undertaken for the last two years, and complements with the sale of food (barbecue and ceviche) on Saturdays and Sundays, as these are the days on which there's most demand. What she likes most about her work is the extra income that it generates, which strengthen her family budget, and because she can count on a faithful clientèle, it has all gone well up until now. This is her sixth loan with MFP. With the money she is asking for, she will construct an adequate site to sell drinks and food, in order to provide her customers with a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a site for her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy es madre de 3 hijos, vive con su conviviente quien la apoya mucho. Ella brinda servicios de radiofonía a las personas que quieren conversar con sus familiares que se encuentran por los caseríos alejados, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años atrás y le gusta porque conoce a muchas personas, además le es rentable, debido a que es ella la única persona en su zona que tiene este tipo de servicio que es de gran utilidad para muchas personas. Este ya es su 3er préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita quiere ampliar su local e implementarlo para que sea cómodo para recibir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucy is the mother of 3 children, she lives with her significant other who supports her very much. She manages a radio call center for people who want to speak to relatives that live in far away hamlets. She has been doing this for the past 4 years and enjoys it as she gets to meet many people, and besides it is profitable as she is the only person in the area that offers this kind of service necessary for many people. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. With the money she will extend her premises and remodel to make it more comfortable for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Extend and remodel premises.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 50 años D. edad, es madre D. 2 hijos solteros que trabajan y la apoyan mucho, en la actualidad vive junto a su esposo. Su actividad diaria D. la venta D. bebidas hace que Teresa siga adelante, este trabajo lo viene haciendo desD. hace 10 años atrás, a razón D. encontrarse en un buen lugar que es muy concurrido. Le gusta su trabajo porque por medio del mismo conoce a muchas personas con quienes intercambia ideas y le es rentable porque las bebidas son consumidas diariamente, debido al calor D. la zona. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita comprará sillas, mesas, y cajas D. cervezas y gaseosas, que son la materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa is 50 years old, a mother of 2 single sons who work and support her a lot. At the present she is living with her husband. Her daily activity selling beverages makes Teresa get ahead as she has been doing this for the past 10 years at a very popular location. She enjoys her work as she meets many people with whom she can exchange ideas, and it is profitable as drinks are consumed daily because of the hot weather in the area. This is her 6th loan with MFP and she has proven to be responsible. With the money she will buy chairs, tables, boxes of beer and pop which represent the raw material to her businesss.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture and products for business.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: La joven Karla Vanessa de 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, trabaja como profesora de primaria desde hace 7 años en El Ayote, viajando a Santo Domingo los fines de semana para ver a su pequeño, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años estudiando el 4to grado de primaria, su mamá le cuida al niño, está solicitando su 7mo credito el que utilizara para construir una cocina, ademas hacer arranques para un cuarto y levantar las paredes hasta donde pueda.  Karla ha pagado en tiempo y forma sus 6 creditos anteriores, manifiesta que le han servido de mucho y quiere darle mejores condiciones a su hijo, ya que es un varoncito y necesita privacidad.  Karla a pesar de ser una joven soltera con esfuerzo propio y sin ayuda de nadie mas que los creditos otorgados por AFODENIC, se ha planteado siempre mantener su record  crediticio para continuar trabajando de la mano con esta institucion que es la unica que le ayuda a los asalariados.
texts.en:
Karla is 31 years old, single mother and has been working as a teacher in elementary school for the past 7 years. She works in El Ayote, traveling to the Dominican Republic on weekends to see his son who is 8 years old. His son is in 4th year of primary school. Her mother takes care of her son. She is requesting her 7th loan which she will use to build a kitchen and make some space in her room. Karla has been paying off her loans on time and she shares that these loans have been very helpful in the past. She wishes to improve her living and give her son the privacy he deserves. Even though Karla is very young, she is very responsible and has maintained her integrity in paying off these loans on time.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building of a kitchen and walls in her home

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos Antonio, casado, de 50 años de esda, de oficio trabajador industrial, con 2 hijos, una niña que cursa el primer grado y un varon de 2 años de edad, su esposa no trabaja fuera de la casa, maneja un negocio de venta de muebles de madera finos del esposo, el trabaja en el Matadero MACESA ubicado en la comarca San Esteban de Juigalpa, con 5 años de servicio, trabaja de Lunes a Domingo con horario de 5:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. como recortador de carne cortes selectos.  Don Marcos ha demostrado responsabilidad en el pago de sus 4 creditos anteriores, pues desde el 2004 esta trabajando con AFODENIC, manifesto que gracias  a los creditos que se le han otorgado ya cuenta con una vivienda digna, pues cuando inicio con AFODENIC solo contaba con el terreno, ahora tiene una vivienda con 2 dormitorios, sala, comedor, cocina amplia, pintada con piso de ceramica, etc.; este 5to credito lo utilizara para comprar zinc y perlines para  techar un galeron que utilizara para el lavado y el planchado y darle mejores condiciones a su esposa para que no se moje con el invierno y no se asolee.
texts.en:
Don Marcos Antonio is married, 50 years old, an industrial worker with 2 children; a girl in first grade and a two-year-old boy. His wife does not work outside their home, she manages her husband's business selling furniture made of fine woods. Mr. Marcos Antonio has been working for 5 years at the MACESA slaughter house located in San Esteban de Juigalpa, from Monday through Sunday from 5:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m as a cutter of selective cuts. Don Marcos has shown responsability repaying 4 previous loans. He has been working with AFODENIC since 2004 and thanks to the loans he owns a decent home. When he started with AFODENIC he only had the land, now he has a dwelling with 2 bedrooms, living room, dining room, big kitchen, all painted, with ceramic floors, etc. The 5th loan will be spent on buying zinc and purlins to cover the area used for laundry and ironing with a roof, to offer more comfort to his wife so that she will neither get wet during winter nor stand in the sun.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc and purlins.

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.es: El Sr. G., casado, de 32 años de edad con 2 hijos, elvaron estudiara el 3er grado, la niña no esta en edad escolar, su esposa no tiene ninguna profesion, pero sale a realizar lavado y planchado donde gana dinero extra por semana los que aporta a los gastos del hogar y el con su salario paga su credito y asume otros gastos.  Eliezer trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de juigalpa desde hace 12 años como vigilante nocturno, ademas cuenta con un bono mensual que le otorga la Alcaldia a sus trabajadores lo que viene a ayudarle en su economia; esta solicitando su 2do credito que lo utilizara para continuar con la construccion de su vivienda, pues con su primer credito levanto paredes hasta la altura de las puertas, en esta ocasion comprara el resto de las piedras, perlines y zinc para el techo, manifiesta que esta haciendo un esfuerzo muy grande para construir su casa y darle un techo propio a sus hijos y a su esposa, pues es muy triste estar comprartiendo con otras personas que tienen diferentes caracteres, donde sufren los niños y los padres al no tener techo propio, gracias a la Alcaldia que ha hecho convenios con AFODENIC muy pronto complira con el sueño mas grande de su vida que es tener un techo digno para su familia.
texts.en:
Eliezer G. is married, 32 years old, and has two children. His son is in the third grade, while his daughter is not yet old enough for school. His wife doesn't have an official job, but earns extra money each week by offering washing and ironing services, and this money goes towards household expenses. Eliezer's salary goes toward loan repayments and other living expenses. Eliezer has worked for the Juigalpa Municipal Council for twelve years as a night watchman. He also receives a monthly voucher which the council awards to its workers, which helps him financially. This will be his second loan, and it will be used to continue construction on his home. With his first loan he built walls up to the height of the doors. With this loan he will buy the rest of the stones needed for construction, and perlines and zinc for the roof. Eliezer has shown that he is making a great effort to build a home and provide shelter to his wife and children. It is very sad to have to share a residence with other people who have different personalities, where the children and parents suffer for not having their own roof over their heads. Thanks to the agreement that the council has with AFODENIC, Eliezer will very soon fulfil the greatest dream of his life, which is to provide a good home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro M. es padre de familia y por el momento en la casa donde vive esta pagando renta.
Como desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su esposa y sus hijos los cuales todavía están en edad escolar. Esta tramitando una vivienda por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental) pero el valor de la casa es superior al crédito que le pueden otorgar ya que su sueldo es muy bajo.
Trabaja en una compañía de repartidor de documentos a diferentes partes de la ciudad. Cuando se tomó la fotografía no se encontraba el señor M., sólo estaban la señora Marilu Maximina y sus dos hijos.  
Solicita un préstamo para poder completar y así adquirir su vivienda y poder darle un lugar seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Ramiro Mendez is the head of a household and at the moment lives in a house where he is paying rent, but hopes to own a secure home for his wife and school-age children. He is in the process of applying for a home through Infonavit, a government housing agency, but the house costs more than the credit he is eligible for given his low salary. He works for a company which delivers documents to different parts of the city. The photo above is of Ramiro's wife Marilu Maximina and their two children, as Ramiro was not at home when the photo was taken. He is seeking a loan in order to complete the financing and acquire the house, so he can provide a secure home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a house through Infonavit, a government housing agency

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es:
El señor Celedonio Pérez esta agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito.
Ahora tiene un negocio más, la venta de alimentos preparados, el cual lo trabajan su esposa y dos personas mas, los carritos de frutas siguen produciendo buenos rendimientos, en este nuevo negocio requiere de mayor mercancía y un vehiculo para poder entregar la comida a diferentes partes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mr. Celedonio P. is thankful for the great support given him with his previous loan. He now has an additional business, the sale of prepared meals, in which his wife and two other persons work. His fruit carts continue to produce well. His new business needs more merchandise and a vehicle to be able to deliver the meals to the different areas of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and a vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: La persona que sale en la foto es la esposa del señor Juan Antonio.Juan Antonio M. desea construir una barda en la parte de atrás de su casa el vive en una zona muy riesgosa como pueden observar en la imagen esta en alto y teme que alguien pueda caer de ahí. Para empezar con la construcción de la barda el solicita la cantidad de $5,000 pesos. El señor Juan Antonio es guardia de un empresa y su esposa es empleada  domestica y con estos ingresos pagara el préstamo dado.
texts.en:
The person in the photograph is the wife of Mr. Juan Antonio. Juan Antonio M. wants to build a wall in the back part of his house. He lives in a very dangerous area. As can be seen in the picture, it is high up and someone could fall. To begin construction of the wall, he is requesting $5,000 pesos. Mr. Juan Antonio is a security guard at a company and his wife is a domestic employee. This income will allow them to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for a wall.

loans.name: Emeterio

texts.es:
Emeterio Z. C. vive en una colonia que apenas empieza habitarse. El es de las primera personas que le otorgaron su casa el quiere un préstamo para poner protecciones ya que en donde vive no hay  habitantes a su alrededor y hay mas vandalismo, es por ello que el piensa proteger a sus hijas al igual que a su esposa.
El es una persona trabajadora de maquiladora que piensa en el bienestar de sus hijas pero el trabajo no le permite estar la mayoría del tiempo al cuidado de sus hijas. Para poner las protecciones el solo necesita la cantidad de $1,500 pesos
texts.en:
Emeterio Z. C. lives in a community that is just beginning to get occupied. He is one of the first people that received his house. He wants a loan to be able to add security fencing to his home since there are no neighbors near by and there is more vandalism. He wants to protect his daughters and also his wife. He works in a bonded factory (maquiladora) and is worried for the safety of his daughters since his job does not allow him to be taking care of them all of the time. To install the security fencing, he only needs the amount of $1,500 pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase security fencing.

loans.name: Mrs. Samon Chork Villgae Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-two people who live in Phum Saeprammuoy village in Kampong Cham province have formed the village bank loan group. Each of the members will use the loan fO. a different purpose. Mrs. Samon C. is the village bank group president who was selected by the members. She is a farmer, who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice fO. a living. Her husband, Mr. Nhen Chhean, is a construction worker who does not earn sufficient income to support the family. Although Mrs. Samon C. and her husband work hard, they still live in poO. conditions. In order to improve these living conditions, Mrs. Samon C. decided to request a loan to buy a cow and start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income to provide a better life fO. her family. Mrs. Samon C. is 40 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow and start a breeding business.

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
This small loan will go to three women, and the group leader, Mrs. Un S., is 40 years old. She is a vegetable market seller, selling different kinds of vegetables such as cabbages, morning glories, and cucumbers. She currently earns an average of US$ 7 a day to sustain her family. She began this business in 1999. She is widowed and has three children, all of whom are still young and attend school. Her older sister is living with her. She makes a living selling mixed fruit juice and helps meet the family's needs.

To improve her business, S. is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables for sale, as well as for her older sister to enlarge her business.

The two other borrowers are:

Em N., 46, who is selling rice and porridge, etc. She's requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her family to ride.

Pich C., 45, is a Cambodian military person. She needs a loan to begin a new business as a hairdresser.

The borrowers live in Steung Meachey Commune in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Hong Heng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim Hong H. is a village bank group president of nineteen people, who all live in Phum Saeprammuoy village, in Kampong Cham province. Each member of the group plans to use the loan, which they obtained, for a different purpose. For instance, Mrs. Kim Hong H. is requesting a loan to buy grocery products to increase her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Suon Sarorn, is a construction worker who earns a small income, bareL. enough to support the famiL.. Aside from this business, he is a cow breeder. Mrs. Kim Hong H. is 46 years old and the mother of five children, one is employed at a garment factory, while the remaining four are construction workers. 
One member in this village bank loan is an end-of-term loan, and the other members have monthL. payment loans. This client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy grocery products to increase her store inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Ol Bin Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fourteen people from the Phum Saeprammuoy Village in the Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Sam Ol B. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Kung Samut, is a construction worker who generates little income to support the famiL.. Mrs. Sam Ol B. is 28 years old and the mother of three children who are all construction workers. Although these famiL. members try to work hard, they still cannot support the famiL. well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sam Ol B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business, and she also hopes to increase her income in order to provide a better life for her famiL..

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Souy

texts.en:
Souy P., 39, is a mother of two children who lives in Cheay Sbay Village in Kampong Thom Province. She raises pigs for sale and has a rice mill, charging a service fee for grinding rice for her villagers. She also cares for her mother.

P. started this business in 2000; her husband is a rice farmer. With their well-managed business, they both work hard every day to generate revenue. As another source of income, P. normally buys rice to grind for re-sale. With a view to improving her business, she now needs a loan to purchase rice to stock for re-sale; any remainder of the loan amount will be used for repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice to stock for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Raoth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-seven people who live in tH. Angkrang Village in tH. Kampong Cham Province form this village bank loan and all tH. members will use tH. loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Touch R. is tH. village bank president who has been selected by tH. members. SH. is a fruit seller in tH. local market. Since her business is going well, sH. wants to expand it; so sH. decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell to her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chaem Chim, is a construction worker who makes a rather small income to support tH. family. Mrs. Touch R. is 38 years old and tH. mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker, and tH. remaining four are attending tH. local school.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and tH. rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on tH. loan until tH. very end of tH. loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are tH. most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of tH. principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before tH. end of tH. loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell

loans.name: Mrs. Mally Theom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who are all from Angkrang village in Kampong Cham province make up this village bank. Mrs. Mally T. is the village bank president. She is a Khmer cake seller, working in the local market. In her business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy ingredients to make the delicious food for her customers. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Mally T. decided to ask for a loan to buy the ingredients for her purpose. Her husband, Mr. Pho Hak, is a policeman who can make only a small salary to support the household. Mrs. Mally T. is 37 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a driver while another one is a laborer and the youngest one is attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Ten members have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food for her customers

loans.name: Mr. Pon Khut Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of twelve people who all live in Chrouy Chrey village in Kandal province, and all the members will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes. Mr. Pon K. is the village bank president. He is farmer who cultivates rice on 1 hectare to earn a living. Since his field is far from the irrigation system, he also has a pump but he does not have enough money to purchase fuel for his pump to water the rice field. Thus, Mr. Pon K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fuel for this purpose. His wife, Mrs. Yath Im, is also a farmer. Mr. Pon K. is 60 years old and the father of two children who are both studying. All the members are presented in the picture but some of tH. are blocked from view.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for his pump to water the rice field

loans.name: Phoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoin M. was born in 1970 and she now lives in Boeng Veng village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Phoin M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to amend the field to make her crop more productive.

Additionally, she plans to use any remainder of the loan to hire laborers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Pheourn Saroeurn, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Phoin M. is 38 years old and the mother of three children two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive and hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha V. is a villager in Boeng Veng Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns 8 hectares where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her fields are infertile which is bad for her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Pha V. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the fields. She plans to use the rest of the loan to hire laborers to work on the fields.

Mrs. Pha V. is a widow with four children, two of whom help her in the plantation while another one is a construction worker and the remaining one is a grocer.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the fields

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Mrs. Vin N. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Beong Veng village in Kampong Cham province. She has 3 hectares where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Vin N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nai Nat, is a pig breeder.

Mrs. Vin N. is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Toeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Toeurn H. is a villager from Beong Veng village in Kampong Cham province. He owns a rice mill which he can hire out for an income. Aside from this business, he is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectares where he cultivates rice to earn a living. Since his field is infertile, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Kin Yoem, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family.

Mr. Toeurn H. is 59 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is a farmer while another one is a pig breeder and the youngest one is a construction worker. His wife is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to make his crop more productive

loans.name: Lev

texts.en:
Mr. Lev M. is a villager from Beong Veng village in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns 3.5 hectares where he cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces a problem because he does not have enough animals to plow the field. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Lev M. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to plow the field. His wife, Mrs. Toem Ton, helps him in the plantation.

Mr. Lev M. is 53 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a laborer while another one is a farmer and the remaining two are attending the local school. His wife is also shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to plow his field.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Mrs. Nang C. is a villager from Sras Pring village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 2-hectare field to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Nang C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Thai Ron, helps her in the plantation.

Mrs. Nang C. is 42 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one helps the parents in the plantation. The remaining four are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to  make her crop more productive

loans.name: Khol's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is going to three borrowers, all residents of Phnom Penh City. The group leader, Mrs. Khol S., is 47 years old and earns a living by providing cookery products, including pans and dishes, using her own truck as transport from market to market in and around Cambodia. She currently earns an income approximately of US$ 8 per day, and she has been running her business for more than one year.

She is married with two children: one is single and one is married and also works with her in the business. Her husband is a local construction worker as well as helping with her business. To enlarge her investment, S. has requested a loan to purchase a range of cookery products to sell.

The two other borrowers are:

Toem C., 40, a grocery market seller who is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for re-sale.

Khol R., 32, who sells groceries from her home and is requesting a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: to purchase a range of cookery products

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Mrs. Thol H. was born in 1972 and she now lives in Beong Veng village in Kampong Cham province. She is a widow with one child who is attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Thol H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to produce a better crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce a better crop

loans.name: Sambou

texts.en: Mr. Sambou S. is a villager in Sras Pring village in Kampong Cham province. He is married to Mrs. Yoem Savann. They do not have any children. This couple are farmers who cultivate rice on a 2-hectare rice field. Since their plantation field is infertile, Mr. Sambou S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to make his crop more productive

loans.name: Sela

texts.en: Mrs. Sela P. is a farmer who lives in Doun Pen village in Kampong Cham province. Her husband, Mr. Khom Sokha, uses electricity to recharge batteries to earn an income. In this business, he now faces an obstacle because his machine is too old so he needs to spend a lot of money on fuel. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sela P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new machine to generate electricity to recharge  batteries. Mrs. Sela P. is 34 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new machine to generate electricity to recharge batteries

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group of three members, requesting a loan. Mrs. L. grouped the three eligible members and was selected to be leader of the group. She is widowed with two children, one of whom is married. She is a rice farmer who lives in Chamres Village in Siem Reap Province.

This is the third loan for Mrs. L. and the past two loans were repaid on time. To support her family, L. works hard every day to generate revenue; normally she buys rice to stock for re-sale at higher prices. Her business has gone well and now she would like to request a loan to purchase more rice to stock.

The other two members are:

Mrs. L., a rice farmer who needs a loan to buy rice to stock for re-sale;

Mrs. R., a rice farmer who needs a loan to purchase rice to stock to re-sell at a profit.

loans.use: to purchase more rice  to stock

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha Y. is a group leader of five women who all live in Tumnob village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sokha Y. is a pig breeder. Because this business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy three more piglets, and she would use the rest of the money to buy seven chickens for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. San Sak, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Mrs. Sokha Y. is 28 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

Three members in this loan group have monthly payment loans, and two have end-of-term loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK (Kiva's Field Partner) has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three more piglets and seven chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van N., 50, is a widow with six children. Two of them are married and live outside the family home; two daughters have full-time employment at an NGO. One son is a painter and the other one is a mason. Besides her children, she also has an elderly mother living with her. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia.

Van has been selling fish for 20 years, a skill she leaned from her parents. She buys them from her villagers for re-sale at the local market. Van earns about US$ 5 per day.

Van has her own farmland and she wants to grow bananas so she is asking for a loan of US$ 700 in order to purchase a water pump and to buy small banana trees for planting.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump  and  small banana trees

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey D., 42, and her husband, Mr. Vy Son, 38 who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 2000 and have two daughters. One of them attends school and another one is still young. Besides her children, she also has one sister living with her.

Srey has been raising pigs for two years. Her husband has been producing rice wine for one year and milling rice for other villagers to get extra income. The couple is also growing rice. Srey is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to purchase feed for pigs and to purchase fertilizer, diesel, and pay plowing fees for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs, diesel, fertilizer, and to pay plowing fees for growing rice

loans.name: Born

texts.en:
Mr. Born B., 33, and his wife, Mrs. Touch Vorn, 35, married in 1990 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Born has been fishing for 25 years, a skill he learned from his father and a neighbor. His wife has been selling grocery items for one year; she sells them at her own grocery shop below her house. Born’s wife hopes to expand her business so it can become bigger and bigger and she hopes that her children will have full-time employment.

Born is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase more grocery items for his wife to re-sell and to construct walls for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for his wife to re-sell and to construct walls for the grocery shop.

loans.name: Sokkhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkhoeun T., 33, and her husband, Mr. Senghout Chea, 37, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have one daughter who attends school. The daughter assists her with weaving silk when she is free from her studies. Sokkhoeun also has her grandmother living with her.

Sokkhoeun has been a silk weaver for 19 years, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who then takes it to re sell at the market in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Sokkhoeun has also been hired by the villagers to spin silk where she can earn extra income. Her husband has been a mechanic in Phnom Penh for a year.

Sokkhoeun is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase silk material for weaving and to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and a motorbike.

loans.name: Sovanna

texts.en:
Mr. Sovanna S., 26, and his wife were married in 2005. They have a young son. Sovanna has been working as a blacksmith for three years. He buys blacksmith tools and materials from the market at Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. His wife stays at home and takes care their child. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn.

Sovanna hopes to expand his business and that he will be able to support his child and provide him a high level of education. He is applying for a loan of $1000 to purchase blacksmith tools and materials to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Lailo

texts.en:
I. Lailo is 21 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Lailo is a market vendor and sells women's clothing at the local market. After finishing school, she entered university and at the same time, started her own business. She needed money to be able to support her family. Lailo has now been in this business for 4 years. During this time she managed to make her business stable and profitable, generating a regular income for her family and supporting her parents. Now Lailo is planning to expand her business. To do this, she will need to increase her working capital to purchase a larger inventory of clothing to sell. Lailo is requesting a 1000 $US loan for a term of 9 months. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting her.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of women's clothing to expand the business

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: R. Gulchehra is a small entrepreneur in Dushanbe city, Tajikistan. She is married with four children, who are the reason she strives for a better life. She sells women dresses and trousers in a famous local market called “Korvon”. Gulchehra is a very hard-working woman and the main bread winner in the family. She achieves her goals and overcomes challenges with a natural optimism. She is requesting a loan of $ 800 USD for the term of 12 moths to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for resale. Gulchehra's dream is to ensure her children are happy and have a good education. We believe Gulchehra’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture in the past years will guarantee further stable expansion of her trade and timely loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of dresses and trousers and expand her business

loans.name: Sindor

texts.en: Sindor is a 26-year old young man and a father of two children. He is married and his wife is a housekeeper. Sindor has been a professional driver for 5 years. He has been able to buy a passenger bus with his savings from his cattle raising business. Now his main business is providing taxi service to the population of his town. At his home his wife helps him with the livestock. He wants to increase his production and to purchase more cattle to breed. For this reason he has applied to IMON International for a loan of 4000 Somoni. Sindor thanks everyone supporting him and promises to promptly repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing breeding cattle to expand business

loans.name: Aniva

texts.en: Aniva F., 52, is married and has three children.  She has many years experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public people two days per week. Aniva has had two previous loans with SPBD, and these have been her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She plans to use this loan to buy pesticides, fertilizers, chemicals, and bush knives for her plantation business.  The remainder of the loan will be used for buying timbers, cements, bricks and nails for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides, fertilizers, chemicals, and bush knives for plantation business

loans.name: Tausala

texts.en: Tausala T., 18, is a married mother of young children.  She works in the plantation business and sells to the villagers and public people three days per week. This is her first loan from SPBD, which is her only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Tausala plans to purchase pesticides, fertilizers, chemicals, and bush knives to support her plantation business.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides, fertilizers, chemicals, and bush knives for plantation business

loans.name: Tului
