Zonia es casada, tiene 41 años y 5 hijos, Sonia vive en la comunidad de Chumbes en el distrito de Ocros, Sonia se dedica a la compra de tara, cochilla, los productos los adquiere en las diferentes ferias a donde viaja 1 vez por semana, luego los comercializa a intermediarios que llevan el producto a la ciudad de Lima. Además Sonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, verduras. Sonia necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara y cochinilla. Los sueños de Sonia son mejorar sus negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy local produce such as tara and cochinilla for resale in Lima

loans.name: Magali Janette

texts.en:
Magali is a member of the Cielo (“Sky”) Village Bank. She is 33 years old and married with two children. She has a pharmacy called “Farmastar,” which she runs from a rented space on a busy street near a bus terminal in Ayacucho. She has two employees who attend customers. Magalí is a Chemical Pharmacist and also works part time as a university professor. Magali needs a loan of 2100 soles to buy perfume. Her dreams are to open more branch locations, achieve economic stability, and spend more time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Magali es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo. Magali es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Magali tiene una farmacia llamada Farmastar, en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida concurrida y cerca de un terminal terrestre, cuenta con 2 personas que se encargan de la atención. Magali es Químico Farmacéutico y trabaja como docente en una universidad a tiempo parcial. Magali necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumería. Los sueños de Magali es tener mas sucursales, tener seguridad económica y estar mas tiempo con su familia.

loans.use: Buy perfume

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour is 31 years old and married with a child. She sells drinks, frozen foods and foodstuffs. Favour needs the loan amount of 140,000 to purchase more frozen foods and drinks to sell. She is a LAPO client. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Casimira

texts.en:
Casimira is a member of the Magnolia Village Bank. Casimira is 50 years old and married with seven children. She sells hardware items in different regional markets with the help of her children. She also sells clothing in the Las Americas Sunday market. Casimira needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy measuring tapes, tubing and levels. Casimira’s dreams are to open a store in a stable location and for her children to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Casimira es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia. Casimira es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Casimira venD. artículos D. ferretería en las diferentes ferias D. la región, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Además Casimira venD. ropa en la feria D. la América los días domingos. Casimira necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. metro, nivel, caños. Los sueños D. Casimira son tener una tienda estable y que sus hijos salgan adelante.

loans.use: Buy measuring tapes, levels and tubing

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Magnolia Village Bank. Maria is 40 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their daughter. She and her husband work as event photographers for graduations, parties, and other occasions. They deliver their photos to their customers’ homes. Maria needs a loan of 800 soles to buy rolls of film and blank DVDs. Maria’s dreams are to own her own home, to run her business from a stable location, and for her daughter to get a professional degree and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia. Maria es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 1 hija, Maria junto a su esposo se dedican a brindar servicios de fotografías para diferentes eventos, como graduaciones, fiestas, entre otros, luego las fotos los reparte a domicilio. Maria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de rollos, DVD. Los sueños de Maria son tener casa propia, que su hija sea profesional y salga adelante, tener un local estable.

loans.use: Buy rolls of film and blank DVDs

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde sells motor spare parts and engine oil. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of 140,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. Kehinde is 50 years old and married with children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is a member of the Legion Village Bank. Hilda travels to different regional markets on weekends to sell dry goods and buy grains and potatoes. During the week, she works as a cook at a restaurant. Hilda and her husband also own a car, which he uses as a taxi. Hilda needs a loan of 1500 soles to paint the car. Hilda dreams of owning her own restaurant and dry goods store as well as providing her children with a good education. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Legión. Hilda es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Hilda viaja a las diferentes ferias los días sábados y domingos en donD. venD. abarrotes y D. las ferias adquiere cereales, papa, mientras que los demás días trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante. Además Hilda junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realiza transporte publico. Hilda necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido para pintar su carro. Hilda sueña con tener un restaurante, una tienda D. abarrotes y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Paint taxi

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Legion Village Bank. She is 57 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their six children on the outskirts of the city of Ayacucho. Paulina has a dry goods store in her home. She sells dry goods, vegetables, and meat. She works seven days a week, and her granddaughter helps her run the store. Paulina also travels each week to a market where she sells dry goods and buys oranges.

Paulina needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy rice, beer, and sugar. Paulina dreams of improving her business and building a home out of bricks and concrete.

loans.use: Buy rice, beer, and sugar

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is 43 years old and divorced with two children. She sells crates of drinks and foodstuffs. Shola has been in this business since 2004.  She needs a loan of 140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Temina

texts.en:
Temina O. is 63 years old and married with 6 children, all of whom have completed their schooling. Temina has owned a retail kiosk in Bware, Kenya since 2002. She sells items like kerosene, soap, sugar, tealeaves, bread, and milk.

The stock for the kiosk comes from the nearby town of Migori. Temina sells between 500 to 800 KSH worth of goods on a daily basis. She says that the benefits of having a business are that she has been able to pay school fees for her children and that she is able to meet domestic expenses.

Temina is applying for a loan of KSH 22,500 (USD 300). She plans to use the money to improve her business by adding an additional stock of consumables to her inventory in the kiosk.

loans.use: To purchase stock of consumables

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is married and has one daughter. She has been in the business of selling hats and women's underwear for 10 years now. She got involved in selling these particular types of goods because she just loves nice clothing. She started small, but now she has 3 business locations plus one seasonal (summer) location. She works at two locations herself, and has a hired person at the third one. Her monthly gross income is 22,500 UAH, and the net profit is 6,500 UAH.

Zhanna is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She would like a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase 100 hats and 100 underwear sets. This would allow her to increase her sales and profits. Zhanna's personal goal is to increase her profits so she can fix her parent's house and move there from the small apartment where she now lives with her husband and daughter.

loans.use: To purchase 100 hats and 100 underwear sets

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel J. is a 40-year-old man who lives with his wife and 5 children in the Stella B area of the Rongo District in Kenya. His wife is a farmer, and 4 of their 5 children are currently attending school.

Abel runs a community pharmacy, which he started in 2008. He sells painkillers like Panadol and Brufen, among other medications. With the profits from the pharmacy he is able to pay his household expenses. If the business does well, there will also be enough profit to pay for his children’s school fees.

Abel is applying for a loan of KSH 11,250 (USD 150) in order to buy a larger stock of medicine, in order to better serve his community’s health needs and also to increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase stock of medicine

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a member of the Legion Village Bank. She is 43 years old and married with four children.

Carolina travels to regional markets, where she sells vegetables and fruits and buys grains, cheese and potatoes to resell in the Nery Garcia Market. Carolina also raises guinea pigs on her land in Acchapa.

Carolina needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy guinea pigs to raise. Carolina’s dreams are to build her own home and to improve her business.

loans.use: Buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Fortunita

texts.en:
Fortunita is a member of the Legion Village Bank. She is 35 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their four children. 

Fortunita sells different brands of catalogue cosmetics, like Avon and Esika. She sells her products to friends and family members, and also sells them on credit. Fortunita and her husband also own a motorcycle taxi, which they use to transport passengers around the city of Ayacucho.  Fortunita needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy replacement parts for her motorcycle taxi.  

Fortunita’s dreams are to join a formal taxi drivers' association and to buy a car. 



Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Fortunita es socia del Banco Comunal Legión. 
Fortunita es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Fortunita vende cosméticos por catálogos de diferentes lineas como Avon, Esika, sus productos los ofrece a sus amigos, familiares y los vende al crédito. Además Fortunita junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi con el que realiza transporte en la ciudad de Ayacucho. 
Fortunita necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos para la mototaxi. 
Los sueños de Fortunita son integrar su mototaxi en una asociación formal y comprar un carro.

loans.use: Replacement parts for motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a member of the Legion Village Bank. She is 51 years old and is the widowed mother of three children. 

Guadalupe has a stand in the market where she sells grains, which she buys in regional markets. Guadalupe also buys cheese and animals at these regional markets. She slaughters the animals and sells the meat and cheese from door to door.  

Guadalupe needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy rams.  Guadalupe dreams of building a third floor onto her house and of improving her businesses. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Guadalupe es socia del Banco Comunal Legión. 
Guadalupe es viuda, tiene 51 años y 3 hijos, Guadalupe tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende cereales, los que son adquiridos de los feriantes. Además Guadalupe viaja a las ferias en donde compra quesos, animales que luego beneficia y vende de casa en casa. 
Guadalupe necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra carneros. 
Guadalupe sueña con construir el tercer piso de su casa, mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy rams

loans.name: Duidora

texts.en:
Duidora is a member of the Legion Village Bank. She is 35 years old and married with two children. 

Duidora has a replacement parts store in a rented location. Her husband runs an auto repair shop, and her store is located near the shop. Diudora and her husband also have three cars, which they use as part of an inter-district transport company. 

Duidora needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy lights, alternators and starters. Diudora dreams of owning a building for her store and of buying a bigger car to use for inter-district transport. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Duidora es socia del Banco Comunal Legión. 
Duidora es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Diudora tiene una tienda de repuestos en un local alquilado, su esposo tiene un taller de reparación de carros y su tienda esta cerca al taller. Además Duidora junto a su esposo tienen 3 carros que integran a una empresa que realiza transporte a diferentes distritos. 
Duidora necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de luces, arrancadores, alternadores. 
Duidora sueña con tener un  local propio, comprar un carro mas grande para transporte interprovincial.

loans.use: Buy lights, alternators and starters

loans.name: Atanasia

texts.en:
Atanasia is a member of the Legion Village Bank. She is 56 years old and is married with seven children. 

Atanasia has a store in her house, located in the Morro de Arica neighborhood, where she sells dry goods and meat with the help of her daughters.  

Atanasia needs a loan of 1,500 soles to buy rice, sugar and milk.  Atanasia’s dreams are to offer a wider variety of merchandise, have more investment capital and for her children to finish their studies. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Atanasia es socia del Banco Comunal Legión. 
Atanasia es casada, tiene 56 años y 7 hijos, Atanasia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio de Morro de Arica, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijas. 
Atanasia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche. 
Los sueños de Atanasia son surtir su negocio, aumentar su capital y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Martha Luduvina

texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Legion Village Bank. Martha is 41 years old and is separated with three children. 

She has a store in her home, where she sells dry goods seven days a week. Martha also works encouraging adults to learn to read, for which the government pays her a small sum.  

Martha needs a loan of 1,050 soles to buy scaffolding for her store. Martha dreams of offering a wider variety of products in her store and for her children to graduate with professional degrees. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Legión. 
Martha es separada, tiene 41 años y 3 hijos, Martha tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Martha trabaja como promotora de alfabetización a mayores por el cual recibe un pequeño pago. 
Martha necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de andamios para su tienda. 
Martha sueña con surtir con mas productos su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy scaffoldings

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada is a member of the Alianza (“Alliance”) Village Bank. She is 38 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son. 

She and her partner have a workshop where they do different sizes of artistic paintings. They fill custom orders and also have a small school supply store, which her husband runs. Ada is also a teacher at a private school.  

Ada needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy notebooks, pens and paints.  Ada’s dreams are to have a larger business, a large school supply store, and to provide her son with a good education. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Ada es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Ada es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 1 hijo, Ada junto a su pareja tiene un taller de pintura de cuadros artísticos, paneles, su local es alquilado, realizan trabajos a pedidos y en el mismo local tienen una pequeña librería que es atendido por su esposo. Ada es docente en un colegio particular.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pens and paints

loans.name: Iris Mercedes

texts.en:
Iris is a member of the Alianza (“Alliance”) Village Bank. She is 53 years old and is married with four children.

Iris and her husband have a clock store, located on one of Ayacucho’s central streets. Her husband is a technician and repairs clocks in addition to selling new clocks and clock parts, which he acquires in Lima.  

Iris needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy replacement parts and batteries.  Iris dreams of buying a plot of land, and that her son will finish his studies and travel to Lima to continue his education by further specializing in one area. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Iris es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza. 
Iris es casada, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Iris junto a su esposo tienen una relojería que esta ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en local alquilado, su esposo es técnico y brinda servicios de reparaciones, venta de relojes, repuestos, sus productos los adquieren en la ciudad de Lima. 
Iris necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos y pilas. 
Iris sueña con que su hijo culmine su carrera y se vaya a especializar a la ciudad de Lima y comprar un terreno.

loans.use: To buy replacement parts and batteries

loans.name: Blanca Gloria

texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Alianza (“Alliance”) Village Bank. She is 40 years old and is married with four children. 

Blanca travels to the Ayacuchan jungle twice per week to sell vegetables and cheese and buy coca leaves, which she brings back to the city of Ayacucho to sell in the Nery Garcia Market.  

Blanca needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy vegetables.  Blanca dreams of improving her business and that her daughters will get ahead in life. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Blanca es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza. 
Blanca es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Blanca viaja a la selva ayacuchana viaja 2 veces por semana, en donde vende verduras, quesos y de la selva compra hoja de coca que lo vende en el mercado Nery García. 
Blanca necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras. 
Blanca sueña con que sus hijas salgan adelante y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the Orquideas (“Orchids”) Village Bank. Lucila is 34 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their four children. Lucila lives in Vilcashuaman Province, located five hours from the city of Ayacucho. 

Lucila has a store in her home, where she sells dry goods, fruit and meat. She and her husband also own a car, which they use for inter-provincial transport. 

Lucila needs a loan of 2,550 soles to buy milk, rice and sugar.  Lucila’s dreams are to educate her children and to expand her businesses. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Lucila es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas. 
Lucila es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Lucila vive en la provincia de Vilcashuaman que se ubica a 5 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Lucila tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, carnes. Además Lucila junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realiza transporte interprovincial. 
Lucila necesita un préstamo de 2550 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar. 
Los sueños de Lucila son educar a sus hijos, hacer crecer sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy milk, rice and sugar

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Orquideas (“Orchids”) Village Bank.  Felicitas is 56 years old and is married with nine children. She lives in Vilcashuaman Province, located five hours from the city of Ayacucho. 

Felicitas sells a variety of clothing, both traditional and modern, in Vilcashuaman’s regional markets. Felicitas also farms potatoes and quinoa. 

 Felicitas needs a loan of 2,100 soles to buy sneakers and hats.  Felicitas dreams of educating all of her children, of expanding her business and of offering a wider variety of merchandise. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas. 
Felicitas es casada, tiene 56 años y 9 hijos, Felicitas vive en la provincia D. Vilcashuaman que se ubica a 5 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Felicitas venD. ropa variada y también típica, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias D. la zona. Además Felicitas se dedica a la agricultura D. papas, quinua. 
Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. zapatillas y sombreros. 
Felicitas sueña con educar a todos sus hijos, ampliar y surtir sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy sneakers and hats

loans.name: Sillah K.

texts.fr: Né le 10 Octobre 1980, M. M. K. Sillah est marié et a trois (03) personnes à charge. C’est un homme très entreprenant qui s’est lancé très tôt  dan le commerce dès qu’il abandonna les études. Il détient aujourd’hui une boutique d’alimentation générale dans le quartier Nkafu à Lomé. N’arrivant plus à satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle très nombreuse par insuffisance de ses moyens financiers, il sollicite un financement pour approvisionner suffisamment sa boutique. Cet apport financier lui permettra de faire face aux demandes de ses clients, d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born on October 10, 1980, M. Sillah K. M. is married and has three persons to support. He's a very enterprising man who started his business early on, just after dropping out of school. Today, he owns a grocery store in the Nkafu neighborhood in Lomé. Unable to satisfy the needs of his numerous clients due to a lack of financial means, he's seeking a loan to buy supplies for his shop. This will enable him to meet customer demand, and to increase both his revenue and his income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for his shop

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.fr: Mr Mathieu L. est né le 21 Octobre 1984 à Lomé. Artiste Perlier de métier, il est marié et père de famille. Il détient un atelier boutique dans lequel il vend des perles et des pagnes pour femmes. C’est une activité qui lui rapporte beaucoup en terme de bénéfice, mais il est souvent confronté à une rupture de stock faute de moyens financier. Pour remédier à cette situation, il demande un crédit pour constituer un stock de pagnes et de perles afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clientes. Cela lui permettra de rentabiliser son commerce et d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr Mathieu L. was born in Lomé, on October 21, 1984. A trained pearl artist, he's married and the father of a family. He owns a workshop where he sells pearls and pagnes (colorful African cloth) for women. His business brings in a great deal, but he often finds himself out of stock due to a lack of financial means. To remedy this situation, he's seeking a loan to purchase a stock of pagnes and pearls, in order to meet customer demand. This will enable him to make his business more profitable, and to increase his income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes and pearls

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 46 años, es madre de 4 hijos y vive con su esposo quien la apoya en lo posible. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas, en una esquina cercana a su casa, labor que realiza desde hace 3 años, y que le gusta, por el trato directo que tiene con sus clientes, además, este negocio le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar, una zona por donde transitan muchas personas y cuenta con una clientela selecta que degustan de lo que ella prepara.  Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir su ramada (techo a base de palos y ramas) y ambientar adecuadamente el lugar donde vende para tener mayor comodidad y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old, the mother of 4 children, and lives with her husband who supports her as much as possible. She has worked for the past 3 years selling food and drinks on a street corner close to her house. She likes this work because of the direct contact she has with her customers, because the business is very profitable as it is well located in an area where many people pass by, and because her select clientele enjoy the food which she prepares. With this loan she wants to order the construction of a ramada (an open or semi-enclosed shelter roofed with brush or branches designed to provide shade), and to decorate her stall for greater comfort so as to offer her customers a warmer welcome.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop a better space for the sale of her food

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Née le  07 Décembre 1972, Mme Essi B. est mariée à un charpentier et est mère de trois (03) enfants. N’ayant appris un métier après avoir abandonné ses études, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de « cuire dents », un bois très prisé et habituellement utilisé en Afrique pour se brosser les dents. Cette activité lui rapporte beaucoup de bénéfices lui permettant de faire face aux besoins de sa famille. Pour augmenter encore davantage ses revenus et mieux satisfaire ses clients, il sollicite un crédit pour afin d’aller s’approvisionner suffisamment dans les pays voisins notamment au Ghana où ce bois abonde.
texts.en:
Born on December 7, 1972, Mrs. Essi B. is married to a carpenter and the mother of 3 children. Having never learned a job after dropping out of school, she started selling "cuire dents" (a wood used to make chewing sticks), a wood highly sought after in Africa and used to clean one's teeth. This business brings in a great deal and enable her to provide for her family. To increase her income and to better meet customer demand, she's seeking a loan to purchase sufficient supplies in the surrounding countries, in particular in Ghana where this wood is found aplenty.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies of "cuire dents" (a wood used to make chewing sticks)

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura tiene 32 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo que estudia y la apoya mucho. Ella trabaja cuidando ancianos en un albergue, y por las noches o en momentos libres vende golosinas, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año y le gusta hacerlo porque se relaciona con muchas personas. El deseo de Laura es contar con una vivienda adecuada y segura para su hijo, es por ello que con este crédito, que es el segundo que tiene con MFP quiere comprar materiales de construcción para ir poco a poco levantando su casa.
texts.en:
Laura is 32 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her son who is in school and who supports her a lot. She works caring for the elderly in a hostel, and in the evenings and during her spare time she sells candy and snacks. She has been doing this work for one year and enjoys it because she interacts with many people. Laura hopes to one day have a secure home for her son. She will use this loan, the second loan that she has received from MFP, to buy construction materials to gradually build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la foto es hija del señor ya que el se encuentra a trabajando todo el día.
 El señor Ramiro P. M. es un cliente que  por tercera ocasión nos pide otro préstamo por lo que se recomienda ya que en los anteriores  créditos pago puntualmente.
El nuevo préstamo lo quiere para seguir ampliando su casa ya que donde vive son casas muy pequeñas y las recamaras también y al ver que ya esta creciendo la familia comenta que la casa debería estar más grande. El es trabaja en un taller donde se recibe material que ya no sirve como partes de carros, su esposa se dedica a trabajar en una tienda de abarrotes y su hija también les ayuda con lo gastos la cual trabaja en maquiladora. 
Comentan estar agradecidos de los préstamos. Y la cantidad que solicitan es de $15,000 pesos.
texts.en:
The photo above shows the daughter of Ramiro P. M., as he works all day and couldn't be photographed. This is the third time that Ramiro has sought a loan through FVP, and he is recommended for a loan as he has been punctual with his previous repayments. He will use the new loan to continue expanding his home, as the houses in the area where he lives are very small. The rooms in the houses are also very small, and as his family is growing they need a larger house. He works in a workshop where he receives materials that no longer function such as car parts. His wife works in a grocery store, and his daughter also helps her parents with living expenses as she works in an export factory. His family is very thankful for the loans they have received. They are seeking a loan of 15,000 pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for construction materials and labour

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr: Mr Idrissou M. est célibataire née le 10 Avril 1974 et réside actuellement à Agoè Asiyéyé dans la banlieue Nord de Lomé où il gère une boutique d’alimentation générale qui marche très bien. Il souhaite augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir disposer suffisamment de moyens financiers pour faire face à la demande sans cesse de ses clients. Pour y arriver, il sollicite un financement. Cet apport financier va sûrement doper son commerce et augmenter considérablement ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Idrissou M. was born on April 10, 1974 and is unmarried. He currently resides in Agoè Asiyéyé in the Nord suburb of Lomé, where he manages a grocery store that is doing very well. He would like to increase his working capital in order to have sufficient financial means for addressing the ever-present demands of his customers. To achieve this, he is requesting financing. This financial provision is surely going to boost his business and to increase his income considerably.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his shop with merchanise

loans.name: Dilsa

texts.es: Dilsa tiene 49 años, es madre de 3 hijos, siendo 2 de ellos independientes, vive en la actualidad con la última de sus hijas y con su esposo quien se encuentra mal de salud. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 15 años en las instalaciones de su domicilio, lo que le gusta de esta actividad es estar en contacto con sus clientes con quienes comparte muchos diálogos y hace muchas amistades. Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una muy buena zona y le va muy bien, pero por la salud de su esposo, ella tiene que velar por el sustento de su casa, lo que suele ser una carga pesada para Dilsa, pero el amor por su familia le da ánimos para continuar. Este ya es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy responsable con su grupo y sus pagos. Con el dinero que requiere ampliará su bodega y comprará más productos para surtirse con lo necesario.
texts.en:
Dilsa is 49 years old, the mother of 3 children, 2 of them are independent, she currently lives with the youngest of her daughter's and her husband who is in ill health. She has sold groceries for 15 years in her home. What she enjoys about her job is to be in contact with her customers with which she has many conversations with and has made many friends. This business is very profitable, as it is located in a very good area so it is doing very well. Due to her husband’s health, she has to ensure the livelihood of her household, which tends to be a heavy burden for Dilsa, but the love of her family gives her the will to continue. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and throughout all this time she has proven to be very responsible with her group and with payments. With the money she requests she will expand her store and buy more products as necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase assortment of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
La casa del señor Edmundo Jiménez Martínez esta en muy malas condiciones el cual nos pide la ayuda para que se le pueda dar un préstamo como pueden observar en la fotografía a la vivienda el falta ventanas, arreglo de puertas y   otros pequeños detalles.
El  es una persona trabajadora pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para hacerlo lo que el solicita es la cantidad de $2,500 pesos.
texts.en:
Mr. Edmundo M. J.’s house is in very poor conditions for which he has asked for help so that he can receive a loan. As you can see in the picture, his home is missing windows, doors and other small details. He is a hard working person but what he earns is not enough to make these improvements. He requests a loan for the amount of $2,500 pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase doors and windows

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos tiene 30 años, es padre de un hijo pequeño, vive con su conviviente quien lo ayuda mucho. Su dedicación al transporte de pasajeros lo viene haciendo desde hace 10 años atrás, a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a  muchas personas con quien comparte ideas y les dar un trato amable a sus pasajeros para que se sientan a gusto y seguros en el viaje, además le trae buenas ganancias porque el mismo maneja el motocarro y lo administra. Lo complicado es tener que lidiar con la competencia, es por eso que en ocasiones trabaja temporalmente comprando y vendiendo madera. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y sigue comprometido en ser puntual en sus pagos, como lo ha sido hasta el momento. Con el dinero que solicita reparará su motocarro que tiene algunos desperfectos.
texts.en:
Marcos is 30 years old, is the father of a young son, and lives with his partner who helps him a great deal. Since he owns a motorcycle, his job for the last 10 years has been the transport of passengers. What he likes about his work is that he knows many people whom he also shares ideas with. He is friendly to his passengers because he wants to make them feel comfortable and safe on their trips. It also brings good profits because he drives and manages the motorcycle. The difficulty is having to deal with the competition, that's why he occasionally works temporarily buying and selling timber. This is his second loan with MFP and remains committed to being punctual in his payments, as he has been so far. With the money he requests he will repair some damages to his motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to his motorcycle

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Né à Tovégan en 1970, Mr Kodjo AM. est marié et a à sa charge trois (03) enfants. Son activité principale est la couture, métier qu’il a appris dès qu’il eu abandonné les études. Cette activité lui procure de maigres revenus qui ne lui permettent pas de subvenir régulièrement aux charges de sa famille. Ainsi il sollicite un crédit lui permettant de promouvoir son activité par l’achat de nouvelles machines à coudre et l’amélioration de son cadre de travail. Cela lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de subvenir convenablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Tovégan in 1970, Mr. Kodjo AM. is married and has three children to support. He's a tailor, a job he learned after dropping out of school. This business provides him a meager income, that does not enable him to support his family on a regular basis. He's therefore seeking this loan to bolster his business, by improving his work environment and by purchasing new sewing machines. This will enable him to increase his income to properly support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machines

loans.name: Wendy Berenice

texts.es:
Wendy Berenice C. Domínguez desea colocar protecciones en las ventanas de su casa por la razón de que donde vive es una colonia nueva y aun no conoce a sus vecinos. Ella  teme que en el momento de irse a trabajar alguna persona con malas intenciones pueda hacer daños a sus hijos. Solicita la cantidad de $6,000 pesos.
Wendy y su esposo trabajan en maquiladora y con estos ingresos pagaran el préstamo
otorgado.
texts.en:
Wendy C. Berenice D. wants to place window guards on her new home’s windows because she lives in a new neighborhood and she does not know her neighbors. She fears that when she goes to work someone with bad intentions will harm her children. She requests the amount of $6,000 pesos. Wendy and her husband work in an assembly plant and this revenue they will help repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase window guards

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Mlle Colette D. est née à Lomé. Célibataire avec un (01) enfant, elle s’est lancée très tôt dans la vente de boissons légères et de sucreries. Très dynamique et dévouée, elle gère bien son activité et sollicite un financement pour se ravitailler en grande quantité auprès des grossistes afin de pouvoir répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Cela lui permettra également d’augmenter ses revenus et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Colette D., age 38, was born in Lomé. She's unmarried and has one child. Early on, she started selling soft drinks and candies. Very energetic and devoted, she's good at running her business. She's seeking a loan to purchase large supplies from wholesalers, in order to meet customer demand. This will enable her to increase her income and to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large supplies of soft drinks

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil es soltero, vive solo en su casa propia. Se dedica a brindar servicios de mecánica para motos en un espacio que implementó en su casa, lo viene haciendo desde hace 6 años. A Oscar le gusta dejar muy bien arregladas las motos que repara para que los usuarios confíen en él y lo recomienden con otras personas, e ir incrementado su clientela, además, por encontrarse ubicado en una zona muy transitada obtiene buenas ganancias por su trabajo, aunque que es cansado, pero le trae satisfacciones. Es la primera vez que recurre a MFP para obtener un crédito, y está muy entusiasmado y comprometido con su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar herramientas para implementar mejor su taller.
texts.en:
Oscar is 47 years old, is unmarried and lives by himself in his own home. He works as a motorcycle mechanic from a workshop he installed at his house, and he has been doing this for the past 6 years. Oscar enjoys repairing motorcycles, and he is growing his client base as his customers trust him and recommend him to others. Additionally he earns a good living from his work as he is located in an area where many people pass by, and although his job is tiring it also rewarding. This is the first time that Oscar has turned to MFP for a loan. He is very excited and committed to his community bank. He will use the loan to buy tools to better equip his workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for his workshop

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Mme Rose L. est née le 23 Août 1970 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire avec deux (02) enfants. Commerçante de boissons, de fruits et d’arachides grillés, elle fait toujours preuve d’un dynamisme dans cette activité. Bonne gestionnaire et maîtrisant bien son activité, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’agrandir son étalage. Ceci pourra augmenter ses bénéfices et contribuer davantage à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie et de celles de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rose L. was born in Lomé on August 23, 1970. She's unmarried and has two children. She sells beverages, fruits, and roasted peanuts, and she's always very energetic. A good manager, she excels in her business. She's seeking a loan to enlarge her stand, in order to increase her profit and to better contribute to improving her living conditions and those of her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell beverages and fruits

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús R. L. es una persona que piensa en el futuro de sus 4 hijos por el momento  no cuenta  con dinero para pagar la colegiatura de su hija. En la escuela donde ella esta es particular y si no paga no podrá presentar sus exámenes; lo cual a  la joven le afectaría en sus calificaciones. El padre preocupado por el bienestar de su hija desea que termine su preparatoria y el pide la cantidad de $7,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Jesús R. L. has four children and he worries about their future. He does not have money to pay for his daughter's tuition. She attends a strict school: if he does not pay her tuition, she will not be allowed to write her exams which will affect her marks. He is concerned for his daughter's welfare and he wants her to finish high school so he is asking for $7000 pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay his daughter's high school tuition

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Née en 1976 à Lomé, Mme Enyonam A. est marié et a deux (02) enfants. Elle coiffeuse de formation et a ouvert un atelier de coiffure à Lomé dans le quartier de Kégué. Cette activité qu’elle exerce avec beaucoup de dévouement lui permet tant bien que mal de subvenir à ses propres besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Aujourd’hui sa clientèle s’accroît et elle est confrontée à un manque crucial de matériels de travail. Aussi sollicite-t-elle un financement pour acheter des séchoirs électriques, des mèches et d’autres produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Born in 1976, at Lomé, Mrs. Enyonam A. is married with two children. She is a trained hair dresser and has opened a hair dressing shop in the Lomé suburb of Kégué. She is very dedicated to this business, which more or less provides for her needs and those of her family. Now, her clientele has increased and she is faced with a shortage of working materials. She is requesting a loan to purchase electric hair dryers, hair extensions and other cosmetic products.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase electric hair dryers, hair extensions and other cosmetic products.

loans.name: Mama Sokou

texts.fr: Mme M. S. est née en 1976. Elle est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de légumes et poissons fumés, une activité très rentable qui lui permet d’aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. C’est une femme qui aime énormément son activité. Elle veut renforcer son commerce et sollicite pour cela un financement qui lui permettra d’accroître considérablement ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. S. was born in 1976. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a reseller of vegetables and smoked fish, a profitable business that enables her to assist her husband with meeting the financial needs of the family. This lady greatly enjoys her business. M. S. is requesting a loan to strengthen her business which would allow her to increase her income.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies of vegetables and smoked fish

loans.name: Tchilabalo

texts.fr: Né le 09 Septembre 1980 à Lomé, Mr Tchilabalo G. est un jeune célibataire qui a, à force de courage et de détermination, une petite unité d’élevage de volailles pondeuses. C’est une activité qui lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge. Mais depuis un certain moment il est confronté à des difficultés telles que la chute des pontes et l’écoulement difficile des produits. Tout ceci est causé par la mauvaise alimentation des volailles. Pour y remédier, il sollicite un financement qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner suffisamment en provendes et en médicament pour volailles et agrandir son exploitation. Cela va contribuer à une augmentation des pontes et des ventes.
texts.en:
Born on September 9, 1980 in Lomé, Mr. Tchilabalo G. is a young and unmarried man who has, by courage and determination, a small business raising egg-laying hens. It brings in revenues that allow him to support himself. But for a time now, he has been confronted with difficulties, such as a drop in the number of eggs produced and low product turnover. All of this is caused by poorly fed poultry. To remedy the situation, he is requesting financing that will allow him to acquire sufficient poultry feed and medicine and to expand his farm. This will help increase his egg production and sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For supplies of feed and medicine for poultry

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Mme Kokoè H. est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Depuis plus de quinze (15) ans, elle fait le commerce de stockage et de vente de céréales notamment le mais, le mil et le haricot. C’est une activité très florissante qui lui procure suffisamment de revenus et de bénéfices. Toutefois elle ne dispose pas d’un magasin propice et convenable pour stocker ses céréales. Pour cela, elle sollicite un financement pour louer un magasin et constituer un stock suffisant de céréales afin de répondre aux sollicitations de ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kokoè H. is married and mother of six children. For more than 15 years she has stockpiled and sold cereals, notably corn, millet, and haricots. This is a very profitable job which provides her with sufficient revenue. However, she does not have a suitable storehouse in which to store these cereals. This is why she is requesting a loan to rent a storehouse and build up a sufficient supply of cereals so she can meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stockpiling and selling of cereals

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Né le 11 Mai 1977 à Noepé dans la préfecture de l’Avé au Sud Togo, Mr Kokou A. est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. Il est cordonnier de métier et exerce depuis plusieurs années cette activité avec dévouement. Toutefois, il mène cette activité dans des conditions difficiles : manque de matériels de travail et de local pour son atelier. Pour cela ; il demande un crédit pour louer un atelier et s’équiper en matériel de travail. Cela va relancer  son activité et accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born on May 11, 1977 in Noepé in the Avé prefecture in south Togo, Mr. Kokou A. is married and the father of one child. He is a cobbler by trade and has been dedicated to his trade for several years. However, he works in difficult conditions: namely, a lack of work equipment for his workshop. This is why he is requesting a loan to rent a workshop and to purchase the work equipment he needs. This will revive his business and increase his revenue.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renting a workshop and purchasing work equipment

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Née le 18 Mars 1953, Mme Philomène S. est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. Elle revendeuse de la farine de manioc « gari » et de tapioca. Cette femme dynamique mène cette activité depuis plus de treize (13) ans qui lui apporte suffisamment de revenus pour aider son mari à supporter les dépenses de leur famille. Aujourd’hui elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de faire face aux besoins de ses clients. Ce financement va doper son commerce et accroître ses recettes et bénéfices.
texts.en:
Born on 18 March 1953, Mrs. Philomène S. is married and has seven (07) children. She is a retailer of manioc flour (called 'gari') and tapioca. This dynamic woman has run her business for more than thirteen (13) years, and this business brings her enough income to help her husband in meeting the household expenses. Currently she is asking for a loan to supply herself with merchandise in order to meet the needs of her clients. This loan will boost her business and increase her revenue and profit.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell manioc flour and tapioca

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Lomé, Mme M. Aissatou est une revendeuse de produits de beauté. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du foyer grâce  aux revenus de sa vente. En vue d’agrandir son activité et mieux satisfaire sa  clientèle, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de renforcer ses activités en s’approvisionnant en marchandises. Les revenus tirés de ses affaires lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Lomé, Mrs. Aissatou M. sells beauty products. A married mother of three (3) children, she is able to contribute to the household expenses thanks to the income from her sales. With the aim of enlarging her business and better satisfying her clientele, she is asking for a loan which will allow her to strengthen her sales by supplying herself with merchandise. The income drawn from her business will allow her to better meet the needs of her family and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell beauty products

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Mme W. Antoinette est née en 1968 à Lomé. Mariée, elle a à sa charge trois (03) enfants et a pour activité principale l’alimentation générale. Très courageuse et dynamique, elle est très bien appréciée dans son milieu. Afin de continuer à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en produits alimentaires. Elle pourra donc augmenter son revenu et assurer  l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antoinette W. was born in 1968 in Lomé. She is married and has three children. Her business is in the general food domain. Very courageous and dynamic, she is extremely appreciated for what she does. In order to continue meeting her customers’ needs, she is requesting a loan so she can stock up in food products. She will therefore be able to increase her revenue and to make sure her children receive an education.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up in merchandise

loans.name: Akesa

texts.en: Akesa K., 30, is married with three children.  She has two years of experience in the business of selling snacks, drinks, ice-cake and pancakes. She sells to the school, villagers, and the public five days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about US$187).  SPBD loans are Akesa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Her husband is self-employed and also earns money to help out the family and the business.

loans.use: Purchase cups, sugar, plastic bags, and flavor

loans.name: Amu

texts.en: Amu M., 36, is married with four children.  She has four years of experience in the Plantation and Vegetable Garden business. She sells to the villagers and the public four days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about US$187).  SPBD loans are Amu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She also works on a peanut farm for extra money.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides as well as fertilizers and vegetable seeds for maintaining the good growth of the business

loans.name: Ivapene

texts.en: Ivapene L., 44, is married with seven children.  She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the villagers, families, and public six days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about US$208).  SPBD loans are Ivapene’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to purchase a new hand sewing machine, fabrics, needles, threads, and materials. Part of the loan will be used to buy timber, cement, bricks, nails, and iron roofs for improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase a new hand sewing machine, fabrics, needles, threads, and materials

loans.name: Tofia

texts.en: Tofia L., 29, is married with one child.  She has many years of experience selling vegetables and fruit. She sells to the villagers and the public four days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 420 Tala (about US$175).  SPBD loans are Tofia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Her husband is a carpenter who also helps run the business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides as well as fertilizers and vegetable seeds for maintaining the growth of the business

loans.name: Gataiala

texts.en: Gataiala A., 54, is married with 10 children.  She has many years of experience selling vegetables and fruit. She sells to the villagers, the public, and families four days per week. She has four previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about US$250).  SPBD loans are Gataiala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. In addition to funding the growth of her business, part of the loan will be used to buy timber, cement, bricks, nails, and iron roofing for improving her living conditions. Gataiala and her husband also have a cattle farm that provides some income.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides as well as fertilizers and vegetable seeds to maintain the growth of the business

loans.name: Pisa

texts.en: Pisa O. V., 50, is married with five children.  She has many years of experience in the farming business. She sells to the villagers and to the general public three days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 4 Tala (about US$1).  SPBD loans are Pisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase Gromoxone, sting, chemicals, bush knives, and seedlings

loans.name: Tauva

texts.en: Tauva A., 56, is widowed with one child.  She has four years of experience selling general goods from her shop. She sells to the public and to villagers six days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about US$250).  SPBD loans are Tauva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She also has a farm run by an employee, and this helps augment her income from the shop.

loans.use: Re-stocking of the shop

loans.name: Fuli

texts.en: Fuli L., 38, is married with two children.  She has many years of experience selling handicrafts such as Samoan bags and hats, printed materials, and bowls. She sells to the villagers and to the general public five days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (about US$229).  SPBD loans are Fuli’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for making her products, such as handicrafts and printed materials

loans.name: Leemo

texts.en: Leemo T., 40, is married with one child.  She has three years of experience selling elei and printing materials. She sells to regular clients as well as to family and friends three days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 650 Tala (about US$270).  SPBD loans are Leemo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Her husband also works and helps her financially when business is slow.

loans.use: To buy paintings, brushes, stencils, carving wood, and materials

loans.name: Fagaee

texts.en: Fagaee S. F., 22, is married with no children.  She has two years of experience selling vegetables and fruit. She sells to the villagers and and to the general public 3 days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about US$180).  SPBD loans are Fagaee’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used primarily to buy chemicals and pesticides as well as fertilizers and vegetable seeds to maintain the growth of the business. The rest of the loan will be used to buy timber, cement, bricks, and nails for home improvement. Her husband is working and also helps run the business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and pesticides as well as fertilizers and vegetable seeds to maintain the growth of the business

loans.name: Alberto Cayetano

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Alberto Cayetano se dedica a su negocio de venta de queso el cual es comercializado en el mercado municipal donde es visitado por sus clientes que le compran el queso en su establecimiento.

El señor Cayetano tiene la responsabilidad de mantener su familia y su humilde hogar de habitación y es esta la razón por la cual se esfuerza grandemente en el negocio de la venta del queso. Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra del queso  para continuar comercializándolo en el mercado municipal de Somotillo y de esta forma mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Alberto Cayetano sells cheese from his store in the municipal market where his customers come to buy his cheese. Mr. Cayetano is responsible for taking care of his humble home and for this reason, as he is running out of cheese to sell, he is asking for Ceprodel's help with a loan to buy more cheese for resale in the market of Somotillo and thus keep his business open.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 37 años, es madre de 2 hijos y vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda en lo posible. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, leche, pan, entre otros productos de consumo masivo) en la tienda que implementó en su casa, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace un año, y le gusta mucho atender al público y hacer amigos. En su zona es la única que vende estos productos, por lo que son sus vecinos sus principales clientes. Con éste, ya son 12 créditos que obtiene María de MFP, y se ha caracterizado por ser una clienta muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita ampliará su bodega y la ambientará adecuadamente para que sea más atractiva a la vista y tenga una buena distribución de sus productos.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old, has two children and lives with her husband who helps her as much as he can. She sells staples such as rice, milk, and bread in the store she opened in her home. She has been doing this for a year and she enjoys taking care of the public and making friends. She is the only one selling these products in her area, and her clients are her neighbours. This will be the 12th loan María has received from MFP and she has always been very punctual with her payments. She will use the loan to expand her store, to decorate it so that it will be more attractive, and to better display her wares.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
El Señor Cesar S. desde hace 10 años se dedica a su negocio de taller de torno atendido en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes en un local muy pequeño y con pocas condiciones de movilización. Por esta razón es que el señor Cesar ha decidido invertir en la ampliación de la vivienda para ampliar el local de trabajo donde se desempeña.

Es por este motivo que hoy en día necesita la compra de los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo la remodelación de su vivienda por medio de la ampliación del local del negocio y para esto ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel el cual le beneficia por medio de créditos usados exclusivamente para la compra de los materiales de construcción de su vivienda. Con este crédito logrará mejorar su local y además permitirá dar un mejor servicio a los clientes en su local.
texts.en:
Cesar S. is a lathe operator, a business which he runs from his home. His workshop is extremely small, and does not allow him to much space to move. Because of this, Cesar has decided to invest in the expansion of his home to allot more space to his business. He needs to buy construction materials to finish remodeling his home and expand his workshop. He is asking for Ceprodel's help in the form of a loan to be used exclusively for the purchase of construction materials for his home. He will improve his work area with this loan and will be able to provide his customers with better service in his workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela tiene 40 años, es madre soltera, vive con su único hijo quien cursa estudios universitarios. Se dedica a la venta de comida, jugos, hamburguesas y refrescos, en las afueras de un centro de salud muy cercano a su casa. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace un año atrás y le va muy bien, ya que por ser un lugar público son varias las personas que al salir o entrar del establecimiento se detienen a comer al paso en el pequeño puesto de Estela, además ella procura que todos los alimento estén bien conservados y limpios, por lo que sus clientes confían en ella. Este es su 11avo crédito con MFP y en el transcurso de todo este tiempo y los préstamos anteriores, ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a ampliar su pequeño kiosco, comprar sillas y mesas para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estela is 40 years old, a single mother, and she lives with her only son who studies at the university. She sells food, juices, hamburgers, and refreshments outside a health center very near her home. She has been in this business for a year and it is going very well, as being a public place there are many people that come and go in this establishment so they stop to eat something from Estela’s small stand. In addition she makes sure all the food is prepared well and her stand is clean, so her customers trust her. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she has been punctual with her payments in her previous loans. With the money she wants to expand her small kiosk, buy chairs and tables in order to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her kiosc and buy furniture

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 52 años, vive con sus dos hijos que son independientes y de familia y con su esposo. Hace 8 años que se dedica a la venta de jugos y sándwiches en su casa, inició con este negocio debido a que notó que en la zona en que está ubicada hay gran tránsito de personas, y no fue una mala idea, por lo contrario este humilde negocio le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, no solo porque le gusta conversar con las personas que se acercan a comprar su comida, sino también porque su economía a mejorado a raíz de esta actividad, por lo que se siente feliz en realizarla. Hace casi 5 años que recurrió por primera vez a MFP y está muy contenta por su permanencia en su banco comunal, este ya es su crédito número 11. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un kiosco fuera de su casa para tener mayor comodidad para vender.
texts.en:
Juana is 52 years old, lives with her two grown children who have their respective families and her husband. She has been selling juices and sandwiches for 8 years. She began this business because she noticed that there is a lot of pedestrian traffic in her area, so this wasn’t such a bad idea, and on the contrary this humble business has brought much satisfaction, not only because she likes to talk with the people who buy her food but also because her income has improved because of this business, so she is very happy to have this work. She approached MFP for the first time 5 years ago, and she is very happy to be a member of the communal bank, this is her 11th loan. With the money she will build a kiosk outside of her house in order to have greater convenience to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosc for her business

loans.name: Erickson

texts.es: Erickson tiene 22 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos. Hace 2 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro, él es dueño de uno de estos vehículos y también el chofer D. mismo. Manejar la moto durante casi todo el día es una labor muy agotadora, no solo por el esfuerzo físico y el calor sofocante de la selva, sino que también debe mantenerse alerta para llevar con seguridad a sus pasajeros de una zona a otra. Este medio de transporte es muy común en esta región D. Perú y por ello debe lidiar cada día con la competencia, pero como el aun no tiene muchos gastos familiares, puede ahorrar para el futuro. Erickson en un joven muy responsable, no por nada es apreciado en su banco comunal y viene teniendo el 5to préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que esta vez requiere mandará a reparar su motocarro, así como también invertir en el negocio de madera de su padre.
texts.en:
Erickson is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents and two siblings. He has been transporting passengers in his motorcar for 2 years. He owns one of the vehicles and he himself drives it. He drives the motorcar almost all day. It is exhausting work, not only for the physical effort and suffocating heat of the jungle, but also because he needs to remain alert for the safe transportation of his passengers from one area to another. This mode of transportation is very common in this region of Peru and so he needs to battle every day with his competition, but as he does not yet have many family expenses, he can save for his future. Erickson is a very responsible young man, and he is appreciated in his communal bank and is seeking his 5th loan with MFP. With the money he is seeking this time he will repair his motorcar as well as invest in his father’s wood business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his motorcar

loans.name: Gloria Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Filomena S. es una dama muy trabajadora que ha logrado mantener a sus cinco hijos en edad escolar brindándoles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Ella habita en el municipio de Somotillo donde tiene su propia vivienda y ha iniciado a reconstruirla y para ello ha hecho uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales de construcción para su vivienda.

Hoy en día, con muchos esfuerzos por continuar la obra de reconstrucción de su vivienda ha decidido continuar con esta actividad ya que al haberse detenido la reconstrucción era para buscar el dinero para la compra de los materiales. Sin embargo una vez mas ha decidido iniciar y para ello ha buscado nuevamente el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así proporcionarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria Filomena S. is a very hard-working woman who has been taking care of her five school-age children by providing for them. She lives in the municipality of Somotillo where she owns her own home. She had already begun rebuilding her home with a loan she received from Ceprodel to buy construction materials. Today, after much effort, she has decided to continue the rebuilding of her home which had been paused due to a lack of money to buy building materials. She has decided once more to ask Ceprodel's help for a loan to buy more construction materials so that she can give her children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen tiene 25 años, es madre de una hija y vive con su pareja. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de cobertizos, estos son muy útiles en su región, ya que por ser zona selva, hay lluvias muy fuertes y también un intenso sol, por lo que casi todos los negocios al aire libre requieren de estas cubiertas. Karen es una madre muy trabajadora, además por su gran carisma y amabilidad en tratar a sus clientes, la recomiendan y aumenta sus ventas cada vez más. Por lo que está segura que seguir invirtiendo en este negocio le traerá buenos frutos en el futuro. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y sigue comprometida en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con la cantidad solicitada alquilará un local para almacenar sus cobertizos y estén protegidos del clima, además de tener mayor comodidad para guardarlos.
texts.en:
Karen is 25 years old, has a daughter and lives with a partner. She has been selling tarps for a year. These are very useful in her area, because being in the jungle zone there are very strong rains and intense sun, so almost all the open air business require these coverings. Karen is a hard-working mother, in addition because of her great charisma and friendliness with her customers, they recommend her and then her sales continue to increase. What she is sure of is that if she continues investing in this business it will bring her good fruits in the future. This is her 3rd loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments. With the loan she will rent a local for fabricating her tarps and they will be protected from the weather, in addition to having greater availability to store them.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a locale for her business

loans.name: Keyla Patricia

texts.es:
La seoñra Keyla Patricia R. ha sobresalido por ser buenísima cocinera la cual se dedica a elaborar deliciosos platillos para venderlos en su casa de habitación ubicada en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega.


Ella elabora los platillos y los vende en el desayuno, en el almuerzo y en la cena, todos los días lleva a cabo esta actividad y la realiza gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha beneficiado grandemente por medio de la entrega de los créditos. La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los deliciosos alimentos que solo ella sabe preparar.
texts.en:
Keyla Patricia R. stands out as an excellent cook. She prepares delicious dishes to sell from her home in the municipality of Somotillo in Chinandega. She prepares her dishes daily and sells them for breakfast, lunch and dinner. She is grateful for Ceprodel's support as she has benefited greatly from the loans she has received. She has approached Ceprodel for a new loan to purchase the foodstuffs she needs to prepare the delicious meals which she alone knows how to make.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to prepare meals with.

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Luz Idalia A. M. desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de carne de cerdo ya que se ha destacado por tener crianza y destace de cerdos.

La actividad la lleva a cabo en su casa de habitación donde da lugar a la crianza de estos animales siendo este local donde las personas llegan a comprar la carne. Como todo negocio en desarrollo, para la señora Luz le es de muchísima necesidad la compra de los cerdos para proceder con su crianza y por este motivo ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita dicha compra y así llevar a cabo su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Luz Idalia A. M. has been selling pork for a number of years as well as breeding and raising pigs. She runs her business from her home, where she both raises her pigs and sells the pork. As with any growing business, it is vital for Luz to buy the pigs in order to raise them and because of this she has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan with which to buy more pigs and carry out her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Francisca Del Rosario

texts.es:
La emprendedora Señora de nombre Francisca del Rosario B. García tiene la edad de 39 años su estado civil es casada Doña Francisca tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son de 16 años y cursa recientemente el 3 año de secundaria y su hijo de de 18 años de edad  recientemente cursa 4 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida no labora debido a la avanzada edad que este posee, sus propósitos son de salir adelante por la difícil situación en la que nos encontramos ya que su interés  esta en darle a sus hijos lo mas importante en la vida como lo es la educación sus deseos son que su pulpería sea la mejor en ofertar los mejores productos que sus clientes sepan que en su pulpería pueden encontrar lo mejor sus sueños son de darle las remodelaciones pertinentes a su vivienda ya que es uno de los sueños que tiene que cumplir para que sus hijos puedan tener un lugar adecuado y con las comodidades necesarias para vivir.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería en la que vende los productos de: bolsas de arroz, detergentes, gaseosas y golosinas, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 5 años, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación de los bomberos 2 ½ al oeste, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia por lo que al principio fue un duro comienzo ya que decide prestarle a una amiga cierta cantidad de dinero para establecer su propio negocio y empezó con la venta de de ciertos productos como lo fue: golosinas, bolsas de hielo y azúcar por lo que logra conseguir a sus propios clientes y así obtiene su popularidad en su misma cuadra por lo que decide aumentar su negocio y es la razón por la que decide recurrir a Fundación León 2000 ya que aquí encuentra de forma mas favorable el financiamiento y así logra adquirir su propio negocio por lo que necesita la ayuda del financiamiento que será destina para capital de trabajo para abastecerse de los diferentes productos para ofertar como lo son: crema, leche, queso y pollo ya que los diferentes distribuidores llegan a dejarle al producto a su casa además ella tiene que salir en busca de los otros productos.
texts.en:
This entrepreneurial woman, Francisca del Rosario B. García, is 39 years old. She is married and has two children: one is 16 and in the third year of high school, and the other is 18 and in the fourth year of high school. Her husband no longer works due to his advanced age. Her goal is to move forward despite the difficult situation we now find ourselves in. She wants the best for her children, specifically to give them an education. She wants her grocery to be the best grocery, offering the best products with her customers knowing that they can buy only the best in her store. She dreams of remodeling her home, a dream she has to fulfill so that her children can have an adequate home with all the necessary comforts. Her income comes from her grocery business. She sells bags of rice, detergent, soft drinks and candies. She has run her grocery store out of her home for five years. She opened her business with her own money. It was hard at first because she decided to lend a friend of hers some money so she too could start her own business. She began by selling products such as candies, bags of ice and sugar until she had built up a customer base and become popular in her neighbourhood. Because of this, she decided to expand her business and has approached Fundación León 2000 as here she is able to get more favourable financing and thus acquire a store. The financing will be used as working capital to offer a greater variety of products, such as cream, milk, cheese and chicken because different suppliers deliver the products to her home, in addition to her having to go out to get the remainder of the products herself.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Luz Maria García A. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Luz tiene 4 hijos de los cuales su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 27 años labora por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 26 años también labora por cuenta propia y su otro hijo de 24 años que cursa el 4 año de secundaria ya que tiene que recurrir a clases por la noche debido a que trabaja por la noche y su otra hija que tiene la edad de 17 años, su esposo labora como capataz de campo, los propósitos de Doña Luz son de sacar delante su negocio por lo que tiene que generar ingresos para su familia ya que tiene que buscar el pan de cada día para su familia sus deseos son de vender mercadería al por mayor para suplir las diferentes necesidades que de sus clientes sus sueños son que la situación del país mejore para que los nicaragüense puedan optar por mas trabajos y mejoremos la economía del país.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en el reparto. Ronal Altamirano de la escuela 2c abajo, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, sus inicios dan comienzo con otro tipo de negocio ella comienza vendiendo refrescos y desayunos a los paileros del Ingenio de Monte Rosa por lo que esta actividad la realiza diario por lo que ella distribuía los productos de comida  y su esposo la ayuda a recolectar el dinero del pago de los clientes y mas tarde decide implementar otra forma de generar ingresos para su familia como lo fue establecer una pulpería por lo que ahora tiene los dos negocios y su objetivo son de mantenerlos para que estos le proporcionen lo necesario para poder vivir por lo que necesita el financiamiento  para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de sus productos como los son granos básicos, pollo, crema y queso ya que tiene que surtir su pulpería para ofertar a sus clientes lo que estos necesitan.
texts.en:
Luz Maria García A. is 51 years old and married. Luz has four children: her eldest son is 27 and self-employed; her second son is 26 and also self-employed; her third son is 24 and studying in his fourth year of high school because he is going to night school as he works at night; her daughter is 17. Her husband works as a field foreman. Luz's goal is to continue in business as she needs the income for her family to put bread on the table. She wants to sell merchandise in bulk to satisfy her clients' demands. She dreams of a better future for her country, with more employment for Nicaraguans and a stronger Nicaraguan economy. Luz has run a grocery for 5 years.
