loans.use: To buy and sell refrigeration equipment

loans.name: Mawussé

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Mme A. Mawussé est une femme mariée a à sa charge six (O6) personnes. Avec son commerce de paniers, et de pôts  et quelques condiments de cuisine, elle n’arrive pas à subvenir aux charges du ménage par manque de moyens financier suffisants. Pour agrandir son étalage et avoir plus de clientèles, elle sollicite un financement. Elle pourra mieux se prendre en charge et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mawussé A., age 48, has six people in her care. Doing commerce in baskets, containers, and a few culinary condiments, she has not been able to support her household due to a lack of sufficient financial means. To expand her display of goods and to have more customers, she is requesting financing. She will then be able to support herself and provide for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell household goods

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bware in the Rongo District of Kenya. She is married to a local schoolteacher and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. 

Rose has run a grocery stall in Bware since 2002. She grows the vegetables herself on her small farm and also sells fresh milk to the local community and at Achutti Market. With the profits from her business, Rose pays the school fees for her children and is able to meet her household expenses.

Rose would like to expand her business and begin selling cereals and maize. She has applied for a loan of $150 which she will use to purchase the stock of cereal and maize.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and maize

loans.name: Siradji

texts.fr: Né en 1962 à Lomé, Mr S. Siradji est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Machiniste de profession, il a toujours fait preuve d’un bon travail, mais manque de moyens financiers pour renouveler ses machines et acheter des planches. Pour avoir un stock considérable de planches et acheter de nouveaux matériels de travail, il sollicite un financement. Les revenus lui permettront de mieux gérer son atelier et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Lomé, Mr. Siradji S. is married and the father of two. A machinist by profession, he has always demonstrated good work but lacks the financial means for refurbishing his machines and buying planks. For a significant stock of planks and to buy new work equipment and materials, he is requesting financing. The income will enable him to manage his workshop better and to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell planks

loans.name: Kuy Seng

texts.en:
Mr. Kuy Seng H. is a villager in Ang Tapok village in Kampong Speu province. He is a wedding chef who gets hired for wedding ceremonies, parties, and so on. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy cooking equipment for his business. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy all kinds of cooking equipment for his purpose. His wife, Mrs. Sun Navy, helps him with the business.

Mr. Kuy Seng H. is 47 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a Casino Club while two others help their parents with the business and the youngest one is attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of cooking equipment for his work

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Mr. Rim S. was born in 1976 and he now lives in Sro Nge village in Kampong Speu province. He is a grocer in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for his inventory. His wife, Mrs. Poy Sokim, helps him with the current business.

Mr. Rim S. has three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are only five months old and four years old. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for his inventory

loans.name: Pong

texts.en:
Mr. Pong Paiy is a villager in Sro Nge village in Kampong Speu province. He is the vice village chief and he also is a farmer when he is free from his official work. In the plantation, he earns a small rice revenue which cannot support the family well. His wife, Mrs. Khun Rom, helps him with the plantation.

Although they try to work hard, they still live in an old house in poor condition. In order to improve this house, Mr. Pong Paiy decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to build a new house for his family. Mr. Pong Paiy is 57 years old and the father of seven children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a firewood seller. The third one is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or wine. The remaining four are attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add to his savings to build a new house for his family

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mr. Keo V. was born in 1955 and he now lives in Anlong Chamna village in Kampong Speu province. He is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or wine. His wife, Mrs. Hang Im, is a grocer. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so Mr. Keo V. decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory.

Mr. Keo V. has six children, one of whom is a teacher while another one is a construction worker. Others two help their parents with the current business while the remaining two are attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for his wife's inventory

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru: Кодиров Насрулло проживает в районе Варзоб.Возраст 40 лет , женат , но детей не имеет. Живет с родителями. Один обеспечивает семью. Жена и остальные члены семьи не работают.Они живут в районе , где очень тяжелые условия. Это горная местность.Поэтому для того, чтьобы прокормить семью занимается ремонтом автомашин. Занимается этим делом уже 5 лет. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить автозапчасти  для того чтобы использовать их в деле. Это поможет ему кроме проедлагаемых услуг , начать торговлю запчастями. Это даст возможность увеличить доходы семьи. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nasrullo K. lives in the Varzob district. He is 40 years old, married, but does not have children. He also lives together with his parents and supports the entire family, since neither his wife nor other family members work. Living in their mountainous district makes for very hard conditions. To feed his family, Nasrullo repairs automobiles and has been in this business for 5 years. He wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase auto parts for his business. This would also allow him to start selling auto parts and increase profit for his family. He will repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts

loans.name: Saifuddin

texts.ru: Сатторов Сайфуддин житель Шахринау. Не женат. Возраст 32 года. Живет  со своими родителями и семьей брата. Семья очень большая, поэтому для того, чтобы прокормить семью ему приходится много работать. В его семье работают все. Женщины работают дома , а мужчины на рынке. Они покупают молодых неоткормленных телят , откармливают , растят , а затем продают. Таким образом все заняты бизнесом. Сейчас время дешевых животных , поэтому он планирует получить кредит и купить  еще одного бычка. Таким образом он увеличит поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saifuddin S. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 32 years old and lives with his parents and his brother’s family. Hi family is very big, so he has to work a lot in order to support the family. Everyone in his family works: women work at home, and men at the market. They purchase young calves, feed and grow them and then sell them. Current animal prices are very low, so Saifuddin wants to obtain this loan to purchase one more bull and to increase his cattle headcount. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne K. lives in the Rongo District of Kenya. She is 34 years old, married to a police officer, and has 3 children. 

Evelyne wants to start her own business – a grocery and cereals stall in her community. As she lives near the border to Tanzania, Evelyne will buy the supplies for her stall from Tanzania and from the Kenyan town of Migori. 

In order to start her business, Evelyne has applied for a loan of $150. With the loan money, she will purchase the initial inventory of groceries and cereals for the new stall.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and cereals

loans.name: Sirodjiddin

texts.ru: Саидов Сироджиддин житель района Шахринау. Женат , имеет двоих детей.Решил получить кредит для того, чтобы купить бычка. После того, как он подрастет Сироджиддин сможет его выгодно продать. Это поможет ему получить прибыль. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sirodjiddin S. lives in the Shahrinau Region. He is married and has two children. He has decided to apply for a loan to buy a calf. After the calf has grown Sirodjiddin will be able to sell it and make a profit. He will be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela M. is 35 years old and lives in the Rongo District of Kenya. She is married to a local community leader and has 5 children who are currently all enrolled in school.

Pamela’s business is a retail shop where she sells soap, kerosene, sugar, tealeaves, bread, and milk. She has been running the shop since 2006. The profits from Pamela’s shop enable her to pay the household expenses and the school fees for her children.

Wishing to expand her business, Pamela has applied for a loan of $150. She will use the loan money to buy additional stock for the shop.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene, sugar, soap

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.ru: Расулова Зиеда жительница района Шахринау.Не замужем. Живет со свим сыном. Возраст 50 лет. Имеет столовую на центральном рынке. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в помещении. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев  от получаемой прибыли.
texts.en:
Ziyoda R. lives in the Shahrinau region. She is not married and lives with her son. She is 50 years old. She owns an eater on the central market. She has ten years experience in this business. She plans to received a loan to make repairs in the premises. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months from the income from her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do repairs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane A. is a 45 year-old widow who has 6 children, 2 of whom are in school. Jane has a retail kiosk in the Rongo District of southwest Kenya. She specializes in selling kerosene and cooking oil and has been running the kiosk for less than a year. 

As a widow, Jane relies on the profits from her kiosk to support her family. She uses the money she makes for all household expenses. 

The retail kiosk is a young business, and Jane is looking to increase her stock. To do so, she has applied for a small loan of KSH 5,250 (approximately USD 75). With the loan money, Jane will purchase additional items to sell at the kiosk, as well as increase her stock of kerosene and cooking oil.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene and cooking oil

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Асроилова Салтанат прживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 41 гд. Замужем и имеет семерых детей.У них очень большая семья , но все они живут очень дружно и весело. Салтанат занимается разведением мелко рогатого скота. Хочет купить еще нескольких овец , на полученный кредит. Погасть кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saltanat A. lives in the Shahrinau region. She is 41 years old, married and has seven children. They have a very big but friendly family who live happily together. Saltanat has a business of breeding cattle. She wants to buy several more lambs for the received loan. She will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lambs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan O. is 50 years old and living in the village of Ogwedhi in the Rongo District of Kenya with her husband who is a businessman in the area. They have 9 children, 3 of whom are in school. 

Susan’s business is fish sales in the Ogwedhi market. She specializes in selling the popular Omena (a small sardine-like fish). She has been running her stand since 1982. Susan buys the Omena from the nearby town of Migori. 

With the profits from her business, Susan pays for her children’s school fees and also for general household expenses. With this well-established business, Susan is looking for ways to increase her profits and expand. She is applying for a loan of $300 so that she can buy the Omena in bulk from Migori. This will both increase her inventory and save her money.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Асроилова Наталья проживает в районе Шахринау. Домохозяйка. Возраст 38 лет.Имеет пятерых детей. Имеет небольшое хозяйство . Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить комбикорм для своих животных. Кредит погашать планирует в течение12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Natalya A. lives in the Shahrinau region. She is a housewife, she is 38 years old and has five children. She has a small business and wants to get a loan to buy fodder for her cattle. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet O. is a 38 year-old woman living in Bware village in the Rongo District of Kenya. She is married to a local man who works in the armed forces. They have 5 children, all of whom are attending school. 

Linet O. sells cereals in Bware which she has done since 2006. She buys the stock from local farms, but when this is not enough she travels across the nearby border to Tanzania to purchase more. 

Linet says that it is due to her business that she is able to feed and educate her children, as well as pay for miscellaneous household expenses. 

Linet has applied for a loan of $300 in order to boost her business by purchasing maize. She plans to buy 20 bags of maize with the loan money, as now the price is low, and sell them when the price goes back up so that she can maximize her profit.

loans.use: To purchase maize

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen A. is a K-MET Community Health Worker Volunteer who lives in Bware, in the Rongo District of Kenya. She is 48 years old and a single mother with 2 children. Both children are currently attending school. 

Hellen earns a living by selling secondhand clothing and tealeaves in the town of Migori on market days. She has been in this business since 2001 and usually travels to Nairobi and Mombasa to buy her inventory. 

With the profits from her sales, Hellen pays for the school fees for her children, as well as all other household expenses. 

Hellen has applied for a loan of  $200 in order to replenish her stock of second-hand clothing and increase the variety of clothing items.

loans.use: To purchase stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mbeche

texts.en:
Mbeche S. is married, and he has 6 dependants. He received schooling through junior high. His wife is a trader.

Since 2005, Mbeche has been in the business of selling groceries at Atobease in Elmina, including biscuits, canned products, etc. Mbeche uses the income he generates from his business to pay for his children's school fees, utility bills, and other family expenses. Mbeche is now seeking a loan to purchase more groceries in order to meet the increase in demand by his costumers. With the expected profits from his expanded business, Mbeche plans to invest further in his children's education.

loans.use: To expand his business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional groceries

loans.name: Mbagnan

texts.en:
Mbagnan K. is a married man with 2 children, and he received schooling through senior high. His wife is a trader.

Since 2003, Mbagnan has been in the business of selling yams at Praso near Elmina. With the income generated from his business, he is able to pay for his children's school fees, utility bills, and other family expenses. Now, he is seeking a loan to buy more yams in order to meet the demands of his customers. Mbagnan is hoping to generate an increase in his business profits, which will enable him to someday build a house for his family.

loans.use: To expand his business and meet customer demand by purchasing additional yams

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en: Saeed is a 35-year-old married carpenter with two young children, living in Sir Al Gharbieh, Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. Saeed opened his shop in 1998, and he has already taken several micro-loans to ameliorate his business. Today, he is asking for US$ 1,000 to buy special tools to diversify his services.

loans.use: Buy special tools for his work

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 45-year-old married man with two children, living in Ansar, Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. He owns a piece of land where he stocks scrap metal. Ibrahim buys and sells this scrap metal and now he has found well-priced merchandise in the amount of US$ 1,000, which can be sold for a greater amount and will help him excel in his career.

loans.use: Buy well-priced scrap metal for re-sale

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba N. is married and has 5 dependants; her husband is a commercial driver.

Abiba has been selling yams since 1985. She currently sells yams at Praso near Elmina. Abiba suports her husband by helping to pay their utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Abiba will use her loan to buy additional yams to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional yams.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys N. is married, has 5 dependants, and received schooling through junior high. Her husband is a customs officer.

Gladys sells fabric and clothing at Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Gladys is seeking a loan to purchase additional fabrics and clothes to sell to her customers. With the expected profits from her expanded business, Gladys hopes to add to her and her husband's savings in order to someday acquire a piece of land where they can build a house for their family.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her inventory of fabrics and clothing

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 51-year-old married woman with three children, living in Old Saida, southern Lebanon. She owns a small shop, where she sells cloth and gadgets to people in the surrounding neighborhoods. Sabah wants to buy cloth for a very good price, in order to increase her profit, therefore she is asking to borrow US$ 1,200.

loans.use: Buy cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa D. is a married woman with 6 children, and she has received no formal education. Her husband is an audit clerk.

Yaa sells yams at Praso near Elmina, and she has been in this line of business since 1993. By doing so, she helps her husband to pay utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Yaa is now seeking a loan to buy more yams in order to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the profits from her business to add to her husband's savings to acquire a piece of land where they can build their family house.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional yams

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 49-year-old married man with 5 children, living in Maarakeh in southern Lebanon. He has owned a mini-van taxi since 2001, and he is offering transportation services to neighboring villages in the Tyr area. Abdallah wants to borrow US$ 1,200 in order to perform maintenance on his van and change the tires for better safety.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his van and change the tires

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 25-year-old man living in Chhim in Mount Lebanon. He has owned a shop since 2006 where he sells new and used clothes. Wassim wants to buy more clothes in order to increase his sales and cover most of his clientele's needs; therefore, he wants to borrow US$ 1,000 to fulfill his project.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en:
Greetings from Ildephonse M. in Rwamagana, in the Eastern province of Rwanda! Ildephonse is 40 years old, married with 4 children.

Mr. M. operates a shop selling various food items such as beans, maize, etc. This entrepreneur hires a small truck, which helps him to carry his products to his store.

He is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf that will help him to increase his stock because he has got new customers in town. Furthermore, he says that this loan will increase his profit and will enable him to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: Increase his inventory of food products

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony M. is single and has no children. He has received schooling through junior high.

Anthony sells yams at Praso near Elmina, which he has done since 1999. Anthony uses the income generated from his business to pay his rent, utility bills, and other living expenses. Anthony is now seeking a loan to buy more yams to meet the demands of his customers. With the expected profits from his expanded business, Anthony plans to save towards a house; indeed, he wants to build a house before he starts a family.

loans.use: To expand his business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional yams

loans.name: Maria Evangelina

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Maria Evangelina O. López tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es acompañada Doña Maria tiene 3 hijos de los cuales el mayor tiene la edad de 18 años y cursa el 3 año de la carrera de farmacia su otro hijo de 13 años cursa el 2 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 8 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como fontanero, sus propósitos son superarse en la vida para salir adelante con su negocio ya que es lo que mas importante para seguir generando a su familia el sustento diario sus deseos son de construir un lugar para establecer un restaurante en el que ella pueda cocinar ya que es uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos sus sueños son de darle a sus hijota oportunidad de se llegar a ser unos profesionales para que el día de mañana sean personas de bien y provechosas para la sociedad.

Su actividad económica es la venta de frutas el lugar del negocio esta ubicada en su casa de habitación y en  el mercado La Estación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de  8 años, Doña Maria inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo es por lo que decide establecer un pequeño negocio en la venta de frutas al principio no poseía la experiencia necesaria para con este negocio por lo que  mas tarde  decide inventar otra fuente de ingresos estableciendo la venta de frutas en su casa de habitación ya que tenia que buscar la forma de vender sus productos en su casa de habitación al principio tuvo algunos problemas ya que no tenia el apoyo de sus hijos en su casa pero mas tarde estos acabaron apoyando a su Mama, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar las compras de las frutas en Managua ya que hay lugares en Managua le resultan mas favorable que aquí en León.
texts.en:
Maria Evangelina O. López is 40 years old, she is married, with 3 children. Her first child is 18, and is in the third year of a pharmaceutical career. Her other son of 13 years old is in his second year of secondary school, and her youngest son of 8 is in his fourth grade of primary school. Her partner works as a plumber. Her dreams are to better herself in life by progressing her business, because it is the most important thing that generates the daily sustenance that her family requires. Her dreams are to construct a place to establish a restaurant in which she would be able to cook, since cooking is one of her favorite pastimes. Her dreams include giving her children the opportunity to become professionals so that in the future they may be good people that will give back to society. Maria’s economic activity is the sale of fruit. Her business is located in the house in which she lives, and in the market “The Station.” She has had her business for eight years. She started this business when she was in need of a job, and so she decided to start her own little business in the sale of fruit. In the beginning, she didn’t have the necessary experience for this business, but later on she decided to even invent another source of income by establishing a business in her own house as well. In the beginning she had some problems, because she didn’t have the support of her children, but later they started helping their mother. This loan will be used for capital to buy fruit from Managua, because there are places in Managua that are more favorable than the ones in León.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy more fruit.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Muraho, “greetings” from Nathan N. in Rwamagana, in the Eastern province of Rwanda! Nathan is 45 years old, married with 4 children and also raising 2 orphans.

Nathan sells bicycle spare parts and he also repairs bicycles, so he is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf to increase his stock of spare parts and also to buy a welding machine. This loan will be repaid over 12 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and spare parts for bike repair

loans.name: Gleysi Del Socorro

texts.es:
Su Nombre Gleysi del Socorro S. E. tiene la edad de 31 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Gleysi tiene 3 hijos una niña de 12 años que cursa el 5 grado de primaria su otro hija de 8 años cursa el 3 grado de primaria y un niño de 4 años que cursa el 3 nivel de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como comerciante, sus propósitos son de superase en lo personal y en su negocio a pesar de las dificultades económicas que este que esta atravesando sus sueños son de  tener tramo donde pueda ofertar sus productos para sus clientes y sea un lugar propio y este a su vez pase de generación en generación sus deseos son de  tener  una gran cantidad de mercadería para seguir contribuyendo mas a los ingresos de la familia para que a sus hijos no le pueda faltar lo mas necesarios como seria el pan de cada día.

Loa actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa en la que vende los productos como: ropa interior, camisolas y calcetines, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 11 años, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que tenia un buscar un medio de trabajo por lo que no tenia un titulo para aspirar a un trabajo profesional  y decide iniciar este tipo de negocio de manera ambulante además de separarse de su primer compañero de vida teniendo a una niña que tenia que sacar adelante el amor materno la llevaron a emprender un reto con este negocio lo que al principio no tenia nadad de experiencia y al pasar el tiempo obtiene lo necesario para saber muy bien el control y manejo de su negocio por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de sus productos por lo que requiere la ayuda de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que se preocupan por cumplir las metas de las personas que realmente lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Gleysi de Socorro S. E. is 31 years old, has a partner, and 3 children. Her 12 year old daughter is in her fifth grade of primary school. Her other daughter of 8, is in her third year of primary school, and her son of 4, is in the third level of primary school. Her partner works as a vender. Her intentions are to better her personal life and in her business, in spite of the economic difficulties that she is going through. Her dreams are to have a plot where she may offer her products to her clients, that would be her own place that could pass through generations in her family. Her dreams also include having a large quantity of merchandise to continue contributing more to her family income so that her children never go without daily essentials like bread. Her economic activity is the sale of clothing, in which she specializes in underwear, camisoles, socks, and stockings. Her business is conducted on a mobile basis. She has had her business for 11 years, starting it because she needed work and did not have a professional track to aspire to. Furthermore, she was also motivated to start this type of travelling business because she needed to separate from her first life partner with whom she had a daughter. It is with her maternal love and desire to better her daughter’s future that she undertook the challenge of starting this business when, in the beginning, she had no experience. Yet with the passing of time she obtained what was necessary to know how to control and manage her business. This loan will be used as capital to buy products, and so she asks for the help of Fundación León 2000 and the other organizations that concern themselves with helping the people who truly need it.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through primary education. Her husband is a fisherman.

Mary sells meat, fish, and "gari" (a delicacy made out of cassava which is pictured in the photograph with Mary) at Seaview near Elmina, which she has done since 2004. By doing so, Mary supports her husband in paying utility bills and other basic living expenses of the family. Mary is now requesting a loan to purchase more meat and fish so that she can satisfy her customers' increasing demands. With the expected profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land in order to build a house for their family.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional meat and fish

loans.name: Aminadab

texts.en:
Greetings from Aminadab R. in Rwamagana, in the Eastern province! Aminadab is 26 years old, married with 2 children.

Aminadab started up a business in 2007. He runs a shop selling various kinds of shoes and women's clothes. He needs a loan of 500,000 Rwf, which will be used to expand his business. This loan will be repaid in 12 months on a monthly basis.

This entrepreneur believes that once he gets this loan, his shop will become bigger because he is planning to buy men’s clothes, which are more desirable in the market.

loans.use: to expand his business by beginning to sell men's clothing

loans.name: Bassaw

texts.en:
Bassaw H. is a married woman and has 3 children. Her husband is an electrical repairman.

For the past few years, Bassaw has been in the business of selling foodstuffs such as tomatoes, rice, and meat at Elmina. By doing so, Bassaw supports her husband in paying their rent, utility bills, and other basic living expenses of the family. Bassaw is now seeking a loan to purchase additional foodstuffs. With the expected profits from her expanded business, Bassaw plans to add to her and her husband's savings in order to acquire a piece of land where they can build their family house.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Claude H. in Rwamagana, in the Eastern province of Rwanda! Jean Claude is 31 years old.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop where he sells various items like men's and women's clothes and men's and women's shoes. Besides the business, he also grows green peas, sorghum, and beans that he later sells in local markets to increase his income.

He is looking for a loan worth 500,000 Frws to increase his stock by buying more clothes and shoes. This loan would be repaid over 6 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Increase his stock of clothing for sale

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona C. C. ha logrado llevar a cabo su sueño de ser comerciante ya que ella misma ha logrado establecer su propia pulpería en su casa de habitación ubicada en el municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega.

La pulpería de la señora Petrona a ido ganando prestigio poco a poco en su comunidad debido a que ha incrementado sus productos y esto se debe gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de los productos. Por esta razón es que en estos momentos ella espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el otro crédito para adquirir la mercadería y continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Petrona C. C. has succeeded in fulfilling her dream of being a saleswoman, in which she has established her own local store in the house in which she lives, located in the municipality of Somotillo in Chinandega. Petrona’s store has gained prestige little by little in her community because she has increased her supply stock. She was able to do this thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has provided loans that she has used to buy products. For this reason Petrona hopes that Ceprodel will supply this other credit so that she may purchase merchandise and continue in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Greetings from Médiatrice B. in Kanombe Sector, Kicukiro District in Kigali, capital of Rwanda! Médiatrice is 37 years old, divorced and the mother of two kids. She is raising one orphan as well.

She started her business 5 years ago. She operates an Internet Cyber-Café and she has a house to rent out and gets around US$ 165 per month. She is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will be repaid over eight months on a monthly basis. This loan will be used to increase the number of computers in her Internet cafe.

loans.use: Increase the number of computers in her Internet cafe

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela K. is a single parent with 4 dependants, and she received schooling through junior high.

Sela has been in the fish-selling busines since 1991. More specifically, she buys fish from fishermen, brings the fish home to be processed and preserved, and then sends the fish to the market at Denu near Elmina to be re-sold for a profit. As a single mother, she is solely responsible for paying utility bills, her children's school fees, and other family living expenses. She is now seeking a loan to purchase more fresh fish for processing and resale purposes. She hopes to generate an increase in profits from her business, which she will reinvest back into the business to increase her capital reserves.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fresh fish

loans.name: Mercedes Yamilleth

texts.es:
Mercedes P. es una dama de muy bajos recursos pero con un gran espíritu de superación ya que junto con su cónyuge se esfuerzan para brindar a sus tres hijos un techo digno ya que su vivienda se encontraba en malas condiciones debido a los fenómenos naturales y climáticos y también al pasar del tiempo.

Al haber iniciado dicha obra, ha logrado levantar las P. y realizar la estructura pero todavía le hace falta la compra de los materiales para poner el techo, piso, puertas, ventanas y pintura de P.. Por esta razón ella ha buscado el refugio en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con su construcción en su municipio de Somotillo.
texts.en:
Mercedes P. is a woman of very few material resources, but with a great spirit of determination to overcome life's challenges. Together with her partner she is working hard to provide her three children with a decent home, as their current residence is in poor condition owing to natural phenomena, the climate, and also the passing of time. Mercedes has started work on the house, and has succeeded in making the basic structure and building the walls. She stills needs to buy the materials for the roof, floors, doors, windows and wall paint. For this reason she has approached Ceprodel for a loan allowing her to purchase these building materials and continue construction in her municipality of Somotillo.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: La señora Ángela Martínez tiene la edad de 40 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 19 años el cual estudia y trabaja para apoyarla un poco, desde hace quince años doña Ángela trabaja como modista en su casa de habitación, los sueños de ella es llegar a expandir su micro-empresa ya que la mayor dificultadad que se le presenta es la falta de apoyo para poder mejor las condiciones de trabajo ; ya que el piso esta bien deteriorado al igual que el techo de la misma. Con la solicitud del préstamo va invertir en infraestructura para hacer mejoras del techo de su casa como el piso que esta quebrado, para eso va a comprar materiales para reparar como: zinc, `perlines,  golosos, piso,  cemento y otros para terminar el trabajo y así poder tener una casa digna para su familia y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ángela Martínez is 40 years old and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla division of the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother. He son is 19 years old and studies and works to help her a little. Ángela has worked as a dressmaker since she was 15 years old. She works out of her home; her dream is to expand her small business. The main difficulty is that she lacks support to improve her work conditions: the floor as well as the roof are quite deteriorated. With the loan she is asking for, she will invest in infrastructure: making improvements to the roof of her home as well as to the floor which is broken. She will buy materials such as zinc, purlins (beams), supplies, flooring, cement and other materials to finish the job and thus have a decent home for her family and be able to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to fix the roof and flooring for her home.

loans.name: Solidarité Group

texts.en:
Irma, one of the members of this loan group, sells lamp oil, soft drinks, doughnuts, and omelette. She makes about US$ 70 in profit per week. She began working in business with her mother in 1988 when she was 11 years old. She used to sell beside her mother until she began her own business with a capital of US$ 5 in 1992.

Irma began purchasing and re-selling about 10 kilograms of corn. Over the years, her business sometimes stopped because of her studies, but she did not close completely. In April 2008, Irma decided to join Solidarité Community Bank, one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo Microfinance Program), and she has received three loans. Through the funds received from Hope’s loans, Irma’s business began to expand and she was able to stabilize her merchandise.

With the new loan, Irma will purchase an ice chest, 2 cartons of eggs, and a crate of soft drinks to expand her product offerings to her customers. Irma believes that she will increase her profit by selling these new products. She is 32 years old, single, and has a 3-year-old boy. She lives with her parents. Irma’s dream is to open a fresh food store.

loans.use: To purchase an ice chest, cartons of eggs, and crates of soft drinks

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mawuenawo Eya

texts.fr:
Mme Mawuenawo Eya T. est née à Davié-Tékpo au Sud du Togo le 29 Novembre 1973. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle est revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités, activité qui lui permet d’appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses du ménage.
Elle est constamment sollicitée par sa clientèle, ce qui le met souvent en rupture de stock. Pour résoudre ce problème, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner suffisamment en marchandises afin de pouvoir satisfaire pleinement ses clients. Ce financement augmentera ses recettes et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Mawuenawo Eya T. was born on November 29, 1973 in Davié-Tékpo in southern Togo. She is a retailer of essential goods. This is a business that enables her to support her husband in covering household expenses. She is in constant demand by her customers which often leads to inventory shortages. To resolve this problem, she is requesting financing to get enough merchandise to meet their expectations fully. This financing will increase her receipts and her profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell staple goods

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en:
Greetings from Jeanne d’Arc U. in Kicukiro district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Jeanne d’Arc is 33 years old and the mother of 7 kids.

Jeanne d’Arc runs a hardware shop where she sells electrical materials, paint, building nails, iron sheets for roofing, locks, and cement. She employs 1 person to help with this business.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will be repaid over eight months. This loan will help her to expand her hardware business.

loans.use: Expansion of her hardware business

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Norma M. E. es madre de tres pequeños niños cuya tarea es mantenerlos y proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que estos estudien. Ella  hoy en día ha duplicado sus esfuerzos para lograr invertir en la remodelación de su vivienda para darle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida y un techo digno donde vivir.

Para iniciar con esta remodelación de su hogar, ha invertido en materiales de construcción para mejorar toda la vivienda desde la sala, los cuartos y el baño. Para terminar con esta obra necesita los materiales de construcción y es por esta sencilla razón que ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar dichos materiales para terminar la remodelación de su hogar y así darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma M. E. is the mother of three small children, and is dedicated to raising them and providing a supportive environment for them to complete their education. Currently she has doubled her efforts in order to invest in remodelling her home, so that her children can enjoy better living conditions and a decent roof above their heads. To start the remodelling of her home she has invested in construction materials to make improvements to the entire residence, from the living room to the bedrooms and bathroom. To complete this work she needs additional building materials, and it is for this simple reason that she approached Ceprodel for a loan. She will use the loan to buy the materials to finish her home improvements and provide her children with improved living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Seidou

texts.fr: Agé de 48 ans, Mr Seidou S. est marié et père de huit (08) enfants. Exploitant de graviers depuis plus de dix (10) ans, il jouit d’une confiance absolue auprès de ses clients dont les demandes ne cessent d’augmenter, obligeant Mr S. à faire face à des ruptures de stocks. Il manque de moyens financiers pour l’extraction à grande échelle et en grande quantité de graviers. Pour y faire face, il demande un financement lui permettant de disposer d’un stock important de graviers afin de répondre à la forte demande des clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Seidou S., age 48, is married and the father of eight. Having a gravel yard for over ten years, he enjoys absolute trust from his customers, whose orders are constantly increasing. This forces Mr. S. to cope with inventory shortages. He lacks the financial means to extract gravel on a large scale and in quantity. To address the situation, he is asking for financing that will enable him to have a sizable inventory of gravel to meet the strong demand from his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To extract and sell gravel

loans.name: German Luis

texts.es:
El Señor de Nombre German Luís E. V. tiene la edad de 52 años su estad civil es casado, Don German tiene 3 hijos Fabio Antonio tiene la edad 22 años y estudia la carrera de periodismo su otro hijo Reynaldo Manuel Martínez Mayorga tiene la edad de 20 años y cursa el 2 año de la carrera química y Juan Carlos Martínez tiene la edad 18 años y cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su esposa labora como la elaboración de tortillas, sus propósitos son de tener su negocio activo por lo que su actividad económica es mas complicada ya que tiene que engordar a los cerdos ya que el alimento para darle de comer a los cerdos es muy caro pero quiere mantenerlo sus deseos son de darle mejoras a su vivienda para que su esposa y sus hijos puedan vivir cómodamente y sus hijos puedan tener un buen lugar para el futuro sus sueños son de comprar una casa en León para ir de vacaciones con su familia ya que su casa de habitación es en la comarca  chácaraseca 

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es engorde de cerdos, reproducción y desarrollo de pollos, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación en la comarca de chacarasecas, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, el inicio con otro negocio antes de comenzar la actividad  a la que se dedica actualmente era chofer de un camión que transportaba concentrado a las avícolas del TIP- TOP y comenzó con 10 pollos ya que el es una persona luchadora además de la crianza de los pollos también inicio con 2 cerdos donde quería invertir mas en los cerdos por lo que esto fue invirtiendo hasta lograr tener 30 cerdos en total y así fue que poco a poco fu7e aumentado su producción hasta lograr lo que tiene en la actualidad, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de mas pollo y para la compra de concentrado para que el desarrollo de los cerdos y los pollos sea de mejor calidad para el engorde de los animales por lo que los productos que mas comercializa es son los pollos que los vende por libra y los pollos que los vende en pie y espera seguir contando con la ayuda de Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Mr. Germán Luís E. V. is 52 years old, married, and has three sons. Fabio Antonio is 22 years old and is studying journalism. Reynaldo Manuel Martínez Mayorga is 20 years old and is in his second year studying chemistry at the university. Juan Carlos Martínez is 18 years old and is in 10th grade. Germán’s wife works making tortillas. His purpose is to have an active business because his business is more complicated now than it was before. He has to fatten pigs and the food that he gives them to eat is very expensive but he would like to keep fattening pigs. His wishes are that he can improve his home so his wife and sons can live comfortably and his sons can have a good place for the future. He dreams of buying a house in León where he could take his family on vacation, as his current home is in the Chácaraseca region. Germán works fattening pigs and raising chickens. His business is located in his home in the Chácaraseca region, and he has had the business for 10 years. He began with another business before starting his current business. In his previous business, he was a truck driver who transported TIP-TOP poultry. He began with 10 chickens, and because he is a hard-working person, he also began with two pigs and wanted to invest in more pigs. He continued buying pigs until he had 30 in total, and this was how, little by little, he increased his production until he had what he has now. This loan is for working capital that will be used to buy more chickens and animal feed so the development of his pigs and chickens can be of better quality for fattening his animals. He sells more chickens than any other animal, and they are sold alive and by the pound. He hopes to continue receiving the help of Kiva partner Fundación León 2000 and their sister organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens and animal feed

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Rosa M. es cocinera profesional habiendo aprendido este oficio desde muy jovencita y hoy en día se dedica a este elaborando diferentes tipos de alimentos los cuales son comercializados en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo.

Todos los días ella elabora los platillos y los vende a sus clientes que le visitan y según dichos clientes, ella es una excelente cocinera en su sector.

La razón por la cual la señora Rosa ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos. Es de importancia destacar que con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y logra salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is a professional chef who learned her trade when she was very young. Today she devotes her time to making many different types of food, which she sells out of her home in the town of Somotillo. Every day Rosa prepares and sells dishes to the customers that drop by. According to those customers, for their section of the city, Rosa is an excellent cook. The reason Rosa has come to Ceprodel is to request a loan that would permit her to buy ingredients for the preparation of food. It is important to stress that this loan will be of great benefit and she will be able to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr:
Mr Koami D. est un fournisseur de graviers né le 30 Août 1977 à Togblé. Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, il exerce cette activité depuis sept (07) ans. Ses principaux clients sont les entreprises de constructions auxquelles il livre tous ses stocks. Toutefois sa capacité financière ne lui permet pas de satisfaire tous ses clients suivant leur demande et à temps.
C’est pour cela qui sollicite un financement pour augmenter sa capacité d’extraction. Ce financement va lui permettre d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Koami D. was born in Togblé on August 30, 1977. He's married and the father of 5 children. He's been selling gravel for seven years. His main customers are construction enterprises, to which he deliver all his stocks. However, his financial capability does not enable him to meet customer demand in time. This is why he is seeking a loan to bolster his extraction capacity. This loan will enable him to increase his revenue and his profit.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Extraction and sale of gravel

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.es: El señor Bismarck Busto A. tiene la edad de 29 años habita en el barrio San Ignacio ubicado en la Concepción, juntos a sus padres, el es soltero, los planes a  futuros es mejorar la producción para obtener otros ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el desde hace veinte años trabaja como agricultor ya que sus padres desde pequeños le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. Los sueños de este Joven es llegar a establecer más cultivos para poder hacer su casa ya que tiene planes de formar una familia. Con la solicitud del préstamo va invertir en fertilizantes para el cultivo ay así vender una buena producción al mercado y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Bismarck Busto A. is 29 years old and lives with his parents in the San Ignacio neighbourhood of la Concepción. He is single. He plans to improve his yield so that he can make more money and improve his living conditions. For 20 years he has worked as a farmer as his parents taught him at a very young age to work the land. This young man dreams of growing more crops to have his own home as he wants to start a family. He will invest this loan in fertilizers to be able to sell a high quality crop at market and make more money.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soil additives such as fertilizers and pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Ayawavi Ama

texts.fr: Mme Ayawavi Ama M. est née en 1955 à Hohoè au Ghana. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle est revendeuse dans son quartier de produits de premières nécessités. Ce petit commerce lui génère de petits bénéfices qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de supporter les besoins élémentaires de sa famille. Son objectif est d’agrandir son commerce par l’ouverture d’une grande boutique et s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de pouvoir vendre tous les produits dont sa clientèle a constamment besoin. Pour y arriver, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’accroître considérablement ses recettes et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ayawavi Ama M. was born in 1955 in Hohoè in Ghana. Married and the mother of 2 children, she sells staples in her neighborhood. This little business generates meager profits for her which allow her to cover her own expenses and her family's most basic needs. Her goal is to expand her business by opening a larger shop and stocking up on merchandise so that she can sell all the products constantly needed by her clientele. To achieve this goal, she has requested a loan that will permit her to considerably increase her receipts and thus her profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of staple goods

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. is 32 years old, married, with 4 children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in the Rongo District of Kenya.

Mary sells kerosene and second hand childrens and men’s clothes in the Achutti Market. She has had a stall there since 2006. Mary purchases her stock in Kisii and Awendo and sells to her local community in the market. 

The business has allowed Mary to send both her children and herself to school. With her profits, Mary was able to attend college and she is also able to pay for her childrens school fees. 

She has applied for a loan of KSH 11,250 (approximately USD $150) in order to purchase more kerosene and used clothing. Mary wishes to expand the range of clothing items that she sells using the loan money.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing and kerosene

loans.name: Ehui

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, Mme Ehui T. est née en 1977 à Davié dans la préfecture de ZIO au Sud du Togo. Elle est revendeuse de la farine de manioc ou « gari », un produit alimentaire de base des populations de sa localité. Elle est pratiquement la seule revendeuse de sa zone mais ses moyens financiers étant limités, elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire pleinement ses clients. Elle demande donc un crédit pour constituer en gros des stocks de farines afin de les revendre en détail à ses clients. C’est une activité très génératrice de revenus qui lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
A married mother of five (05) children, Mrs. Ehui T. was born in 1977 in Davié in the prefecture of Zio in southern Togo. She is a retailer of manioc flour ('gari'), a basic food product for the population in her area. She is virtually the only seller in her locality, but since her financial means are limited, she is unable to fully satisfy her customers. She is thus asking for a loan to build up her stocks of flour in bulk in order to re-sell them at retail to her customers. This is a business that generates a lot of income, which will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell manioc flour

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
La señora Sandra María H. reside en el municipio de Somotillo donde se desempeña laborando arduamente y donde ha decidido invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que requiere de su apoyo por lo que la casa se ha venido deteriorando a través de los años.

Al haber iniciado con el mejoramiento de su habitación por medio del levantamiento de las paredes. Hoy en día necesita el apoyo para la compra de los materiales de construcción y para esto ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el objetivo de ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar mejorando su vivienda para dar mejores condiciones a sus hijos y a sus futuras generaciones.
texts.en:
Sandra María H. lives in the town of Somotillo where she works hard and has decided to invest in home improvements. She requires your assistance because her home has fallen into disrepair over the years. Sandra began the home improvements with the construction of walls. Now she needs assistance with the purchase of construction materials. She has turned to Ceprodel for a loan for the purchase of those construction materials in order to continue making improvements to the house in order to provide better living conditions for her children and future generations.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana K. is a widow with four children, and she has received primary education.

Since 1998, Juliana has been in the fish-selling business. More specifically, she buys fresh fish from fishermen, brings the fish home to be processed and preserved, and then sends the fish to the market at Denu near Elmina to be re-sold for a profit. (Beside her in the photograph are the smoking shelves on which she arranges the fish, which is part of the preservation process.) As a widow, she is solely responsible for paying the family's living expenses. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for processing and re-sale purposes. With the expected profits from her expanded business, she hopes to add to her savings to someday build a house for her family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fresh fish

loans.name: Lina

texts.fr: Née en 1941 à Gbodjomé, Mme A. Lina est mariée et mère de neuf (09) enfants. Son mari étant retraité toutes les charges du ménage se reposent pratiquement sur elle seule. Ce qui rend la vie du foyer difficile, car son petit commerce de légumineuses et articles de ménage n’arrivent pas à couvrir les charges du ménage. Pour s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante en marchandises et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille, elle sollicite un financement.
texts.en:
Borin in Gbodjomé in 1941, Mrs. Lina A. is married and the mother of nine children. Her husband being retired, she has to provide for the household expenses almost on her own. This makes life difficult since her little business selling legumes and household goods, is not sufficient to meet the family expenses. She's seeking a loan to purchase large quantities of goods in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods for her shop

loans.name: Sixto Arquímedes

texts.es:
El señor Sixto Arquimides G. labora arduamente en el municipio de Somotillo de donde es originario.Se ha desempeñado como contratista de construcción y  su meta para este año es terminar con la reconstrucción de su vivienda por la razón de que desde hace muchos años había sido golpeada por los fenómenos naturales y las paredes no estaban en buenas condiciones

Al haber empezado en la reconstrucción de la vivienda ha hecho uso de materiales de construcción con precios altos y por su bajo ingreso financiero, decidió solicitar un crédito en Ceprodel para dar lugar a la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar la obra de mejoramiento de su vivienda para dar mejores condiciones de vida a sus tres pequeños hijos, a su esposa y  a él mismo.
texts.en:
Sixto Arquímedes G. works arduously for the municipality of Somotillo, where he is originally from. He has been working as a building contractor and his goal for this year is to finish rebuilding his own home which has been hit by natural phenomena over many years and the walls are no longer in good condition. To start the reconstruction he used building materials which were expensive and, because of his low income, he decided to ask for a loan from Ceprodel so that he could afford to buy the materials and continue the project so that he can give a better standard of living to his three young children, his wife and himself.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is married. She is an entrepreneur from Vinogradovo. Magdalina sells children’s clothing in the central city market. She has been in the business for 5 years. Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has impacted her business a lot. Moreover, favorable location in the marketplace and growing sales have only added to the success of Magdalina’s business and increased her income within the past few years.

Magdalina is currently making about 15,000 Grivnas in gross income. Her monthly net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnas. Magdalina has an enterprising spirit. She is a thorough planner, very punctual and active. One of her long-term plans is to open one more vending stand in the market.

Magdalina believes current increase of assorted merchandise will help her develop her business consistently and move her one step further in her business progress. Magdalina is now requesting a 2,500 Grivna loan. This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Mme A. Jeannette est née en 1970 à Kpalimé. Veuve avec deux personnes à charge, elle a du mal à se prendre en charge car n’ayant aucune source de revenu. Elle entrepris alors la vente des denrées alimentaires notamment, du riz, le poisson fumé, les jus et de l’eau glacée. Ce qui lui réussit très bien. Compte tenu de la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elle sollicite un financement pour faire le stock considérable de riz, acheter du poisson régulièrement en grande quantité et élargir son commerce à d’autres activités. Les bénéfices lui permettront désormais de se prendre convenablement en charge et veiller aux bien être de ses deux enfants orphelins.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanette A. was born in Kpalimé in 1970. She's a widow and has two persons to support. Lacking a source of income, she started selling food products, notably rice, smoked fish, juices and iced water, a business that works well for her. Since customer demand is ever-increasing, she's seeking a loan to stock large amounts of rice, purchase large quantities of fish on a regular basis, and expand her business to other activities. The profits will enable her to adequately provide for herself and to ensure the well-being of her two orphan children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and fish for her food products business

loans.name: Dzalilou

texts.fr: Mr B. Dzalilou est né en 1970 à Cotonou. Célibataire, il exerce le métier de mécanicien qui lui réussit bien. Afin d’agrandir son garage et acheter de nouveaux matériels de travail, il sollicite un financement. Son courage et son dynamisme lui permettront de mieux gérer son garage et de prendre convenablement en charge.
texts.en:
Mr Dzalilou B. was born in 1970 in Cotonou. Unmarried, he's a mechanic, and is doing well. He's seeking this loan in order to enlarge his garage and purchase new work equipments. His courage and energy will enable him to better run his garage, and to adequately support himself.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his garage and purchase work equipments

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is in the clothing sales business, selling items for babies and children. She owns a small, comfortable vending kiosk in the central city market of Berdyansk called Privoz. Olga has been a client of “Nadiya Ukraine” for more than 5 years. She acknowledges that loans have been an essential part of the growth of her business. They have made her business more flexible and mobile. Currently Olga’s net sales profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnas, which helps create stable growth for her business.

Olga is requesting a loan of 3,000 Grivnas to increase her inventory of clothing items. Prompt loan repayment and self-discipline have characterized Olga in the past. Financial assistance will continue to promote the growth of her business and provide her family with consistent income. Olga is hoping to open one more vending location in the future.

This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To increase assorted inventory

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: El señor Dionisio Busto A.,  tiene la edad de 46 años habita en el barrio San Ignacio ubicado en La Concepción, junto a su compañera de vida, ella no trabaja pero le apoya con la agricultura , ellos tienen cincos hijos todos mayores de edad los cuales le aportan  con los gastos de la casa , el desde hace veinte  años se dedica a la agricultura , se siente muy contento con el apoyo de Afodenic ya que a través de sus financiamiento a logrado establecer mas cultivos ya que le han asesorado para que aplique sus insumos en tiempo y forma para que obtenga los resultados que lo tienen muy contento. Con la solicitud de crédito va comprar insumos agrícola para tener una buena producción y poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Dionisio Busto A. is 46 years old and lives in the San Ignacio district of La Concepción. He lives with his partner, who doesn't work but helps him with farming. They have five adult children who help them with their living expenses. Dionisio has worked in farming for 20 years, and is very happy with the support of Afodenic, as thanks to the loans he has received he has been able to plant more crops. He has been advised to use agricultural supplies such as fertilizers leading to better results, which makes him very happy. He will use this loan to buy agricultural supplies in order to have a good harvest and be able to sell his crops for a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies including crop fertilizers

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, Mme D. Akouélé est une veuve avec quatre (04) enfants et sept (07) autres personnes à charge. Très brave et courageuse, elle arrive à bien gérer son  commerce de pain. En effet, elle achète du pain en gros chez les boulangers et les revend en détails sur place ou dans les marchés. Mais compte tenu de la mévente et de la cherté de la vie, elle n’arrive plus à bien vendre par manque de fonds propre. Pour relancer son activité d’achat et vente de pain, elle sollicite un financement. Ceci lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Akouélé D., age 46, is a widow with four children plus seven others to support. A very kind and courageous woman, she manages to do a good job managing her commerce in bread. Basically, she buys bread in bulk from bakers and resells them locally retail or in the marketplaces. But given a drop in sales and the high cost of living, she is no longer able to do well because of a lack of working capital. To reinvigorate her trade in bread, she is requesting financing. This will enable her to support her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell bread

loans.name: Charité

texts.fr: Née en 1962 à Lomé, Mme K. Charité est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Très dévouée et dynamique elle a réussit à s’adonner à la vente de pain assaisonné avec la mayonnaise, la salade, le beurre, des œufs devant les établissements scolaires. Une activité qui lui réussit très bien compte tenu de l’hygiène et la qualité du service. Afin de continuer à fournir un service de qualité non douteuse et varier ses ingrédients, elle sollicite un financement. Ceci lui permettra de renforcer son chiffre d’affaires et mieux s’occuper des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Lomé, Ms. Charité K. is a married mother of three. A very devoted and energetic woman, she has succeeded in dedicating herself to selling bread seasoned with mayonnaise, salad, butter, and eggs in front of school houses. This business has been a successful one for her, given the quality of her service and hygienic practices. In order to continue providing unquestionable quality service and to vary her ingredients, she is requesting financing. This will enable her to boost her sales figures and to take better care of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell breads

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph K. N. is forty-three years old, married and a father with five children, who are currently all in school. He is a very hard working young man and artisan who designs and manufactures baking bowls for bread and trunks to store goods, etc. Joseph has been in this business for the past 20 years in the community market of Babiani, where he lives with his family.

Coal pots are used in many Ghanaians' homes as cooking burners are expensive to buy. Trunks are mostly purchased by parents who have their wards in the boarding house because it is safe and secure to keep your goods in them. Joseph said business is doing very well due to the strategic location he founds himself in the market but he is refusing to be complacent. Joseph is worried about the frequent increases in the price of raw materials retarding his business progress. However, he is convinced that with the loan he can buy stock of materials like steel, paints, rods, metals and others to increase his inventory. He believes this would help him even in the face of high prices in the cost of raw materials.

Joseph is pleading for your assistance to realize his dream for giving his children a better education for their future prospects. He also believes the loan would help him to buy machines for the cutting of the metals, to ease the stress he goes through. His picture was taken when he was selling one of his trunks made for his customer.

loans.use: Joseph wants the loan to buy materials like steel, paints, and brushes

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr: Née en 1949 à Lomé, Mme D. Mawuena est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes à charge. Malgré son age un peu avancé, elle est toujours très forte et active. Son petit commerce de bonbon, chocolat, chewing-gum, amuse gueule n’arrive plus à lui procurer les ressources nécessaires pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Pour agrandir son étalage et s’approvisionner en marchandises et renforcer son chiffre d’affaires, elle sollicite un financement. Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1949 in Lomé, Ms. Mawuena D. is married and a mother of five who has two others to support. Despite her rather advanced age, she is still very strong and active. Her small business selling candy, chocolate, chewing gum, and tasty treats is no longer able to bring in the necessary resources for supporting her family. For expanding her display of merchandise, getting supplies of goods, and boosting her sales figures, she is requesting financing. The profits will enable her to take better care of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of merchandise
